Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Covr Technologies is a leading, InsurTech venture capital-backed company, focused on using technology to simplify the buying process for life insurance and related products. As an innovator in a rapidly evolving industry, Covr is a technology-driven company that provides a simpler way for people to protect what matters most. Through partnerships with financial institutions and advisors, Covr's innovative digital platform provides the capability to research, compare and buy life insurance from top providers, fully online and within minutes. Our employees enjoy a casual dress code, flexible hours and progressive work environment. We have a strong culture based on our core values: Client First, Integrity, Innovation, Collaboration, Fun!




Overview




This candidate will be responsible for the key function of supporting Covr’s new business case status project, advisor database management and other projects involving key data. The role is responsible for reviewing the accuracy of the data from the various sources and ensuring that the data is accurately scrubbed and organized and available for reporting various sources. They will work closely with Covr’s operations and sales leaders and support Covr’s data engineering team who will be responsible for gathering the source data and producing the reporting tools used by the business.




Essential Job Functions, Duties, Performance Responsibilities




Review case status detail in each phase of the case; pre-sale inventory, application phase, carrier submitted phase, issue phase and inforce phase
Review advisor database information for accuracy and hierarchy assignments for each of our partner firms
Ensure the data is accurate and is reported in an accurate and timeout manner
Interface with the various sources of data to ensure feeds are received in an accurate and timely manner and maintained in a way consistent with company guidelines
Work with end users like partner firms, advisors, sales leaders, etc to make sure that the data is useful at the end point and ensure that the reporting formats and other communications like emails are accurate and usable




Experience




2+ years insurance experience
2+ years in Data Analysis and/or Excel
Strong analytic and Excel skills
Ability to work in various reporting and database systems with the help of others (eg powerBI, Snowflake, BMS, salesforce, etc)
Must be highly accurate and manage large amounts of data and multiple tasks.
Must be good communicator and work with many people.




Benefits




Full benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role




We are looking for an experienced analyst to dive deep into our data, work collaboratively across teams, and share insights. You will play a central role in bringing data to the forefront of all decisions and be an important data advisor at the launch of new initiatives. If you are a curious analyst with strong SQL, Python and business acumen, then we want to hear from you! This is an exciting role with varying responsibilities from analytics and reporting to light data engineering, data product, performance analysis, insight generation, and strategic recommendations. This is a full-time position.




What we do




Founded in 2015, ReUp Education is the only organization that focuses exclusively on helping colleges and universities engage and re-enroll the more than 40% of US students who have “stopped out” and support them until graduation, through our technology-enabled service. To date, we have re-enrolled nearly 22,500 students, assisted over 5,000 to graduate, and recaptured over $85 million in tuition for our university partners.




What you’ll do




Visualize key information through dashboards and reporting to allow teams to understand and use data to power daily decision-making.
Create reports to share performance, insights, and updates with client colleges, universities, and partners.
In partnership with both external partners and internal functions, develop research questions, conduct analyses, synthesize findings, and communicate recommendations that will help ReUp reach its goals.
Support all internal teams to become more data-driven in their work through developing tools, training, automating processes, and day-to-day support.
Support and lead validation efforts to ensure we have an accurate, scalable, stable data system.
Identify and lead opportunities to improve our data system and the ways we use data as a company.
Analyze client data in SQL, statistical languages, and BI tools like Tableau and Mode Analytics.




Qualifications




Research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups often only apply to jobs if they meet all of the qualifications. However, no one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. ReUp encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. We look forward to your application.
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Public Policy, Research, or quantitative focused study [or comparable experience in the field]
3-5 years of related work experience in data and analytics
Experience using data and analysis to communicate ideas and make recommendations
Ability to engage cross-functional audiences in conversations about analysis and data
Experience with at least one analytics / visualization tool such as Tableau and Mode Analytics
Highly analytical and quantitative with strong self discipline
Experience with statistical analysis techniques such as correlation and regression
Strong fluency in any of the following: SQL, Python, R, Stata
*SQL & Python preferred
Familiarity with post-secondary education data a plus
Familiarity with user analytics and/or marketing analytics a plus
Familiarity with machine learning, predictive modeling, and natural language processing a plus




What does success look like?




You are able to communicate complex ideas effectively
You proactively look for trends in data and provide actionable insights
Your attention to detail leaves no stone unturned
You can look across multiple data initiative and see themes that will help us support re-entry students and their educational outcomes
You have a passion to support data driven decisions while recognizing the humans behind the numbers




Compensation & Benefits




Compensation: $90,000-$100,000 commensurate with experience
Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; we pay 100% of the employee's premium and 50% of any dependents' premiums
Flexible time off and remote work opportunity
401(k) plan
A diverse team that fosters a high level of collaboration despite being highly distributed
We provide your choice of a Mac or PC laptop




Location




ReUp is a remote organization with a geographically distributed team. This position will be based remotely in one of the states listed: AL, AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, LA, MA, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, NH, NY, OH, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, and WI.




Company Culture




TEAMWORK * RESULTS * CONSTANT LEARNING * AGENCY * DIVERSITY, INCLUSION & EQUITY * JOY




ReUp employees share a passion for improving outcomes for stopout students. We connect with students to get Results as they embark on completing what they started. We believe in the power of human potential and that supporting an individual’s Agency acts as a catalyst for positive change and resiliency. We support Diversity, Inclusion & Equity, for both the students we work with and in our hiring practices. We value Teamwork and strive to create a safe and supportive environment where trust, communication, creativity, and humility are valued as highly as technical skills. We tackle hard problems with curiosity and take action towards continuous improvement and Constant Learning. Approaching our work with open hearts, open minds, and seeking collective success creates Joy. If that sounds like your dream work environment, we look forward to hearing from you.




ReUp Education is an equal opportunity employer. Our company values diversity and believes diverse teams make innovation possible. We encourage all qualified applicants from any race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or other characteristics to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Red Carrot is seeking an Analyst to join a team to support the Department of Homeland Security with measurement and evaluation products. This position is in the DC metro area.




Responsibilities




Plan, develop, and manage measurement and evaluation work
Provide evaluation design to include data collection recommendations
Provide recommendations for objectives and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Perform a variety of analyses required for the formulation, administration, and evaluation of a monitoring and evaluation system (A project monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system covers all the work carried out during or after a project to define, select, collect, analyze, and use information)
Provide measurement and evaluation of Government-Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) / Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) application evaluations and recommendations
Provide program analysis, Project Management MEL support, and program evaluation to include investigating the quality of programs
Provide process improvement with the ability to identify and recommend solutions to streamline processes and improve efficiency
Provide Strategic Communications Support for all measurement and evaluation work including briefings, presentations, and meeting management
To work on other duties as assigned




Qualifications




Must have at least a bachelor’s degree
Proven track record managing projects
Data-driven and focused on results
3+ years of experience in analysis
Strong writing, communication, and organizational skills
Proficient in Office 365
U.S. Citizenship and ability to obtain a security clearance




Employee Benefits




Top-tier medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
401(k) plan with company matching and profit-sharing
Paid time off and Federal Holidays
Tuition reimbursement for professional training




About Us




Red Carrot is an award-winning, woman-owned small business that is growing rapidly in the federal government space. Our team is fueled by passion, backed by intelligence, and built on expertise. From our inception, we have leveraged industrial engineering principles and data analytics to craft highly efficient solutions for clients’ complex needs. As we have grown, we remain focused on research-centric, data-informed, and audience-oriented, while expanding our range of expert capabilities.




Headquartered in Miami, Florida, we have a strong and continually growing presence in Washington, D.C., as well as team members and clients all over the country. We understand the importance of overcoming geographic limitations to provide the best, all-encompassing service to our clients. Red Carrot builds client capacity by implementing Strategic Communications, Customer Experience, Management Consulting, and Human Capital Solutions on behalf of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Engineer / Data Scientist

Job Type: Hybrid

Location: New York, NY




Staffing Opportunities Solutions Inc. is seeking a motivated, interdisciplinary individual who will be responsible for the development, implementation, data migration and performance of our client’s information architecture. With a clear focus on data analytics, attention to detail, and the ability to drive projects to completion is critical.




· Oversee data warehousing, integration, migration, ETL, and BI

· Responsible for Data Governance and Quality policies and procedures

· Promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals.

· Drive data centric decision making to enhance the data infrastructure to ensure data quality, accessibility, and security.

· Collaborate with data consumers, developers, security, and governance teams to implement solutions to answer complex questions.




Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data management, information systems, information science or a related quantitative field is required.

· 5+ years of experience creatively designing, developing, troubleshooting, and tuning/securing databases.

· 5+ years of direct experience in data management disciplines including: data integration, modeling, optimization, and data governance & quality.

· Strong experience with various languages and advanced analytics tools such as SQL, Python, PowerBI, Microsoft Azure and others.

· Excellent communication and troubleshooting skills.

· Superior problem-solving skills with a high attention to detail

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Career with Point72’s Office of the CIO

The Office of the Chief Investment Officer, led by co-CIO Harry Schwefel, supports the success of our long/short discretionary investment professionals, through oversight and portfolio construction analysis, talent development, operations management, and the continued advancement of the tools and resources available to our teams.

We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the Office of the CIO. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the data and reporting initiatives of the Co-Chief Investment Officer and ensuring that our Long/Short Equity Platform is making informed business decisions. You will be passionate about gathering, maintaining, visualizing, and generating insights from data.

What you’ll do

Create and maintain data tables and dashboards that allow key stakeholders to view data in a quick and concise manner, effectively communicate insights through visualizations
Collaborate with other members of the team to share best practices and develop new skills in data analytics
Design metrics, derive data-driven insights, and communicate findings in a concise manner to key stakeholders to help improve business performance
Partner with stakeholders across the long/short business to identify data needs and build reporting to inform business decisions
Design data models, ensure data quality, and automate processes where possible
Collaborate with technology partners to design tools to capture and structure data


What’s Required

An undergraduate degree (or above)
2+ years of experience in Excel, SQL, R and or Python
Finance and non-finance work experience welcome, but demonstrated work experience with data is a plus
Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills, with team members at varying levels of technical background
Excellent data visualization skills (Tableau, PowerBI, or software libraries in R or Python)
The ability to synthesize information quickly to provide an independent and objective viewpoint, propose appropriate solutions, and drive meaningful change
The ability to multitask and prioritize assignments while producing high quality work in a demanding, fast-paced environment
Self-motivated, mature, and eager to learn
Exceptional critical and analytical thinking ability
Commitment to the highest ethical standards


We take care of our people

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. When you work here, we provide:

Fully-paid health care benefits
Generous parental and family leave policies
Mental and physical wellness programs
Volunteer opportunities
Non-profit matching gift program
Support for employee-led affinity groups representing women, minorities and the LGBT+ community
Tuition assistance
A 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more


About Point72

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here

The annual base salary range is $130,000-160,000. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things. Details about eligibility for bonus compensation (if applicable) will be finalized at the time of offer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Under general supervision, this role's primary responsibility is performing data research and financial analysis to answer complex business questions. Develops timely, innovative, objective analysis and reporting, which leads to fact-based solutions for strategic business issues. Responsible for the Company's reporting, metrics, and KPIs.







Essential duties and responsibilities



Manage the full life cycle of analytical projects: interview business users; capture and document requirements; analyze and validate data needs; analyze data; design and develop any reporting solution; work with business users to determine the best plan of action and make process recommendations; manage the implementation; test and train users
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, focusing on trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Developing and preparing reports for various audience levels, from users to senior management, that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Defining new data collection and analysis processes as needed
Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then cleaning and reorganizing this data in a format that either human or machine within Department guidelines can easily read
Monitor for data accuracy, timeliness, and integrity in data used in analysis and reporting. Communicate to appropriate personnel if data inaccuracies exist. Responsible for testing systems enhancements and fixes
Manage individual projects as assigned to ensure adherence to schedule, quality, and accuracy of delivered results. Ensure follow-up so that analysis and reporting outcomes are reviewed and implemented
Learn and continue to gain business operations knowledge. Leverage this knowledge to recommend future projects

Secondary Functions



Perform other job-related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned

Qualifications/Requirements



Bachelor's Degree and at least 3 years of experience in a similar role OR High School Diploma/GED and at least 5 years of experience in a similar role.

Skills/Abilities



An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Proficiency in SQL and experience in Microsoft database technologies (SQL Server, T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS, MDX, etc.)
Experience in Power BI reporting development
Advanced skill in Excel includes macros, pivot tables, and advanced formatting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate findings to all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and with a team while executing independent decision-making abilities in a fast pace environment.
Strong interpersonal skills, problem-solving skills, and the ability to handle multiple demands and competing priorities
Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing problem-solving strategies
Experience with data extraction, data mining, data acquisition, data profiling, and data warehouse management
Experience in a data warehouse/business intelligence/decision support systems environment or IT experience
Knowledge of statistical concepts and data mining techniques
Any experience analyzing supply chain, production, warehouse execution, and/or financial data is a plus
Any experience with Infor M3 is a strong plus





This document does not state or imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

  • Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then cleaning and reorganizing this data in a format that either human or machine within Department guidelines can easily read
  • Monitor for data accuracy, timeliness, and integrity in data used in analysis and reporting. Communicate to appropriate personnel if data inaccuracies exist. Responsible for testing systems enhancements and fixes
  • Manage individual projects as assigned to ensure adherence to schedule, quality, and accuracy of delivered results. Ensure follow-up so that analysis and reporting outcomes are reviewed and implemented
  • Learn and continue to gain business operations knowledge. Leverage this knowledge to recommend future projects

Secondary Functions

  • Perform other job-related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned

Qualifications/Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree and at least 3 years of experience in a similar role OR High School Diploma/GED and at least 5 years of experience in a similar role.

Skills/Abilities

  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience in Microsoft database technologies (SQL Server, T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS, MDX, etc.)
  • Experience in Power BI reporting development
  • Advanced skill in Excel includes macros, pivot tables, and advanced formatting
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate findings to all levels of the organization
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and with a team while executing independent decision-making abilities in a fast pace environment.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, problem-solving skills, and the ability to handle multiple demands and competing priorities
  • Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing problem-solving strategies
  • Experience with data extraction, data mining, data acquisition, data profiling, and data warehouse management
  • Experience in a data warehouse/business intelligence/decision support systems environment or IT experience
  • Knowledge of statistical concepts and data mining techniques
  • Any experience analyzing supply chain, production, warehouse execution, and/or financial data is a plus
  • Any experience with Infor M3 is a strong plus



This document does not state or imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
JOIN THE GIBSON TEAM AND FIND YOUR EDGE!

As a 100% employee-owned organization, we are committed to creating world class service experiences for our customers through our high-performance client service teams. We’re passionate about our employee owners, which is why we utilize best practices; provide access high quality training, tools, and resources; and curate experiences that help them find and own their edge.

Our Core Values are lived in our business and our culture is fueled by them.

Create a Great Experience
Do the Right Thing
Play for Each Other
Pursue Growth
Own Your Future

This position possesses a keen attention to detail, can juggle multiple tasks on an ongoing basis and possesses excellent analytical skills. The Associate Data Analyst assists in preparing contribution modeling and monthly claims dashboards. This person is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of data from clients and carriers and works in conjunction with the Data Analytics team.




In this role, you will contribute to the team by:

Acquiring data from carrier resources for standard client reporting, ad-hoc analysis, and forecasting
Supporting the development of mid-year renewal projections
Populating monthly claims dashboards for self-funded and fully insured clients
Aggregating benefits benchmarking information to assist with client benefits decision making
Extracting utilization and clinical data to support strategy development from data warehouse
Preparing employee and employer cost modeling
Gathering data from multiple sources, reviewing for accuracy, and formatting for client and team use
Performing other duties and special projects as assigned




You may be a great fit for this role if you:

Love digging through data for patterns and trends
Have a knack for telling the story behind the data
Enjoy working “behind the scenes” to create client deliverables
Strong project management skills
Have a natural intellectual curiosity and enjoy complex problem solving
Thrive in a fast-paced environment working in a team structure




Required

Bachelor’s degree, with prior experience considered in lieu of a diploma
Indiana Health, Life, and Disability license or the ability to obtain the license within 3 months of employment
Advanced Excel Proficiency (Macros, Power Query, Complex Formulas, etc.)
Experience manipulating data and creating reports in tools like Tableau or PowerBI
Excellent computer, software and office machine skills and knowledge specifically with Microsoft products (Excel) and Tableau. Must have the ability to collect, analyze and interpret data from various sources in order to solve client problems

About Gibson:

We exist to pursue the best interests of our clients. And we do it together, sharing what we learn from client to client, moment to moment, and digging deeper to see things others can’t – or don’t bother to. That’s how we get to the proactive side of insurance, where our clients really gain their edge.




Here are some noteworthy facts about Gibson:




Founded in 1933
100% Employee-Owned
Business Insurance Top 100 U.S. Broker
Designated as one of the Best Places to Work
Locations in South Bend, IN, Fort Wayne, IN, Indianapolis, IN, Kalamazoo, MI, Phoenix, AZ
Great benefits!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst for a company in Suwanee, GA. The successful candidate will join a new enterprise analytics team focused on providing functional and technological capabilities to support business growth.







Responsibilities:







Collaborate with functional analysts and stakeholders to develop insight-driven analyses that add value to the business
Serve as a subject matter expert on the analytics technological ecosystem
Identify opportunities for productivity improvements through data process automation
Provide support for complex analyses and special projects as assigned
Advocate data literacy and analytics best practices
Develop dashboards and data workflows for enterprise solutions





Minimum Qualifications:







2 years of experience in an analyst role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency with SQL, data automation technology (e.g., Alteryx), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, ThoughtSpot or similar)
Demonstrated self-starter who proactively identifies new value-add opportunities





Preferred Qualifications:







4 to 6 years of experience in an analyst role
Experience with Data Governance practices and technology
Experience with SAP S/4 HANA and Salesforce
Experience with Distribution / Warehouse operations





The position offers a base pay between $76,800 and $105,600 per year at commencement of employment, with actual pay dependent on market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The company is an equal employment opportunity employer and adheres to federal law, verifying identity and eligibility to work in the United States.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST
REMOTE MUST BE IN WEST COAST/PACIFIC TIME ZONE



About Tillster
Tillster, headquartered in the USA, is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we have developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions – for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more – creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions.



Our mission and passion are one in the same: Empower restaurants and consumers to engage and transact anywhere, anytime, and from any device - one consumer at a time, one order at a time, billions of times over. In doing so, together we are transforming e-commerce in restaurants and make the till grow for Tillster and our customers.



About the Role
Tillster is seeking aData Analyst to help transform data from our services and existing reports and Tableau dashboards into consumable data Explores and Dashboards in our platform. You will play a crucial role in enabling Data Democratization inside Tillster and with our customers -- owning the implementation, improvement, and maintenance of our data products. This includes partnering and consulting with business teams to provide guidance and assistance in creating and streamlining Looker or equal style reports and underlying ETL pipelines.



What You’ll Do



Identify and implement new capabilities and best practices to develop and improve self-service and automated data analysis processes
Develop and update clear, high performing Explores and dashboards for business stakeholders such as Marketing, Product, Finance, Engineering, Account and Support/Operations
Create new Explores to enable non-technical analysts to access data, build dashboards, and solve critical business challenges on Looker technology.
Create new complex dimensions and measures for analysts to meet their business needs
Help create and maintain coding standards (style guides, etc.) and perform code reviews for other BI developers or technical analysts
Update production explores and dashboards to ensure consistent and accurate data as underlying data warehouse changes
Promote and ensure the use of a common semantic layer, data definitions, and metric calculations across all business areas.
Maintain Tillster Data infrastructure
Write SQL, build derived tables, and work with data engineering to ensure queries are performant, maintainable, and consuming cloud computing resources most efficiently
Ensure project: model: view structure is optimized to handle internal and external multi-tenant access and re-architect as needed for growing business use cases
Optimize performance through re-architecting as needed
Maintain existing data pipelines
Develop LookML in Looker.
Troubleshoot Jenkins orchestration jobs.
Modify SQL and Python code for ELT process to load data into Redshift.

About You



Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative area such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 1 years of experience in similar role
Excellent SQL skills
1 years of experience on AWS or Google cloud technologies (Redshift or BigQuery)
Mid to Advanced skills in Python, Looker and LookML
Knowledge of software development processes and best practices (code style guides, PR reviews, GitHub branch/merge processes, etc.)
1+ years’ experience in developing end to end business intelligence solutions, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques, and technology.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills (including ability to effectively use business tools such as Excel, Tableau, Looker) and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.
Proven track record of taking ownership and of driving outcomes in a fast-paced matrix environment; history of successfully delivering large scale projects in high-quality, managing the entire life cycle
Understanding of how to write readable code and documentation
Working knowledge of agile development processes

Preferred Skills



Development experience in Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, MicroStrategy or other BI tools.
Previous experience building scalable BI platforms, including the use of code review processes, automated testing, staging and production environments, and release schedules is preferred
Teaching/training/consulting experience
Work experience with R, Ruby, or JavaScript (D3)
Experience with Linux/OSX command line and git
Advanced degree in a quantitative area such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
Understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.), especially utilizing serverless technologies such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, etc.

The Interview Process



Recruiter interview with a Talent Acquisition Specialist
Interview with Data Analytics Team
Final interview with our VP Data

Making a Difference in the Tillster Way



Our business and product mission is to empower restaurants and consumers globally, by empowering, supporting, and nurturing the people who are part of the global Tillster team. We want to ensure all employees feel respected, confident, and engaged. Creating an inclusive working environment is of the utmost importance to us. To make this a reality, Tillster is dedicated to embracing diversity in all forms and is proudly an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, family/parental status, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status.







Pay and Benefits (USA)



Expected base salary range $80,000 - $100,000. Total starting compensation will be determined based on all lawful criteria, Company policy and best practices.
Equity: All employees within the U.S. are eligible to participate in the Stock Option Plan.
Health Benefits: All full-time, regular employees and their dependents are eligible for medical, dental, vision and FSA benefits. Additional health benefits include Healthcare and Dependent Care reimbursement programs, Employee Assistance Program (“EAP”) and Optum Care 24-hour confidential medical counseling services.
Holidays: The company observes ten (10) paid holidays per calendar year.
Paid Time Off (PTO): Full-time, regular employees earn 15 days of PTO in the first 12-months of continuous service, and 22 days in subsequent years. Eligible part-time employees earn pro-rated PTO.
Retirement: Effective with your employment start date, you will be eligible to participate in the 401(k) Plan.
Education, Learning & Development: We offer college tuition and education assistance programs; LinkedIn Learning courses; and ongoing learning and development opportunities.

Local Candidates Strongly Preferred



No Visa Sponsorship



Principals only – no Agencies or calls please

  • Development experience in Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, MicroStrategy or other BI tools.

  • Teaching/training/consulting experience
  • Work experience with R, Ruby, or JavaScript (D3)
  • Experience with Linux/OSX command line and git
  • Advanced degree in a quantitative area such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
  • Understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.), especially utilizing serverless technologies such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, etc.

  3. Final interview with our VP Data

Making a Difference in the Tillster Way

Our business and product mission is to empower restaurants and consumers globally, by empowering, supporting, and nurturing the people who are part of the global Tillster team. We want to ensure all employees feel respected, confident, and engaged. Creating an inclusive working environment is of the utmost importance to us. To make this a reality, Tillster is dedicated to embracing diversity in all forms and is proudly an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, family/parental status, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status.



Pay and Benefits (USA)

  • Expected base salary range $80,000 - $100,000. Total starting compensation will be determined based on all lawful criteria, Company policy and best practices.
  • Equity: All employees within the U.S. are eligible to participate in the Stock Option Plan.
  • Health Benefits: All full-time, regular employees and their dependents are eligible for medical, dental, vision and FSA benefits. Additional health benefits include Healthcare and Dependent Care reimbursement programs, Employee Assistance Program (“EAP”) and Optum Care 24-hour confidential medical counseling services.
  • Holidays: The company observes ten (10) paid holidays per calendar year.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
FUNCTIONAL DEFINITION




This Data Analyst position is assigned to the Allegheny County Department of Human Services (DHS), Office of Intellectual Disability (ODS). The Data Analyst will be responsible for ODS data collection, maintenance, and reporting. This individual will design data reports and databases to meet internal management needs and to represent the status of ODS administration of services and supports to external partners and stakeholders.




Duties And Responsibilities




Reporting and integrating data from multiple systems and sources, including but not limited to program eligibility and consumer demographics, support plans, assessments, service authorizations and utilization, incident management, and waiver capacity management.
Maintenance of internal ACCESS databases from HCSIS Extract source
Development of new databases to support and enhance business functions.
Tracking and problem-resolution of data integrity issues identified internally and as required by the State Office of Developmental Programs (ODP)
Providing relevant, specific, and current data to ODS teams to facilitate administration of services
Maintaining and reporting data relevant to performance indicators.
Maintaining and reporting data relevant to the ODS Quality Management Plan.
Maintaining and reporting data relevant to the State ODP monitoring of the Administrative Entity (QA&I)
Maintaining and reporting data relevant to ODS oversight of Supports Coordination and Provider functions
Technical assistance to ODS staff in collection and maintenance of data
Data analysis to support system change and quality improvement, including special projects to support ODS collaboration with other PA Counties and with the State ODP.




Skills And Knowledge




Ability to work in a team-oriented atmosphere.
Ability to be attentive to detail.
Strong demonstrated organizational skills.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication across all levels
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Access, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Working knowledge of internet research methods.
Ability to work at a high level of independence with minimal supervision.
Ability to interact with individuals on all organizational levels
Ability to work with people from a variety of diverse agencies, backgrounds, resources, and communities.
Ability to compile reports based on individualized and aggregate data
Ability to adapt to and learn new software products.




Essential Requirements




Possess Acts 33 and 34 clearances.
Have a valid Pennsylvania motor vehicle license, access to a personal vehicle, and have maximum auto insurance on an employee driven vehicle.
Strong data management and analysis skills
Expertise in ACCESS and Excel
Ability to work independently.
Full-time position requiring 38.75 hours per week.




Education And Experience




Bachelor’s degree in math, statistics, computer science or related subject and one year of experience in data collection, reporting and analysis or three years of experience in data collection, reporting and analysis. Preferred experience in project management and performance measurement.




Employee will report to




4550 McKnight Rd




Pittsburgh, PA 15237




Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are a Direct Mail and Email Marketing company. We acquire database lists and put them in a format for printing and mailing or emailing. We use Altryx and Excel. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Must be authorized to work in the US




100% Remote




Job Summary:




Support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Electronic Health Record Modernization Integration Office (EHRM-IO) program as Data Analyst to develop models to collect and review data and workflows to identify insight into EHR related issues. The role will also need to provide operational support for on-going priority action items for EHRM-IO leadership and help produce regular status reports, pivots, and data visualizations to demonstrate progress on items. The role will help with process flows and governance for priority items and help cross VA collaboration on items.




Minimum qualifications:




4+ years of professional work experience
Must possess knowledge of appropriate data sources to address the specific requirements of projects for monitoring, characterization, analysis, and modeling
Must perform scientific research, scientific writing, and editing, including the writing and editing of project products to established government standards for the targeted science and lay audiences, proofreading of draft and final documents
Able to work independently
Able to attend meetings and workshops to present on project work, participate in discussions
Master’s Degree in Healthcare, Science, Computer Engineering, or related scientific, technical, or clinical discipline, or an additional 8 years of relevant experience may be substituted for degree requirements




Preferred qualifications:




Experience with the VA
Experience implementing Electronic Health Records (EHRs)
Experience with government consulting
Experience with commercial EHRs
Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing data visualization and reports
Advanced Excel and Power BI experience
Work with client leadership to prioritize business and information needs




Benefits:




Retirement Plan  
Group Health Insurance (Health, Dental, and Vision) 
Paid Time Off 
Referral Bonus 
Opportunity for Performance Evaluation/Retention Bonus  




Compensation:  




Full-Time Direct Hire 
Compensation: $100,000-$120,000

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




We are CirrusLabs . Our vision is to become the world's most sought-after niche digital transformation company that helps customers realize value through innovation. Our mission is to co-create success with our customers, partners and community. Our goal is to enable employees to dream, grow and make things happen. We are committed to excellence. We are a dependable partner organization that delivers on commitments. We strive to maintain integrity with our employees and customers. Every action we take is driven by value. The core of who we are is through our well-knit teams and employees. You are the core of a values driven organization.




You have an entrepreneurial spirit. You enjoy working as a part of well-knit teams. You value the team over the individual. You welcome diversity at work and within the greater community. You aren't afraid to take risks. You appreciate a growth path with your leadership team that journeys how you can grow inside and outside of the organization. You thrive upon continuing education programs that your company sponsors to strengthen your skills and for you to become a thought leader ahead of the industry curve.




You are excited about creating change because your skills can help the greater good of every customer, industry and community. We are hiring a talented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. If you're excited to be part of a winning team, CirrusLabs ( http://www.cirruslabs.io ) is a great place to grow your career.




Job Description




R will be helpful but not required.




The contractor shall assist DSS and the Workforce Management. Division with reports and data analytics with a focus on:




Assisting the WMD team with receiving and managing requests for reports
Collecting and summarizing data from deployment tracking system.
Producing business intelligence reports via WMD's reporting mechanisms.
Distributing reports and providing customer support to end users.
Quality checking data and reports

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Coriell Institute for Medical Research is currently seeking an energetic and organized Data Analyst to join our IT team and successfully support a wide variety of projects in support of our biobanking operations. The successful applicant will merge, process, clean, validate and make available data and data reports collected for biobanking efforts at Coriell, including demographic data, clinical data, sample processing data, sample inventory data, and sample distribution data for thousands of participants.

The successful applicant will have 3-5 years of experience with data management, data cleaning, and data processing in a scientific environment. In particular, three years of SQL Server and R programming experience and experience in maintaining source code in code repository tools are desired. Experience with Shiny is a plus. Applicants should also have excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to interface with an interdisciplinary team of IT professionals, scientists, and support staff.

If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please email a cover letter and resume to careers@coriell.org. Please note, the cover letter must include a detailed description of your relevant experience as well as highlight your applicable background.

Founded in 1953, the Coriell Institute for Medical Research is a nonprofit research institute dedicated to improving human health through biomedical research. Coriell scientists lead research in personalized medicine, cancer biology, epigenetics, and the genomics of opioid use disorder. Coriell also hosts one of the world's leading biobanks—comprised of collections for the National Institutes of Health, disease foundations and private clients—and distributes biological samples and offers research and biobanking services to scientists around the globe. To facilitate drug discovery and disease study, the Institute also develops and distributes collections of induced pluripotent stem cells. To learn more, visit www.coriell.org. EOE

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Geode Capital Management is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to join the Data Operations Team. Your mission is to ensure our key data assets are ready for use by the entire firm on a daily basis. We are looking for someone with an “eye for quality and details”. We want someone with the managerial skills to triage issues as they arise, intuitively to ask the right questions, and execute a corrective course of action. We are looking for someone with excellent sleuthing skills to investigate issues to uncover root causes and work with resources across the firm to continually improve the data and our processes. We are looking for someone with the research and analysis skills to become the go-to experts on data sets. We want someone that can produce metrics and other analytical reports for Portfolio Management, Trading and other stakeholders. Are you great at producing visualizations? Designing dashboards? Critical to success are strong decision-making abilities, consensus building skills, and effective communication.




This is a hybrid work environment opportunity.




Who Are You?




Love data and don’t think it’s crazy to be madly passionate about it.
Appreciates the criticality of good, clean, data, that helps drive business impact.
Team player - willingness to help with any task needed for team success.
Clear communicator who can explain complex data problems in concise language.
Determined, curious, and industrious.
Thrives in a fast-paced environment where you roll out of bed excited to work that day.
Understands our business and sees how your work impacts the whole.




What Will You Do?




Serve as operational data steward for a set of data assets.
Validate the day-to-day readiness of data assets for use in the investment process.
Ask questions and look for anomalies. Identifying possible data issues is a high priority.
Be a problem solver. Triage issues and flag critical issues for escalation. Collaborate with colleagues to resolve issues.
Develop metrics, tests, reports/dashboards to evaluate and monitor data quality.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines. Identify ways to streamline our processes and automate standard maintenance.
Be curious. Develop your technical skills and expand the tool kit you use for data analysis.




Qualifications




BS/MS (Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related major).
Strong technical background and the ability to work independently.
Experience with SQL is also preferred.
Experience with various asset classes including equities, fixed-income securities, and derivatives.
Solid working knowledge of Excel or more sophisticated data analysis tools (Jupyter Notebooks, Tableau, etc).
High attention to detail and supreme quality, while balancing both practicality and value-creation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Nice To Have




Experience leveraging tools available from major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Hold yourself to a high standard of work. Be responsible, open, honest, and transparent. We value your contributions and believe that when we all work together, we create a better product




About Geode




Geode Capital Management, LLC (Geode) is a global systematic asset manager providing core beta exposures across a range of equity and niche asset classes, including commodities and options. Geode currently manages over $850 billion in AUM across registered funds and institutional managed accounts. Geode can offer institutional investors the essential building blocks for today’s changing investment landscape.




Geode is headquartered in Boston’s financial district, the center of one of the world’s most vibrant finance and technology hubs and employs approximately 180 employees and contractors. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and support diversified and hybrid work environment. Geode enhances the employee experience with a culture of engagement, wellness, diversity, equity, inclusion, and a focus on being environmentally conscious. Learn more about Geode at www.geodecapital.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced UX Data Analyst to join our team. As a UX Data Analyst, you will work closely with the UX team to analyze user data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to improve user experiences.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with UX team members to understand user behavior and develop research questions.
Design and execute quantitative and qualitative research studies.
Analyze user data and provide actionable insights to improve user experiences.
Communicate research findings to stakeholders and team members.
Help establish and maintain a UX research repository and knowledge base.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research methods and tools.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Statistics, or related field.
At least 3-5 years of experience in UX research and data analysis.
Strong portfolio showcasing experience in UX research and data analysis.
Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool (e.g., R, SPSS, Python, etc.).
Experience with SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Experience working in agile environments.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




This is a remote position for U.S. applicants only. To be considered, please include a link to your portfolio showcasing your best UX research and data analysis work. If you are a self-motivated and passionate UX Data Analyst looking to join a dynamic and innovative team, we encourage you to apply today.




Please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and skills. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking a technical data and reporting analyst that gathers, organizes, and reviews data from multiple information sources to develop, automate, analyze and present information on key performance metrics.




Maintains a meaningful set of metrics using data from central repository and other internal information sources.
Maintains process and pipeline to collect key data/metrics and compile into operational dashboards.
Communicates effectively with technical and business staff.
Develops reports and prepares and delivers both informational and decision-seeking presentations.
Maintains knowledge of company's computing and risk management environment and planned changes in order to develop meaningful measurements.
Monitors industry and marketplace technology practices and benchmarks related to IT environments. Stays abreast of technology innovations and trends.
Contributes to the achievement of team objectives.
Analytic mindset with high attention to detail.
Advanced expertise with Excel required.
Strong understanding of data modeling, data visualization and data storytelling; experience with reporting & visualization platforms like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Knowledge of data query tooling like Splunk is a plus .




Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or at least 5 years of equivalent work experience required. 2-3 years of related experience required; experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

KIPP Metro Atlanta Schools is part of the growing network of KIPP Public Schools. KIPP Public Schools is a national network of free, open enrollment, college-preparatory public schools dedicated to supporting all students to reach their highest aspirations. There are 270 KIPP schools across the nation serving more than 120,000students. Nationally, KIPP students have a 4X higher graduation rate than that of their peers.

KIPP Metro Atlanta currently operates eleven KIPP schools including four primary schools, five middle schools, one K-8 school, and one high school, as well as the KIPP Forward program which supports students through college, career, and beyond.

Job Description

KIPP Metro Atlanta's Support Team is seeking a Data Analyst to support the creation and maintenance of the regional data analysis, reporting, and use strategy. The Data Analyst will manage, analyze, and report on school-level and regional data from various sources (e.g., academic, operations, demographic, etc.) pertinent to the regional strategic plan. The Data Analyst will support implementation of organizational data strategies around driving decision-making and instructional practices through analyses and capacity building.

As a Data Analyst, your core responsibilities include:

Data Analysis, Application, and Action

Design, implement, and monitor the use of real-time data reports and dashboards (e.g., Tableau reports) to support strategic decisions at the regional and school-level. Seek feedback from teammates and end users to improve the product. Provide training and coaching on using reports and dashboards
Collaborate with the broader Data Team to define regional data analysis and reporting plan and deliverables
Conduct descriptive and predictive analytical work on outputs from KIPP Metro Atlanta’s student information system, student assessments, teacher evaluations, and other organizational data platforms
Translate data into relevant insights and implications and support stakeholders on interpreting findings. Tailor the complexity of analysis appropriately to audiences with various data literacy skills (e.g., regional team, principals, teachers, Board members, funders, etc.) Anticipate and empathize with stakeholder reactions
Assist with mentoring school and organizational leaders on using data to improve instructional planning and drive student achievement
Regularly monitor key metrics and report significant changes or trends
Support implementation of a central access point for most relevant data reports and dashboards and ensure functionality of reports within the access solution
Develop and maintain documentation of data analysis and synthesis methods and processes
Maintain an in-depth knowledge of all regionally standardized data sources and systems, being constantly aware of new updates and incorporating changes into analytical approach and data visualizations
Execute on external and internal data requests related to student or staff information and other relevant school-level or student-level data


Data Strategy

Build and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders in order to encourage questions and surface opportunities to provide support
Seek opportunities to increase stakeholder ability to use data. Help to plan for and lead the training of school and regional staff on using data systems and interpreting data reports
Work with teammates to analyze current and future data needs of teams and departments
Participate in planning a data strategy to meet needs of stakeholders across the organization
Participate in a cross-functional data/analytics/compliance team that enables and expedites the gathering, processing, and acting on relevant evidence from all parts of the organization
Manage stakeholder expectations around data availability for regional rollups and comparisons
Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data.
Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams.
Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.


Data Management and Support

Collaborate with other Data Team members to develop and maintain data warehouse of all relevant data sources
Develop an understanding of KIPP Metro Atlanta’s data model and systems integration processes to enable tool building and data quality investigations
Maintain and troubleshoot the integrity of data linkages between data source systems and data warehouse


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum of 5 years relevant experience, preferably in the education or non-profit fields
Strong project management skills
Robust quantitative and analytical skills, including experience working with large data sets to derive insights
Knowledge of the education field, including familiarity with current student data systems (e.g., student information systems such as Infinite Campus and/or SchoolPlus, assessment platforms such as Illuminate Education and NWEA MAP, behavior platforms such as Kickboard and LiveSchool, etc.) and relevant data sets (e.g., demographics student achievement data, attendance/behavior, etc.)
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word); advanced skills with Excel
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation tools (i.e., Tableau)
Experience training and communicating data and analytics products to audiences of varying levels of expertise
Experience programming in data analysis languages and/or software (e.g., SQL, R, Stata, SPSS).
Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills and ability to build meaningful relationships
Ability to convey information in a way that is strategic, honest, timeline, and respectful
Team-player capable of working both collaboratively and independently
Flexible and strong ability to multi-task and prioritize
Thrives in an entrepreneurial start-up environment and working conditions; can work within an ambiguous, fast-moving environment while also driving toward clarity and solutions
Self-starter with demonstrated resourcefulness
Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the mission of KIPP Metro Atlanta
Data Prep, Alteryx, Trifacta
Knowledge of database structure systems and data mining.


Additional Information

Compensation:

We offer a competitive salary that depends on prior experience, as well as a benefits package including

Healthcare (medical, vision, and dental)
Life and Long-term Disability
Additional Voluntary Supplemental Insurance
Enrollment in the Teachers Retirement System of Georgia (mandatory for all employees)


Statement of Non-Discrimination:

KIPP Metro Atlanta is committed to a policy of equal treatment for all individuals applying to the school. KIPP Metro Atlanta does not discriminate based on race, color, gender, handicap, age, religion, sexual orientation, or national or ethnic origin.

Tailor the complexity of analysis appropriately to audiences with various data literacy skills (e.g., regional team, principals, teachers, Board members, funders, etc.) Anticipate and empathize with stakeholder reactions
  • Assist with mentoring school and organizational leaders on using data to improve instructional planning and drive student achievement
  • Regularly monitor key metrics and report significant changes or trends
  • Support implementation of a central access point for most relevant data reports and dashboards and ensure functionality of reports within the access solution
  • Develop and maintain documentation of data analysis and synthesis methods and processes
  • Maintain an in-depth knowledge of all regionally standardized data sources and systems, being constantly aware of new updates and incorporating changes into analytical approach and data visualizations
  • Execute on external and internal data requests related to student or staff information and other relevant school-level or student-level data

Data Strategy
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders in order to encourage questions and surface opportunities to provide support
  • Seek opportunities to increase stakeholder ability to use data. Help to plan for and lead the training of school and regional staff on using data systems and interpreting data reports
  • Work with teammates to analyze current and future data needs of teams and departments
  • Participate in planning a data strategy to meet needs of stakeholders across the organization
  • Participate in a cross-functional data/analytics/compliance team that enables and expedites the gathering, processing, and acting on relevant evidence from all parts of the organization
  • Manage stakeholder expectations around data availability for regional rollups and comparisons
  • Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data.
  • Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams.
  • Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.

Data Management and Support
  • Collaborate with other Data Team members to develop and maintain data warehouse of all relevant data sources
  • Develop an understanding of KIPP Metro Atlanta’s data model and systems integration processes to enable tool building and data quality investigations
  • Maintain and troubleshoot the integrity of data linkages between data source systems and data warehouse

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Minimum of 5 years relevant experience, preferably in the education or non-profit fields
  • Strong project management skills
  • Robust quantitative and analytical skills, including experience working with large data sets to derive insights
  • Knowledge of the education field, including familiarity with current student data systems (e.g., student information systems such as Infinite Campus and/or SchoolPlus, assessment platforms such as Illuminate Education and NWEA MAP, behavior platforms such as Kickboard and LiveSchool, etc.) and relevant data sets (e.g., demographics student achievement data, attendance/behavior, etc.)
  • In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word); advanced skills with Excel
  • Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation tools (i.e., Tableau)
  • Experience training and communicating data and analytics products to audiences of varying levels of expertise
  • Experience programming in data analysis languages and/or software (e.g., SQL, R, Stata, SPSS).
  • Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills and ability to build meaningful relationships
  • Ability to convey information in a way that is strategic, honest, timeline, and respectful
  • Team-player capable of working both collaboratively and independently
  • Flexible and strong ability to multi-task and prioritize
  • Thrives in an entrepreneurial start-up environment and working conditions; can work within an ambiguous, fast-moving environment while also driving toward clarity and solutions
  • Self-starter with demonstrated resourcefulness
  • Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the mission of KIPP Metro Atlanta
  • Data Prep, Alteryx, Trifacta
  • Knowledge of database structure systems and data mining.

Additional Information

Compensation:

We offer a competitive salary that depends on prior experience, as well as a benefits package including
  • Healthcare (medical, vision, and dental)
  • Life and Long-term Disability
  • Additional Voluntary Supplemental Insurance
  • Enrollment in the Teachers Retirement System of Georgia (mandatory for all employees)

Statement of Non-Discrimination:

KIPP Metro Atlanta is committed to a policy of equal treatment for all individuals applying to the school. KIPP Metro Atlanta does not discriminate based on race, color, gender, handicap, age, religion, sexual orientation, or national or ethnic origin.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role : Data Analyst I

Location : 100% Remote

Duration : 4+ months (Possible Extension)

Description:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for design, build, and iterating processes that help our organization with data visualizations for Sales, Finance, Operations and other critical data from various data systems (ERP, CRM, Marketing etc). Work will require exceptional attention to details in accuracy, performance, and alignment with organization priorities.

Motorola Fixed Video provides trusted security solutions to the global market. This division of Client comprises the Pelco, Multi-Sight, IndigoVision, and Avigilon brands. Together, we design, develop, and manufacture video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions. Avigilon’s solutions have been installed at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers.




Position Overview:

Client Fixed Video is seeking a Data Analyst to tell compelling data stories to drive better business decisions by helping us become customer obsessed. This role will help us achieve our goal of transforming data into a strategic enterprise asset that is shared, accessible, trusted, stewarded and secure. We want to grow and we need your help. For the right candidate there will also be opportunities to build machine learning products.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate a passion for asking questions and answering them with data stories, led by compelling visualizations that help drive business decisions keeping the customer experience at the forefront.




Responsibilities:

Translate complex, technical information into simple, engaging visuals that a less-technical audience will easily understand and use for actionable insights

Provide input on topics like data access, data ingestion, data transformation, database design and implementation

Developing a deep understanding of the business, its data, its patterns and our customers.

Working with data engineers to ensure we have the necessary data sources available to produce these insights.

Creating and communicating in-depth, precise reports, and work with the business to define and surface relevant KPIs

Ensure the validity and action ability of the data gathered and results surfaced to ensure they are be tied to customer and business outcomes




Skills:

Proficiency in SQL and can independently mine data to translate business data needs into creative and actionable visualizations. Python coding a plus

Expertise is the design and development of Tableau dashboards, reports and front-end visualizations and analysis with ability to tell stories with data

Experience with various types of data repositories (e.g., data warehouses, data lakes, data marts), master data management, and ETL/integration

Technical aptitude with Google Suite, Salesforce and broad awareness of other analytical tools

Experience in SaaS sales industry or a subscription based sales a plus




Qualifications:

Undergraduate Degree in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field

2+ years of experience with Tableau, Salesforce, Power BI or related tool

2+ years of experience in visual reporting development, including hands-on development of analytics dashboards and working with complex data sets

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary




The Jr. Data Analyst will be responsible for gathering data from relevant sources, organizing and cleaning it to identify, analyze, and interpret trends, using statistical and data science techniques.




Responsibilities




The primary responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:




Create reports for internal and/or external clients.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data.
Create data visualizations and dashboards.
Structure large data sets to find usable information.
Work with the team of analysts and other associates to process information.
Create presentations and reports based on findings.




Qualifications




A bachelor’s degree in a field such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, data science, or related areas.
Knowledge of a programming language used for data analysis. Python is desirable.
Some experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Some knowledge of statistics.
Strong problem-solving skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate effectively.
Strong communication skills and ability to report findings.




Nice To Have




Knowledge of Machine Learning.
Knowledge of SQL.




Compensation And Perks




Competitive salary.




Robust employee benefits package including major medical (currently 80% Employer covered for employee and approximately 56-66% Employer covered for dependents depending upon which Cigna plan you choose), dental, vision, long-term disability (100% employer covered), supplemental plans, HSA, FSA, pet insurance, legal discount plan, and more.
401k plan with company match.
Growth and development opportunities.
Your holistic wellness matters to us. We have a year-round wellness calendar of events, a corporate wellness coach and personal trainer who manages our wellness program throughout the year, fitness classes, fitness challenges, and an employee assistance program for employees and their family members.
Employee discount program.
PTO, holidays, birthdays, and volunteer time off.




Company Overview




Since 1997, AlphaStaff has delivered HR outsourcing solutions to thousands of small and medium-sized businesses across the country, as well as some large organizations. AlphaStaff is majority-owned by its management team, giving it the freedom to invest in its employees and client relationships to drive long-term value. With a dynamic and adaptable approach, we are constantly finding the best solutions to meet our clients’ needs. We help our clients improve talent management, compliance, employee benefits, and HR technology by creating tailored solutions. Our experienced leadership team is comprised of thought leaders in the human capital management and insurance sectors. We are constantly looking for “athletes” – driven and passionate individuals, to join our dynamic team. Our company culture emphasizes diversity and a collaborative environment where everyone’s opinion is valued. As one team, we have one mission: to create Raving Fans with every interaction as we help our clients solve day-to-day human capital challenges better, faster, smarter.




Disclaimers: AlphaStaff, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, past or present military service, disability, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. AlphaStaff, Inc. also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. To help ensure a safe, healthy, and productive work environment for our employees and others, to protect company property, and to ensure efficient operations, AlphaStaff, Inc. has adopted a policy of maintaining a workplace free of drugs and alcohol. Employees and applicants may be requested to submit to drug and alcohol testing in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking a technical data and reporting analyst that gathers, organizes, and reviews data from multiple information sources to develop, automate, analyze and present information on key performance metrics.




Maintains a meaningful set of metrics using data from central repository and other internal information sources.
Maintains process and pipeline to collect key data/metrics and compile into operational dashboards.
Communicates effectively with technical and business staff.
Develops reports and prepares and delivers both informational and decision-seeking presentations.
Maintains knowledge of company's computing and risk management environment and planned changes in order to develop meaningful measurements.
Monitors industry and marketplace technology practices and benchmarks related to IT environments. Stays abreast of technology innovations and trends.
Contributes to the achievement of team objectives.
Analytic mindset with high attention to detail.
Advanced expertise with Excel required.
Strong understanding of data modeling, data visualization and data storytelling; experience with reporting & visualization platforms like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Knowledge of data query tooling like Splunk is a plus .




Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or at least 5 years of equivalent work experience required. 2-3 years of related experience required; experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Aeropay

Aeropay is a rapidly-growing financial technology company based in Chicago, IL. With Aeropay, businesses can offer a convenient and contactless digital payment option to their customers. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team.

Job Description

The ideal candidate will use their passion for data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

You Will Make An Impact By

Understand the day-to-day complications that our business faces, which can be better answered with data
Compile and analyze data related to business questions
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Automating data and analytic solutions at scale

Qualifications

Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer or Statistics or Applied Mathematics or related field (or equivalent experience)
Strong organizational skills, a strong sense of ownership and accountability, the ability to communicate effectively, and be a self-starter
Proficient in SQL

You will sweep us off our feet if..

You are a storyteller using data
You have experience solving new problems - digging in and finding answers
You have experience working in multiple business areas / functions / segments
You have a strong understanding of statistics with applied experience on analyzing large data sets
You can collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
You have strong skills in Python, SQL,
You have hands on experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau,
You can work effectively with internal stakeholders, including data scientists and data engineers
You have experience driving understanding of customers and their interaction with products, through in-depth analysis of user behavior and engagement

Learn more at https://aeropay.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced UX Data Analyst to join our team. As a UX Data Analyst, you will work closely with the UX team to analyze user data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to improve user experiences.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with UX team members to understand user behavior and develop research questions.
Design and execute quantitative and qualitative research studies.
Analyze user data and provide actionable insights to improve user experiences.
Communicate research findings to stakeholders and team members.
Help establish and maintain a UX research repository and knowledge base.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research methods and tools.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Statistics, or related field.
At least 3-5 years of experience in UX research and data analysis.
Strong portfolio showcasing experience in UX research and data analysis.
Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool (e.g., R, SPSS, Python, etc.).
Experience with SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Experience working in agile environments.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




This is a remote position for U.S. applicants only. To be considered, please include a link to your portfolio showcasing your best UX research and data analysis work. If you are a self-motivated and passionate UX Data Analyst looking to join a dynamic and innovative team, we encourage you to apply today.




Please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and skills. We look forward to hearing from you!
