Title: Senior Analyst, Campaign Analytics & Insights- EN
Description:
TD Description




Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.




Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com




Department Overview




Department Overview




The Marketing Delivery team is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.




The Marketing Delivery team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.




The Marketing Delivery team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.




Job Description




The successful candidate will be responsible for Campaign Analytics within the broader Marketing Analytics group. If you are driven by understanding data and how we can help our LOB reach the best customers and continuing to challenge the "status quo" to make our campaigns and processes better, then this is the role for you.




Success In This Role Will Be Achieved By




Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI
Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence
Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting
Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting
Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.




Responsibilities




Design/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments
Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
Execute with excellence
Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure




Job Requirements




Required Skillset




Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)
Good knowledge of everyday banking products and transactions; Mutual Funds, Investment Products, Savings, GICs and registered banking products
Technical and detail oriented
Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as Unica, SAS, SQL and/or Python/Pyspark
A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications
Team player while able to work independently
Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts
A profit driven mindset




Job Requirements




1-2+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)
Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica)
Knowledge of SQL, Python/PySpark; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements
Experience designing and executing successful direct marketing experiments, including channel, A/B, Creative/Copy test etc…
Familiarity with concepts such as "next best offer" and "always-on" an asset
Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline
Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget




Inclusiveness




At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analyst Data Strategy - Express Scripts Canada
Description:
The Business Analyst Data Strategy will support the development of a self-service reporting tool. In this role you will facilitate the identification and documentation of detailed user stories (functional requirements), process and system flows and contribute to the overall user experience, technical solution and acceptance criteria for our Book of Business solutions portfolio. The Business Analyst will work closely with the business to define how best to address business challenges faced by our customers and our internal operations, including non-functional requirements and technical constraints. The Business Analyst will work with the development team to assure the quality of deliverables ensuring that developed products are fit for use, supportable and maintainable.




Key Responsibilities




Elicit new reporting requirements from clients x; often requiring hands on investigation of existing technical processes, SQL reports and databases
Work on agile Scrum/Kanban teams in the role of Business Analyst to identify, document, and refine user stories, capture acceptance criteria, assumptions, constraints, dependencies.
Identify Business Rules and Data Elements associated with user stories
Investigate and assist the development team in troubleshooting incidents and problems in our systems (Adjudication, Billing, Reporting and other services and data integration issues across all the integration points)
Assists with system and related process documentation including workflow processes




Qualifications




Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3 years of experience working in Information Systems
Experience in Agile Methods (Scrum/Kanban) in a team that builds products that successfully achieve intended user outcomes
Excellent written & communication skills, including the ability to follow standards and methodology
Very strong problem solving skills with a desire to understand
Strong customer focus, adaptability, flexibility and willingness to learn
Ability to prioritize work load and meet multiple project deadlines
Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make decisions with assistance from senior staff
Willingness to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines
Experience working with software development teams




Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required




Background in data analytics e.g. reporting, development of data warehouse or business intelligence solutions
Familiar with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Working knowledge of SQL and Jira
Knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices
Strong process orientation (ITIL considered bonus)
Experience with Agile development process




Nice To Have Skills




Knowledge of PBM (Pharmacy Benefits Management) or similar claims adjudication systems
Experience with QA or user acceptance testing (experience specific to data considered a bonus)
Agile certifications




NOTE: Internal posting will be closed on March 17, 2023.




Express Scripts Canada Is a Cigna Company




Express Scripts Canada is a subsidiary of Express Scripts, a Cigna company. Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, wellbeing and peace of mind of those we serve. Cigna offers an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioural health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products.




About Express Scripts Canada




Express Scripts Canada is a leading health benefits manager and has been recognized as one of the most innovative. Our clients include Canada's leading insurers, third party administrators and governments. We work with these clients to develop industry-leading solutions to deliver superior healthcare in a cost-controlled environment. We provide Active Pharmacy™ services to more than 7 million Canadian patients and adjudicate more than 100 million pharmacy, dental, and extended health claims annually. Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.




It will be a condition of employment that the successful candidate obtains an Enhanced Reliability Clearance from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to provide supporting documentation to receive clearance if required.




We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a positive work environment built on solid corporate values, integrity, mutual respect, collaboration, passion, service and alignment.




We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace. By embracing diversity, we build a more effective organization that empowers our employees to be the best that they can be.




We are committed to creating a working environment that is barrier-free and we are prepared to provide accommodation for people with disabilities.




If you require accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: eschr2@express-scripts.com Do not email eschr2@express-scripts.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

  • Familiar with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Working knowledge of SQL and Jira
  • Knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices
  • Strong process orientation (ITIL considered bonus)
  • Experience with Agile development process


Nice To Have Skills


  • Knowledge of PBM (Pharmacy Benefits Management) or similar claims adjudication systems
  • Experience with QA or user acceptance testing (experience specific to data considered a bonus)
  • Agile certifications


NOTE: Internal posting will be closed on March 17, 2023.


Express Scripts Canada Is a Cigna Company


Express Scripts Canada is a subsidiary of Express Scripts, a Cigna company. Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, wellbeing and peace of mind of those we serve. Cigna offers an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioural health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products.


About Express Scripts Canada


Express Scripts Canada is a leading health benefits manager and has been recognized as one of the most innovative. Our clients include Canada's leading insurers, third party administrators and governments. We work with these clients to develop industry-leading solutions to deliver superior healthcare in a cost-controlled environment. We provide Active Pharmacy™ services to more than 7 million Canadian patients and adjudicate more than 100 million pharmacy, dental, and extended health claims annually. Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.


It will be a condition of employment that the successful candidate obtains an Enhanced Reliability Clearance from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to provide supporting documentation to receive clearance if required.


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a positive work environment built on solid corporate values, integrity, mutual respect, collaboration, passion, service and alignment.


We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace. By embracing diversity, we build a more effective organization that empowers our employees to be the best that they can be.


We are committed to creating a working environment that is barrier-free and we are prepared to provide accommodation for people with disabilities.


If you require accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: eschr2@express-scripts.com Do not email eschr2@express-scripts.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Title: Information Management Analyst
HTML:
Data. Discovery. Better Health.

ICES is a world-leading health research and analytics institute. With a wealth of data and analytic expertise, we create trusted evidence that has changed health policy and practice and helps ensure better health for all.

Ready to discover more with us? Join our outstanding, collaborative team where your skills, knowledge and curiosity are valued and can change the future of health care.


At ICES, we recognize what matters most to our employees. Some of the great benefits of working at ICES include:

  • Flexible remote work arrangements anywhere in Ontario
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Comprehensive Benefits Program
  • HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
  • Employee Assistance Program and Dialogue Well Being Program
  • Generous vacation, float and caregiver days for all employees
  • Education Fund and Dedicated Education Days
  • Holiday Closure
  • Perkopolis Employee Discount Program


Introduction:


Reporting to the Manager, Information Management, the Information Management Analyst is responsible for the import and maintenance of large health services data sets in a SAS/LNIX environment under stringent confidentiality and security guidelines. The Information Management Analyst will convert the administrative data to SAS datasets, perform data cleaning and validation activities, document data characteristics, and conduct routine implementation of ICES data destruction policy. The Information Management Analyst will assume data management and data processing responsibilities of ICES research projects. She/He will demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of specific ICES Data Holdings and ICES’ privacy, confidentiality and security policies and guidelines.



Responsibilities of the position include, but may not be limited to:


  1. Encode any direct personal identifiers as it arrives at ICES as the first use;
  2. Develop and process SAS programs to convert ICES data files to SAS datasets;
  3. Act as an ICES Data Covenanter;
  4. Perform data cleaning and validation activities, documentation of data characteristics according to data standards and guidelines;
  5. Perform electronic archiving of specific ICES databases;
  6. Carry out data destruction following ICES data destruction policy;
  7. Receive data collected in ICES primary data collection projects and prepares for the ICES research environment (LNIX);
  8. Perform ad-hoc data transferring requests;
  9. Communicate with Technology department, Research Program Managers, and/or Project Managers to solve data issues;
  10. Communicate with ICES data providers as necessary;
  11. Other duties as may be assigned within the scope of this position.


Knowledge, skills and abilities required:


  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Biostatistics, or related field.
  • 2 years of related work experience;
  • Working knowledge of principles of computer systems architecture, database design and record linkage methodology.
  • Good SAS programming skills;
  • Excellent understanding of the concepts of data privacy, confidentiality and security practices;
  • Understanding of the LNIX operating system for data security management practices, ICES Primary Data Collection Utility and how to use administrative data in health services research is an asset;
  • Good organizational skills;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.


Security clearance may be required.


Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter detailing how their knowledge, skills and abilities match the scope of this position.


We thank all applicants for their interest in working at ICES. Due to the volume of applications received, only applicants being considered for the position will be contacted for further discussions.


ICES is committed to providing accessible employment practices, in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Applicants are asked to make accommodation requests to ICES and we will make every effort to ensure that accommodation requests are met throughout the recruitment process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Arobas Personnel is looking for a Data Engineer for a contract at one of its clients located in Mississauga.

*Remote : Hybrid-Mode – 3 days/week*

The 3 Super-powers Required

Super-Power 1 : Hadoop Developer
Super-Power 2 : Knowledge about GCP and Cloud native solutions
Super-Power 3 : Analyst Business Intelligence

What does your day to day look like?

Participate in all aspects of Big Data solution delivery life cycle including analysis, design, development, testing, production deployment, and support
Develop standardized practices for delivering new products and capabilities using Big Data technologies, including data acquisition, transformation, and analysis
Ensure Big Data practices integrate into overall data architectures and data management principles (e.g. data governance, data security, metadata, data quality)
Create formal written deliverables and other documentation, and ensure designs, code, and documentation are aligned with enterprise direction, principles, and standards
Train and mentor teams in the use of the fundamental components in the Hadoop stack
Assist in the development of comprehensive and strategic business cases used at management and executive levels for funding and scoping decisions on Big Data solutions
Troubleshoot production issues within the Hadoop environment
Performance tuning of a Hadoop processes and applications

What we’re looking for?

Bachelor in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Computer Information Systems is required.
Minimum of 4 years of Building Java apps
Minimum of 2 years of building and coding applications using Hadoop components - HDFS, Hive, Impala, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, StreamSets, HBase, etc.
Minimum of 2 years of coding Scala / Spark, Spark Streaming, Java, Python, HiveQL
Minimum 4 years understanding of traditional ETL tools & Data Warehousing architecture.
Proven experience as a Hadoop Developer/Analyst in Business Intelligence
Strong communication, technology awareness and capability to interact work with senior technology leaders is a must
Good knowledge on Agile Methodology and the Scrum process
Delivery of high-quality work, on time and with little supervision
Critical Thinking/Analytic abilities
Strong personal leadership and collaborative skills, combined with comprehensive, practical experience and knowledge in end-to-end delivery of Big Data solutions.
Experience in Exadata and other RDBMS is a plus.
Must be proficient in SQL/HiveQL
Hands on expertise in Linux/Unix and scripting skills are required.
Strong in-memory database and Apache Hadoop distribution knowledge (e.g. HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, Pig, Flume, Oozie, Spark)
Past experience using Maven, Git, Jenkins, Se, Ansible or other continuous integration tools is a plus
Proficiency with SQL, NoSQL, relational database design and methods
Deep understanding of techniques used in creating and serving schemas at the
Identify requirements to apply design patterns like self-documenting data vs. schema-on-read.
Played a leading role in the delivery of multiple end-to-end projects using Hadoop as the data platform.
Successful track record in solution development and growing technology partnerships
Ability to clearly communicate complex technical ideas, regardless of the technical capacity of the audience.
Strong inter-personal and communication skills including written, verbal, and technology illustrations.
Experience working with multiple clients and projects at a time.
Knowledge of predictive analytics techniques (e.g. predictive modeling, statistical programming, machine learning, data mining, data visualization).
Familiarity with different development methodologies (e.g. waterfall, agile, XP, scrum).
Demonstrated capability with business development in big data infrastructure business
Bilingual (French/English) who has the capacity to adapt his communication to most of the situations and audience. Proficient in planning his communications, facilitating a meeting or workshop;
Able to proactively plan his/her work over multiple timeframes – week-months-year and juggle multiple priorities and deliver as per commitments;
Able to plan and execute complex tasks without supervision, identify potential roadblocks and mobilise resources to remove them and achieve goals;
Able to identify and analyze complex problem, identify root cause, provide detailed description and plan, design and deliver workaround/solution;
Capable to evaluate without supervision the effort & time required to complete a deliverable and/or task thru collaboration, teamwork, honesty, commitment and respect;
Comfortable interviewing non-technical people to gather/discuss requirements;
Gets easily acquainted to new technologies e.g. programming language within 2-3 days;
Wireless/Telecom Operations and Engineering business Knowledge including basic understanding of Radio access, Core network and Value added Services technologies and configurations.

Our client is looking for a motivated individual who is trying to take the next step in their career to join their statistics department. This opportunity is also 100% remote but there is also a physical office in Toronto. If this sounds appealing to you, apply now!

Title: Power Automate Developer [Remote]
Description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $40 – $60/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Long term


THE OPPORTUNITY

Our client is a technology consulting company based out of Chicago, IL. Their mission is to increase efficiency, reduce cost and scale businesses in the professional services industries through customizing technology and automating processes. They do this through consulting, implementation and maintenance. They have experience with customizing and automating a variety of technology solutions including Microsoft Office 365 as well as connect with other applications using API’s.

They believe in building meaningful relationships, sharing their knowledge and creating opportunities for underrepresented communities. As a minority and first-generation American owned business, they are a proud equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce and encourage women and people of color to apply.

What They Offer:

Working with a diverse team
Flexible work schedule and work life balance
Ability to work remotely from anywhere
Hands-on experience with new technologies
Exposure to all parts of the business
Working closely with the leadership team
Mentorship and growth opportunities
Ability to have direct and meaningful impact on the business


What They Look For:

Creative problem solvers
Integrity and taking pride in your work
Self-starters with an entrepreneurial mindset
Team-oriented, communicative and open-minded
Comfortable giving and receiving feedback
Genuine interest in learning, growth and team building
Flexible and can keep up with a shifting fast-paced environment


What You'll Be Doing:

As a Power Automate Developer, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, testing and maintaining custom business apps and custom automation for wide-ranging clients using the Microsoft Power Platform. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Learning and understanding the list of Power Automate Flows that make up a particular solution
Implementing automation solutions and workflows through gathering requirements
Update flows to meet changing requirements
Documenting processes and developing, testing, and deploying solutions using the Power Platform
Understanding SharePoint


Job Requirements:
3+ years of working on Power Automate
Experience in Power Platforms
Custom connectors
RPA
AI Builder
Solutions
Gateways
Experience with RESTful web services
OAuth 2.0 understanding
SharePoint Online, Graph API, Automated Deployments, PowerShell, SQL
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps are a plus
Experience in
Project Management Tools (i.e. ClickUp)
Agile Methodology
Power Virtual Agent is a plus
Power Apps is a plus
Microsoft Certification PL-200, PL-600 or PL-900 is a plus
Startup experience is a plus


This is a contract position with the potential to convert to full time.

Apply Now!

Braintrust Job ID: 6085

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
DUTIES:

Ensure that the Safety Engineering activities are executed in accordance with the company’s process, applicable industry standards and best practices 
Perform hazard identification studies (HAZID, HAZOP), hazard analyses (PHA, SHA, OSHA, FTA), safety analyses (FFMEA, FMECA, FSA) and hazard management 
Define safety requirements; analyze and evaluate design compliance with safety requirements and safety principles 
Review the adequacy and completeness of the safety evidences and produce the corresponding Safety Case artifacts 
Provide technical safety leadership to the project Safety Engineering team; work as part of an integrated project team, promoting the company's safety policy, best practices and train other staff 
Report directly to the Manager, RAMS Engineering and liaise with the Chief Safety Architect.




SKILLS:

M.Sc. in Electronics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent 

• Working knowledge of Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and/or Solid-State Interlocking (SSI)

• Member of Professional Engineer of Ontario (PEO) or Institution of Railway Signal Engineers (IRSE)




EDUCATION:

B.Sc. in Electronics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent 
Minimum 10 years of experience in a senior technical role in train control systems or automation in other industries such as aerospace, defense, automotive, medical or nuclear 
Knowledge of railway signaling systems, train control systems, fixed and moving block signaling principles, relay-based and/or computer-based interlocking design 
Good understanding of systems engineering, software engineering and functional safety 
Detailed knowledge of system safety lifecycle, system requirements definition, safety design concepts (system and software), safety and risk analysis 
Extensive experience with safety standards (CENELEC, IEC, IEEE, MIL), best practices, safety methods and techniques (HAZID, HAZOP, PHA, SHA, OSHA, FTA, FMEA/FMECA, FSA) and hazard management 
Ability to lead and coordinate technical staff 
Good technical writing skills, excellent communication and analytical skills; excellent command of the English language, both written and oral.

Title: Drug Database Associate - 12 Months Contract - Express Scripts Canada
Description:
Position Summary




Through the work of the Drug Pricing Services team, Express Scripts Canada offers its customers access to a comprehensive drug product and price file database of drug identification numbers (DINs) and drug prices for drug claim adjudication. The primary function of the Provider Data Analyst is to update and maintain the master drug file and the provincial price files for ESC customers using their knowledge and experience from retail pharmacy.




Delivers specific delegated tasks assigned by a supervisor in the Provider Data job family.




Responsible for accurate, timely maintenance of complex provider information and synchronization of data on all claims and provider databases including expertise on business requirements for multiple business regions.




Participates in the design of data tracking and monitoring tools.




Participates in system testing and analysis in support of new functionality, new system processes, and business rules changes.




Validates data to be housed on provider databases and ensure adherence to business and system requirements of customers.




Researches, resolves complex exceptions and error reports, determine regional/cap/business indicators for multiple business areas to assure accurate reimbursement based on provider contract and area fee schedules.




Interprets update requests and coordinates with internal and external customer to clarify and complete. Contributes to completion of projects and programs in area of expertise.




Completes day-to-day Provider Data tasks without immediate supervision, but has ready access to advice from more experienced team members.




Tasks involve a degree of forward planning and anticipation of needs/issues.




Resolves non-routine issues escalated from more junior team members.




Essential Functions




Performs the scheduled tasks required to maintain the product and price information for drug and medical supplies & equipment items in each province and territory
Uses documented processes to apply provincial coverage data and price changes from the source files for each field in the database and prepare the data for upload.
Performs peer review and quality assurance checks in the application following the data change
Prepares the price and coverage data required for custom programs
Resolves and responds to Provider and Customer queries regarding information in the database
Analyzes price and provincial program changes for impact to customer benefit plans
Identifies trends and opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies




Qualifications




High School diploma.
Graduate from a Pharmacy Technician/Assistant program
Effective organizational and time management skills to meet firm turnaround times
Critical thinking for decision making
Ability to work individually and in a team setting
Meticulous attention to detail
Advanced MS Excel skills
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Bilingualism (French & English) is an asset




NOTE: Internal candidates should apply before April 7, 2023.




Express Scripts Canada Is a Cigna Company




Express Scripts Canada is a subsidiary of Express Scripts, a Cigna company. Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, wellbeing and peace of mind of those we serve. Cigna offers an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioural health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products.




About Express Scripts Canada




Express Scripts Canada is a leading health benefits manager and has been recognized as one of the most innovative. Our clients include Canada's leading insurers, third party administrators and governments. We work with these clients to develop industry-leading solutions to deliver superior healthcare in a cost-controlled environment. We provide Active Pharmacy™ services to more than 7 million Canadian patients and adjudicate more than 100 million pharmacy, dental, and extended health claims annually. Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.




It will be a condition of employment that the successful candidate obtains an Enhanced Reliability Clearance from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to provide supporting documentation to receive clearance if required.




We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a positive work environment built on solid corporate values, integrity, mutual respect, collaboration, passion, service and alignment.




We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace. By embracing diversity, we build a more effective organization that empowers our employees to be the best that they can be.




We are committed to creating a working environment that is barrier-free and we are prepared to provide accommodation for people with disabilities.




If you require accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: eschr2@express-scripts.com Do not email eschr2@express-scripts.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

HTML:
Position Summary


Through the work of the Drug Pricing Services team, Express Scripts Canada offers its customers access to a comprehensive drug product and price file database of drug identification numbers (DINs) and drug prices for drug claim adjudication. The primary function of the Provider Data Analyst is to update and maintain the master drug file and the provincial price files for ESC customers using their knowledge and experience from retail pharmacy.


Delivers specific delegated tasks assigned by a supervisor in the Provider Data job family.


Responsible for accurate, timely maintenance of complex provider information and synchronization of data on all claims and provider databases including expertise on business requirements for multiple business regions.


Participates in the design of data tracking and monitoring tools.


Participates in system testing and analysis in support of new functionality, new system processes, and business rules changes.


Validates data to be housed on provider databases and ensure adherence to business and system requirements of customers.


Researches, resolves complex exceptions and error reports, determine regional/cap/business indicators for multiple business areas to assure accurate reimbursement based on provider contract and area fee schedules.


Interprets update requests and coordinates with internal and external customer to clarify and complete. Contributes to completion of projects and programs in area of expertise.


Completes day-to-day Provider Data tasks without immediate supervision, but has ready access to advice from more experienced team members.


Tasks involve a degree of forward planning and anticipation of needs/issues.


Resolves non-routine issues escalated from more junior team members.


Essential Functions


  • Performs the scheduled tasks required to maintain the product and price information for drug and medical supplies & equipment items in each province and territory
  • Uses documented processes to apply provincial coverage data and price changes from the source files for each field in the database and prepare the data for upload.
  • Performs peer review and quality assurance checks in the application following the data change
  • Prepares the price and coverage data required for custom programs
  • Resolves and responds to Provider and Customer queries regarding information in the database
  • Analyzes price and provincial program changes for impact to customer benefit plans
  • Identifies trends and opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies


Qualifications


  • High School diploma.
  • Graduate from a Pharmacy Technician/Assistant program
  • Effective organizational and time management skills to meet firm turnaround times
  • Critical thinking for decision making
  • Ability to work individually and in a team setting
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Advanced MS Excel skills
  • Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Bilingualism (French & English) is an asset


NOTE: Internal candidates should apply before April 7, 2023.

Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job#: 1337921

Job Description:

Data Engineer

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing practice has an opening for a Data Engineer with a strong background GCP services IE BigQuery, Cloud storage, and DataFlow, experience with Python or Java, and proficient in SQL and NoSQL, to place at our client, a major international retailer.

Client: Major International Retailer

Terms: 12 Month Contract.

Location: Hybrid 2 days/week – Mississauga

Application Process: It is best to apply via the medium on which you are seeing this posting. If you encounter technical difficulties submitting your resume, please send a Word version of your resume to Cole at cedwards@apexsystems.com . Please reference Data Engineer, #.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled data engineer with expertise in Google Cloud Platform and Hadoop to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience with data pipeline development, data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processing. The candidate should be able to design, build and maintain scalable and efficient data solutions.

Responsibilities:

Design and implement GCP-based data solutions to meet business requirements
Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, and data warehouses
Optimize data processing and data storage to improve system performance and reliability
Develop ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into GCP
Implement data security and governance best practices
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues


Key Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
3 years minimum of experience in data engineering with a focus on GCP
Expertise in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, DataProc
Strong programming skills in Python or Java
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with version control tools such as Git


Nice to Have:

Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes


Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills


Interview Process: There will be 2 rounds of Interviews that will take place in the week of March 27 th .

This a great opportunity to join a leading household brand and continue your career in the ecommerce domain. Be a part of a great work environment with a very well organized team and colleagues who will help you succeed.

This is a position that impacts the business enterprise wide with great opportunity for career growth within the business.

If you are not a 99% match to the above, and want to be considered for other opportunities at our enterprise clients, register for our Talent Network where you can receive job alerts about new opportunities that match your interests.

Title: IT Specialist, Enterprise Applications - BI Reporting & Analytics
HTML:
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.


Overview Of The Role


The IT Specialist, Enterprise Analytics provides reporting and analytic solutions to meet business requirements, and drive business value for the organization through strong skills and experience with SAP Native HANA, Data Modeling, and BW on HANA/BW4HANA.


How You Will Make Contributions That Matter:


  • Collaboration with business & functional teams to understand business requirements and transform them into data models, HANA Calculated Views, Reports and Dashboards;
  • Direct interaction with business SMEs and technical groups (BASIS, Security, Release Management…)
  • Preparation and facilitation of workshops with documented outcome (requirements, design, data models)
  • Contribution to the elaboration of Saputo’s BI strategy and architecture;
  • Contribution to the estimates of building new or enhanced BI solutions;
  • Functional design and functional design reviews;
  • Ensuring report designs are scalable, on strategy and deliver the expected business outcome to drive value;
  • Technical design of components of the solution (high level of complexity)
  • Development of components of the solution (high level of complexity)
  • Design and develop optimal code to maintain exceptional performance in processing large volumes of data across diverse sources;
  • Design and develop scalable reusable data models in SAP HANA in line with architectural standards and best practices;
  • Building solutions using Native HANA and components;
  • Building enterprise interactive dashboards using Power BI Dataset interfaced to HANA;
  • Defining testing plans, conducts performance tunning and data profiling;
  • Identifying and gaps resolution in data or information quality;
  • Ownership of problem resolution of incidents reported through our Global Service Desk or via our BI key users;
  • Coach and mentor Sr. Analysts and Analysts;
  • Experience in HANA performance analysis and optimization of the models and procedures;
  • Developing SAP HANA information models like Graphical and SQL based calculation views;


You Are Best Suited for The Role If You Have the Following Qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or Software Engineering;
  • 8+ years of hands-on project and support experience with Native HANA and SAP BW technologies;
  • Functional SAP experience in at least two (2) of the following SAP domains: FI, CO, SD, PP, QM, MM, EWM, TM, CRM, MDG, BPC, APO, PM;
  • Experience in developing SAP HANA database development and technologies such as tables, views, synonyms and procedures using SQL;
  • Experience in replicating data from SLT and work experience in SDA.
  • SAP Native HANA Modeling
  • SAP BW (Extractors, Infobjects, Composite providers, ADSOs, Process Chains, BEx etc.);
  • SAP BusinessObjects Suite, but more specifically Analysis for Microsoft Office and WebI;
  • LSA++ solution architecture;
  • Power BI Dashboards;
  • BOBJ, BW & HANA Security Model (nice to have)
  • SAP BW and HANA certifications - nice to have;
  • Strong technical design skills;
  • Proven to be detailed oriented;
  • Experience with enterprise estimating tools and delivery methodologies;
  • Bilingual - English and French (nice to have);
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • Ability to operate in complex, fast-paced project environment with interdependencies spanning multiple work-streams, teams, business divisions, geographies, time zones, & language.


We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:


  • Competitive salaries
  • Advantageous corporate agreements
  • Full range of group insurance benefits
  • Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
  • Purchase option of company stocks
  • Group RRSP
  • Health and wellness program in the workplace
  • Assistance program for employees and their families
  • Saputo products at a discounted price
  • We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.


Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise. To learn more about Saputo in Canada, please click here. (http://saputo.com/en/our-products/canada-sector)


Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!


  • SCOTSBURN is a registered trademark and is used under license by Saputo Dairy Products Canada G.P.


The material contained herein is provided for informational purposes only. All open jobs offered by Saputo Inc. and all companies, corporations, partnerships, limited partnerships and other entities controlled by Saputo Inc. (collectively, “Saputo”) on Saputo's web site are subject to specific job skill requirements. The job skill requirements, qualifications, and preferred experience are determined by a Saputo subsidiary, office or department, and all positions are subject to local prevailing employment laws and restrictions. This would include immigration laws pertaining to work authorization requirements and any other applicable government permissions or compliance. The materials on this site are provided without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties regarding the accuracy or completeness of the information contained on this site or in any referenced links. While Saputo attempts to update this site on a timely basis, the information is effective only as of the time and date of posting. Strict confidentiality will be observed at all times. Saputo is an equal opportunity employer. The information on this site is for information purposes only and is not intended to be relied upon with legal consequence.


Saputo welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations may be available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist - Power BI Developer
Description:
This is a 12 months contract located in Toronto, ON/ Hybrid




If you are interested in this posting please call me or send me your updated resume formatted in word. Please fill out the representation agreement and the skills matrix chart.




If you are not interested but know of someone who meets this criteria please feel free to forward them my contact information.




Please fill out the below email confirmation clearly stating the job #, title and permission to TekStaff allowing us to present you for this role.




“I, give Tekstaff IT Solutions Inc. the Contractor Representation Agreement me for position number (RQ05206 - Business Intelligence Specialist - Senior) at a daily pay rate of $.”




Please note - This is a 7.25 hour work day – paid daily rate.




All successful candidates will be subject to a mandatory credit AND criminal check as per the client. If you require any type of accommodations (for example, accessible interview site, alternate formats of materials, Assistive Technology, ASL Interpreter, etc.) during the recruitment and selection process, please let one of our Recruiters know.
Please note that all contractors are subject to a possible Holiday Leave program schedule, set by the client. Qualifying Questions: Legal First Name: Legal Middle Name (if applicable): Legal Last Name: Availability to Start Upcoming Vacations/Time Off (Yes/No, When) Banking/FI Experience (Yes/No, Where) Pay rate Incorporated (YES/NO) Month/Day of Birth** Will pass a mandatory criminal and credit check as per the client(YES/NO) Notice to interview Actively interviewing/Offers (Yes/No) Please address any employment gaps in the resume Reason for looking for new opportunities ** This information is needed to create a unique Security ID for you in the client's internal system.




Description




As part of the modernization of Social Assistance (SA) reporting platform (Legacy Cognos system), conduct a review of existing data model(s), report model(s) and redesign reporting products to be scalable and flexible to meet current program and Ministry needs for analytical and operational reporting.




The SA program area has identified several data and reporting products to support their efforts to modernize service delivery and streamline partnerships with municipalities. As the SA program area continues to develop the operational model implementation and evaluation plans, BIPD needs to establish a modernized, flexible reporting model to support reporting products and requirements. This will result in development of net new data and reporting products, including products to support Service Planning, continuous monitoring of operational indicators and outcome data through the contract cycle. At the same time BIPD needs to address the development of products in the SA reporting backlog, and the rationalization of the current 160+ operational and analytical products in the reporting catalogue.




Purpose




To integrate, translate and oversee design of business-driven issues and priorities into enterprise-level business intelligence and data analytics solutions, using leading-edge data development approaches, with expertise/knowledge in data modelling, data architecture and infrastructure, data development (including dimensional modelling) as well as reporting (e.g. dashboard) development.
To project-manage (e.g. design, deliver and implement) complex I&IT projects and various agile, business solutions required to meet cross-ministry business intelligence and data analytics activities and priority projects, including leading and supporting enterprise-wide projects that may involve work with other ministries, jurisdictions and the broader public sector.
To work within the ministry's business analytics data warehouse environment, and support efforts to enhance and maintain infrastructure and applications, and providing technical expertise to the development and implementation of various I&IT solutions, while working with CYSSC, ITS and enterprise partners.
To lead data development and maintenance activities that support strategic initiatives and priority projects across the ministry, including the preparation of ad-hoc statistical information and developing research/analytical data for reporting and analytics, while ensuring appropriate data quality, integrity, privacy and security.
Skills




Experience




Experience and Skill Set Requirements




Experience in Power BI software development and a number of years of practical experience (minimum 3+ years)
Experience in other Microsoft BI stack e.g. SSAS, SSRS, SSIS
Experience with scripting and programming
Experience working with MS SQL Server on premise and within Azure Environment
Experience with data-specific tasks including database management, SQL querying, data modelling, online analytical processing
Experience with designing and mapping multi-dimensional data models, report models into business insights
Ability to assist in the requirements gathering, analysis and subsequent developments
Ability to conduct unit tests and assist in test preparations to ensure data integrity
Work closely with Project Manager, UX/UI Designers, Quality Assurance Analysts and other Developers
Experience working within an Agile software development life cycle, e.g. Scrum/Kanban
Understanding of accessibility compliance requirements e.g. AODA, WCAG 2.0




Skills




Must Have:




3+ years using Power BI software development, including using DAX queries and functions
Microsoft Azure services such as Power Apps, Power Automate, Azure Database, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Synapse, Customer Voice, etc.
SQL Server
Oracle
Ability to translate wireframes, lo-fidelity and high-fidelity prototypes and business requirements into technical tasks towards functional reporting products or dashboards
Ability to present technical requirements to the business
Familiarity with accessibility compliance, usability testing e.g. AODA, WCAG 2.0




Nice To Have




Some knowledge of user interface design and user interaction design is an asset but not required.
Knowledge of Golden Gate is an asset but not required.




Evaluation Criteria




Power BI Development (25)




Demonstrated experience in Power BI software development and a number of years of practical experience (minimum 3+ years)
Experience in development of data marts in Power BI




Data Injection (25)




Demonstrated experience in Extract, Transform & Load software development and a number of years of practical experience (minimum 8+ years)
Experience in Informatica/SISS and ETL/ELT
Development of pre-defined and ad hoc reports and meet coding and accessibility (WCAG 2.0) requirements




Design Documentation And Analysis Skills (25)




Demonstrated experience in creating data documentation about algorithms, parameters, models using standard approaches e.g. Functional Design Documents (FDD) & Detailed Design Documents (DDD).
Experience in Fit-Gap analysis, system use case reviews, requirements reviews, coding exercises, and reviews
Experience in the development and maintaining a plan to address contract deliverables, through the identification of significant milestones and expected results with weekly status reporting.
Work with the Client, Designer(s) & Developer(s) assigned to refine/confirm Business Requirements
Analyse and document solution complexity and interdependencies by function / track for purpose of effort and cost estimation.




Database and Cloud Related (20)




Demonstrated experience with T-SQL Server databases
Experience with Microsoft Azure services such as Power Apps, Azure Database, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Synapse, Customer Voice, etc.




Knowledge Transfer (5)




The Developer must have previous work experience in conducting Knowledge Transfer and training sessions, ensuring the resources will receive the required knowledge to support the system. The resource must develop learning activities using review-watch-do methodology & demonstrate the ability to prepare and present.
Development of documentation and materials as part of a review and knowledge transfer to other members
Conduct Analysis, Design, Development and execution of specific learning activities that are aligned to Informatica work packages to staff
Development of specific activities as part of a review, watch, do methodology and building block approach which, build on knowledge transfer and skills development from the previous stage with increasing levels of complexity, priority and responsibility and hands on experience
Development and facilitation of classroom based, or virtual instructor demo led sessions for Developers
Monitor identified milestones and submission of status reports to ensure Knowledge Transfer is fully completed
Assist in the development of the pre-defined and ad hoc reports and meet the coding and accessibility (WCAG 2.0) requirements
5+ years using Power BI software development, including using DAX queries and functions
Microsoft Azure services such as Power Apps, Power Automate, Azure Database, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Synapse, Customer Voice, etc.
SQL Server
Oracle
Ability to translate wireframes, lo-fidelity and high-fidelity prototypes and business requirements into technical tasks towards functional reporting products or dashboards
Ability to present technical requirements to the business
Familiarity with accessibility compliance, usability testing e.g. AODA, WCAG 2.0

Title: Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics Developer
Description:
If you are a self-confident, self-motivated person with a strong work ethic and excellent communication skills and you enjoy a fast-paced team-driven environment, contact us today!




Working with one of the top financial clients this role calls for an Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics Developer who will be accountable for the implementation, continued integration and knowledge transfer of the client’s analytics stack including Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe AudienceManager, Adobe Launch, Adobe Mobile Services and Ensighten. This candidate will collaborate with digital stakeholders to define KPIs, reporting requirements, and overall measurement strategy for digital and mobile customer journeys.




Responsibilities




Translate business requirements into technical specifications for custom digital analytics implementation using a business combination of the data layer, processing rules, SAINT classification, report suite configuration, custom JavaScript, JSON and applicable integrations with other systems
Manage daily operations and implementation of client’s analytics stack (Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, AdobeAudience Manager, Adobe Launch, Adobe Mobile Services, Ensighten) and 3rd party marketing tags (DoubleClick, Rakuten, Facebook, etc.)
Develop and own all implementation documents such as SDR, Data Layer specifications, custom JavaScript
Ensure the timely delivery and accuracy of documentation and technical coding (HTML, JavaScript, ActionScript) of various Tag Management System
Collaborate with technology teams on the implementation of analytics solutions, including guidance on data layer implementation and troubleshooting, data feeds and integrations with other systems
Keep abreast of product updates (Adobe, Ensighten), and best practices and proactively follow up with required changes in our implementation and appropriate communications
Provide consultative service, training and validation support to quality assurance/testing teams




Desired Skill Set




3 years of hands-on experience with Advanced JavaScript
2 years of solid experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
Sound understanding of Custom tag implementation




Nice To Have




Exposure to Adobe Launch, Adobe Workspace and Adobe Target
Working knowledge of Ensighten
Deep understanding of GA4
Exposure to webSDK implementation
Hands-on experience with JIRA




BeachHead is an equal opportunity agency and employer. We advocate for you and welcome anyone regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.




Privacy Policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Apply




Job Type




Full-time




Description




The Data Analyst is a passionate, outgoing, responsible, and experienced professional who ensures that Mary’s Place has a complete and robust data system and maintains data policies and procedures on an ongoing basis. General responsibilities include management of policy and procedure information, data system development and maintenance, program evaluation, data analysis, quality management and reporting.




Valuing diversity and championing equity are core values at Mary’s Place. This position requires critical thinking and analysis through a race equity lens, as well as demonstration of compassion, understanding and empathy while working with diverse staff, guests and community partners in a multi-racial and multi-cultural environment.




This is a full-time, hourly position earning $30-35/hour DOE with a schedule of Monday-Friday 8:30am-5pm. The Data Analyst reports to the Data and Analytics Manager and works closely with the Director of Community Impact. This position does not supervise other staff.




NOTE: This position is a hybrid of remote work and in-person work which occurs on-site at Mary’s Place shelter locations




Key Responsibilities




Devise and implement efficient and secure procedures for data collection, handling, processing and analysis
Develop and administer surveys, focus groups and other tools to elevate client voice
Develop, document and disseminate data policies and procedures and ensure that updates are incorporated to keep materials accurate and current
Identify data errors, coding errors or other issues which impact data quality and resolve and implement strategies to improve data quality, reliability and efficiency
Train and coach data system users on processes and procedures to support the proper daily use of data systems and ensure adherence to established standards; provide technical assistance as requested
Maintain internal database and assist with the ongoing development of a complete internal data system including the development, construction, testing and maintenance of architectures that are aligned with program requirements
Collaborate across multiple departments to improve data processes and meet programmatic/organizational needs
Collect and process data for analysis and conduct regular analysis to identify trends and areas for quality improvement
Create/maintain dashboards, visualizations, queries, reports and reporting tools and share results across multiple levels of the organization and externally to demonstrate impact and facilitate decision-making
Respond to data requests and provide accurate and appropriate interpretation of data
Lead data-driven conversations with program and executive teams
Manage external data partnerships and provide requested data to external partners as needed
Participate in regular staff and team meetings
Ensure all responsibilities are carried out and adhere to Mary’s Place rules and policies
Maintain ongoing and open communication with Data and Analytics Manager and Director of Community Impact as well as other leadership staff and support staff
Embrace the Mary’s Place mission of centering equity and opportunity for women and families so no child sleeps outside and adhere to staff guidelines as outlined in the Employee Handbook
Maintain a calm demeanor and model positive behavior
Perform other duties as assigned




NOTE: We do not offer relocation pay or sponsor work Visas.




Requirements




Skills/Qualifications Required




Highly organized and attentive to detail
Ability to work as a part of a team and independently manage tasks
Experience working with people experiencing homelessness preferred
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
1+ years of experience as a data analyst or in a related field
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases and programming languages including SQL, Java, C++
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience developing qualitative data processes and using qualitative analytical tools
Experience with program evaluation including statistical analysis software and advanced statistical analysis techniques
Working knowledge of office equipment, computer hardware and peripheral devices
High-level written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable working on a computer for multiple hours a day
Able to speak, read, write and understand English
Ability to work successfully in a collaborative, team-orientated organization
Commitment to racial equity and social justice
Highly motivated, resourceful, flexible, and possesses a positive attitude and sense of humor
Strong communication and documentation skills
Ability to speak languages other than English preferred (Amharic, Tigrinya, Spanish or other languages spoken by clients)




Physical Requirements




Ability to converse with and listen to people in many different settings
Ability to use a computer and telephone, as well as other standard office equipment
Ability to sit, walk, stand, bend, squat, climb, kneel and twist on an intermittent or continuous basis
Ability to occasionally push, pull, lift and/or carry supplies up to 25 pounds
Work takes place in a social services environment where long periods of sitting, working on a computer, walking to various work areas, going up and down stairs, and standing are required
Travel to program sites and meetings outside the site and around the county may be necessary on occasion
Ability to work in an environment where there may be animals present, including dogs




In compliance with the ADA Amendment Act, should you have a disability that requires assistance and/or reasonable accommodation with the job application process, please contact the Human Resources department.




Qualified individuals must be able to perform the essential duties of the position with or without accommodation. A qualified person with a disability may request a modification or adjustment to the job or work environment in order to meet the physical requirements of the position. Mary’s Place will attempt to satisfy requests as long as the accommodation needed is reasonable and no undue hardship to Mary’s Place would result.




Details




In addition, Mary's Place offers the following benefits to full-time staff:




Medical and dental insurance with the cost for core employee coverage paid at 100% by the company and competitive family rates
Basic Life Insurance of $50,000 at no cost to employee; option to buy up for additional coverage
403(b) plan with a 50% employer match on the first 6% employee contribution. Eligible to participate upon hire; eligible for the match after first year of employment.
Unlimited use ORCA pass for a small deduction per pay period
10 days paid time off (PTO) each calendar year (accrued by pay period)
10 days of sick time each calendar year (accrued by pay period)
10 days of flexible floating holidays each calendar year (accrued 40 hours on January 1st and 40 hours on July 1st). Prorated based on date of hire for first year of employment.
Personal vehicle Mileage Reimbursement for traveling across sites
Employee Assistance Program




Mary’s Place is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workplace and strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Position Name: Data Analyst




Location: Seattle, WA




Duration: Full Time




Job Description




Data Analyst with 4+ years' experience, including experience in implementing end-to-end large Analytics programs. Retail/Manufacturing domain and eCommerce Analytics experience will be preferred.




Must Have Skill Set




Data preparation, Descriptive & predictive analytics, Data Visualization and Dashboard, Ecommerce Analytics, Statistical Modeling, Basic knowledge of Client & model building. Data Analysis Data Mining, Data transformation, Data preparation, Data Reports, Data Visualization, Define KPIs, Ecommerce Data analysis Basic statistics, Probability & statistical inference methods Data distribution techniques, quantitative & quantitative data, Modeling of Data distribution, Joint & conditional probability, Significance tests (hypothesis testing), Estimation techniques, Inference for categorical data (chi-square tests), Analysis of variance (ANOVA), Data Quality control measure, Time series analysis & A/B testing methods. Natural Language processing Text mining, Text transformation & pre-processing, Word Embedding techniques, NLP methods using Client & DL Bayesian Machine Learning Monte Carlo methods, Non-parameter estimation techniques. Sample techniques using BML such as MCMC, HMC etc. and A/B testing using BML




Technology: SQL, Adobe Analytics, Python, Scikit-learn, NLP

Title: Jr Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
Description:
Get It Recruit - Information Technology helps job seekers connect with employers and opportunities that match their qualifications. Once connected job seekers can complete the full application process directly on the employer's website.

We are seeking passionate and detail-oriented individuals to join our team in revolutionizing patient care. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in improving the quality of clinical data by meticulously reviewing and annotating it. You will work alongside a talented and diverse team of clinical researchers, data scientists, engineers, and statisticians who are committed to the intersection of clinical knowledge and advanced data science.

The ideal candidate for this position is a visual learner with exceptional attention to detail. You should feel comfortable working with medical data and be motivated to contribute to our mission of enhancing patient care.

Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree in health informatics, nursing, biology or related field

At least 1 year of clinical experience as a Medical Scribe, Medical Assistant, Nurse Practitioner, or Clinical Research Associate

Experience handling protected health information

Proficiency in clinical parameters, medical terminology, and ontologies such as ICD-10-CM, SNOMED-CT, CPT, RxNorm and LOINC

Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including common functions across worksheets and workbooks

Preferred Qualifications

Strong clinical background with exceptional attention to detail

Familiarity with formatted clinical notes

Knowledge of oncological diagnoses and treatments

Exceptional Execution Skills, Organizational And Coordination Experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong interest in healthcare and an eagerness to learn

As a key member of our multi-disciplinary team, you will:

Utilize your clinical experience to annotate and quality-assure existing labels of medical data using our editing interface and pre-defined tags that you will learn during the onboarding process.

Annotate clinical data from different databases based on linguistic role, clinical classification, structure role in medical note, and/or extraction of clinical attributes with normalization.

Be responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data) and data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records).

Utilize multiple sources of data, including tools to analyze and resolve problems.

Approach work requirements in a methodical and conscientious manner.

Prioritize tasks and follow them through to completion in a timely manner, with minimal supervision.

This is a contract position located in Redmond, Washington, with a competitive hourly rate ranging from $23 to $33, depending on experience. Work hours are from 8am to 5pm.

At our company, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please let us know.

Join us in our mission to improve patient care by applying today!

Please note that Get It Recruit - Information Technology is sharing this job opening on behalf of the employer. Any questions related to the job description or application process should be directed to the employer. To learn more about the position and begin the application process, please use our 'apply' button.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title




Job Title: Data Analyst




Duration: 6+Months




Location: Remote




This job contributes to success by guiding business decisions through utilizing data analysis and consulting that results in predicting outcomes, understanding complex data relationships, and developing a quantitative return on investment. This position partners on a cross-functional team of data scientists, statisticians, and business analysts supporting strategic initiatives utilizing the latest in computing technologies and operating across customer transactions and data elements to unlock the opportunities to support our global business.




Team Culture/work Environment




Agile team
Team mixed of business product developers, developers, SA’s and SME’s




Daily Responsibilities




support / mature data swat type stuff - requests, etc
one - off analysis of / support of sustainability, etc requests
mature and support our all up data maturation
Technology requirements?:
Advance Excel,
Alteryx,
SQL,
Azure Data pipeline components like Data Bricks,
Tableau,
BI Apps,
Incorta,
understanding of large ERP system data,
understanding of Large Organization Application eco system.




Required Background Skills




Functional Skills: Strong Data analysis skills
know how to consolidate
link and transform data
Other skills: Knows how to drive and discover with minimal hand holding,
get goer,
coordinate work with different teams,
can do multi-tasking.
Curious,
know how to work with in a team,
able to connect quickly with partners




Nice-to-Haves




Preferably an experience with Sustainability and Energy related data Analysis, Understanding of Data Modeling




Must Haves




SQL
Azure (Data tools)
ETL tools




About Us




Established in 2004, SPECTRAFORCE is one of the largest and fastest-growing diversity-owned staffing firms in the US. SPECTRAFORCE is built on the concept of “human connection,” defined by our branding tagline NEWJOBPHORIA®, which is the excitement of bringing joy and freedom to the work lifestyle so our people (and clients) can reach their highest potential. Our entire workflow cultivates NEWJOBPHORIA® with candidates and employees throughout their engagement with SPECTRAFORCE. http://www.spectraforce.com




Benefits: SPECTRAFORCE offers ACA compliant health benefits as well as dental, vision, accident, and hospital indemnity insurances. Additional benefits SPECTRAFORCE offers to the eligible employees include commuter benefits, 401K plan with matching and a referral bonus program. SPECTRAFORCE offers unpaid leave as well as paid sick leave when required by law.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Seattle, WA 98101

Duration: 12 + months contract

Pay rate: $35 – $40/Hr on W2

Summary:

In this role, you will be expected to support the team in creating metrics dashboards, producing operational KPIs, and partnering with stakeholders on the People team to support Pinterest leaders, managers, and employees.


What you’ll do:

Develop reporting solutions and dashboards to show current state and progress on People team KPIs
Analyze trends and provide value-added insights through the use of statistical analysis
Support development of data analytic products with self-service capabilities for stakeholders
Support automation and preparation of regular reports on the People team’s KPIs.
Advocate for continuous improvement by identifying clear measures of success and influencing process design to enable more effective data products
Define business needs through discovery sessions with key stakeholder


What we’re looking for:

3+ years’ experience in similar type of work preferred
Ability to build small to midsize business intelligence (BI) solutions – data sets, queries, reports, dashboards, analyses – or components of larger solutions to answer business questions with data
Use one or more industry analytics visualization tools (in particular Tableau)
Ability to manipulate large data sets with high dimensionality and complexity
Experience with SQL and Python
Prior experience in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in Human Resources
Basic understanding of statistical methods (descriptive and inferential) is a plus as you will be partnering with People Analytics team members
Experience in data storytelling and use of data visualizations to bring important takeaways to life
Ability to create narratives and support business partners to engage in data-driven decision making
Experience in Snowflake and Human Resources technology and tools, including experience with Workday, Greenhouse, or other ATS is a plus


Rate/Salary: $35.00/Hr. to $40.00/Hr.

Title: Business/ Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Job Requirements And Preferences

We are looking for a Business/ Data Analyst who knows HR processes and procedure (any country) to support an HR transformation programme eg:

Transform and enable better decision-making through the usage of advanced analytics
Partner business teams to understand the business area, work with the team to evolve and define the business problems, translate the same into an analytical problem, design solution approach to solve the same and help execute to deliver relevant insights that lead to actions.
Connect and explore large data-sets (both internal and external), help gather, analyse, and model data to solve complex business problems. Guide data science team on Diagnostic and Predictive Models to solve the business problem applying a range of techniques across classical statistics, Machine Learning (e.g. regression, clustering, variance analysis and basic exploratory univariate and bi-variate data analyses)
Be creative and a committed problem-solver using Data and Advanced analytics skill alongside leadership and direct engagement of business leaders
Have proven understanding of business strategies, goals and processes, and how Business Analytics can positively impact them


As a VR Business/ Data Analyst, you will have the flexibility to manage your own day, as long as you meet your set objectives and client demands. Often your team will be a mix of on-site and remote based members who will connect using IM, video calls and an online ticketing system. Good communication skills and time management is essential for this role.
