Title: Research / Data Analyst
Description:
Position Status: Full-time / Non-exempt / Hybrid

ECONorthwest, the Pacific Northwest’s largest economic consulting firm, has an immediate opening for a full-time Research Analyst to support our work in applied economic analysis and social/public policy analysis. Research Analysts support Project Managers and Associates in completing projects on a variety of topics. Day-to-day tasks will include general and specific research assignments, data cleaning and analysis, creation of report components such as charts and graphs, writing, and assisting with the creation of interactive visualizations or other web applications.




For examples of past ECONorthwest projects please see the projects section of our website: https://econw.com/projects.




The ideal candidate will possess a knowledge of economic concepts, proficiency in math, developed or developing technical abilities, and a strong interest in learning and applying new technologies across the varied subject areas where ECONorthwest works.




The position will be full-time and will be located in either our Portland, Oregon or Seattle, Washington office. This is a hybrid position, in-person Tuesday through Thursday and remote Monday and Friday.




Purpose:

Research Analysts are responsible for performing research on various assigned projects, in collaboration with others. Research Analysts are an important part of a project team. They prepare sections of technical reports, summaries, and qualitative and quantitative analyses, as needed, under the supervision of Associates, Project Managers, and Project Directors. They may bring specialized skills, such as spatial analysis or statistical analysis.




Essential Functions:

Under the guidance of an Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director:

§ Conducts research, in accordance with standard methods and research best practices

§ Identifies and organizes data and sources of information that are appropriate to assigned tasks

§ Summarizes information into clear and understandable tables and charts

§ For staff with spatial analysis responsibilities, produces clear and correct maps and spatial analysis

§ Ensures that data and information is thoroughly documented with appropriate sources and assumptions

§ Conducts interviews as part of research, as directed by Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director

§ Completes work within project timeline and budget as provided by the Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director

§ Proactively reports concerns and progress to the Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director on a weekly basis, unless more or less frequent reporting is requested

§ Manages their time based on the deadlines of each project they are working on, coordinating with Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director when there are competing deadlines

§ Requests a time budget for tasks and alerts Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director when work will exceed the time budget they were given

§ Discusses findings with other staff to evaluate validity of findings and explore implications; raises any concerns about how a research process addresses issues of diversity, equity, and inclusion, or any other concerns or issues with research alignment with ECONorthwest’s mission and statement of research integrity

§ Prepares sections of reports or memorandum under direction from Associate, PM, or PD, including inserting tables and charts and writing narrative

§ Assists in developing presentations, as needed

§ Related duties, as assigned




Required Competencies

Technical

§ Proficiency in Python and GIS/spatial analysis required

§ Knowledge of web development and R preferred

§ Knowledge of and ability to appropriately apply principles of research, including interviews, documentation and analysis of data, documentation of analysis, understanding and application of relevant theory, use of database, spreadsheet, and statistical software

§ Familiarity with public data sources (e.g., U.S. Census Data, Bureau of Economic Analysis, USDA agricultural statistics, population forecasts, etc.) and an understanding of their limitations and biases

§ Ability to write clearly about technical information

§ Ability to learn and adapt new principles

§ For staff with spatial analysis responsibilities, produces clear and accurate maps

§ Ability to understand appropriate use of data sources and their limitations, including how they may over- or under-represent specific populations

§ Ability to understand and help with formulating a research question

§ Ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment

§ Ability to incorporate existing knowledge into projects




Project and Team Management Skills

§ Ability to meet deadlines and produce quality analysis in the form of tables, charts, and narrative

§ Ability to work collaboratively and respectfully in team environment

§ Ability to develop a network within ECONorthwest

§ Demonstrated ability and willingness to adapt appropriately to business culture

§ Demonstrated awareness of the pertinence of the research with the project and across similar project




Personal Aptitude / Skills

§ Proactively contributes to a collegial and inclusive work environment

§ Ability to self-assess and course correct

§ Self-starting and proactive in soliciting work to maintain an appropriate billable rate

§ Ability to clearly communicate with staff, both verbally and in writing

§ Innate intellectual curiosity and the desire to seek out new ideas and solutions

§ Open-minded approach, flexible when needed

§ Motivated to produce high quality, relevant work

§ Adaptability

§ Takes responsibility for own work

§ Reliability, timeliness, and efficient management of time and workload




Qualifications

§ Bachelor’s degree in economics, mathematics, computer science, planning, political science, environmental policy, or a related field

§ Strong writing and communication skills

§ Experience using relevant qualitative, quantitative, or statistical methods




Physical Requirements

§ Ability to work for long periods at a computer.

This job description is a general description of the duties and requirements of the position. It is subject to revision by the management of ECONorthwest, as needed.

REQUIRED APPLICATION MATERIALS

All materials should be submitted in PDF format. Please contact king@econw.com if you have any questions or concerns about these requirements.

• Resume• Cover Letter (1 page limit). Please address in the cover letter how yourpersonal and professional experiences can help ECONorthwest deliver high-quality products to our clients.

• (Optional) List of relevant courses taken in college or elsewhere. This may be a college transcript or a list of courses, descriptions, and where you took them.

ECONorthwest is not a sponsoring organization.ECONorthwest is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ECONorthwest is committed to the work of improving its diversity and inclusiveness as a workplace. Our best work draws on teams within and beyond ECONorthwest who have diverse backgrounds and experiences that reflect the multifaceted communities we work in. Thus, we encourage applicants who would expand the diversity of lived experiences within our team and who share our values and commitments to advancing equity through research and data justice.

HTML:
Position Status: Full-time / Non-exempt / Hybrid

ECONorthwest, the Pacific Northwest’s largest economic consulting firm, has an immediate opening for a full-time Research Analyst to support our work in applied economic analysis and social/public policy analysis. Research Analysts support Project Managers and Associates in completing projects on a variety of topics. Day-to-day tasks will include general and specific research assignments, data cleaning and analysis, creation of report components such as charts and graphs, writing, and assisting with the creation of interactive visualizations or other web applications.


For examples of past ECONorthwest projects please see the projects section of our website: https://econw.com/projects.


The ideal candidate will possess a knowledge of economic concepts, proficiency in math, developed or developing technical abilities, and a strong interest in learning and applying new technologies across the varied subject areas where ECONorthwest works.


The position will be full-time and will be located in either our Portland, Oregon or Seattle, Washington office. This is a hybrid position, in-person Tuesday through Thursday and remote Monday and Friday.


Purpose:

Research Analysts are responsible for performing research on various assigned projects, in collaboration with others. Research Analysts are an important part of a project team. They prepare sections of technical reports, summaries, and qualitative and quantitative analyses, as needed, under the supervision of Associates, Project Managers, and Project Directors. They may bring specialized skills, such as spatial analysis or statistical analysis.


Essential Functions:

Under the guidance of an Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director:

§ Conducts research, in accordance with standard methods and research best practices

§ Identifies and organizes data and sources of information that are appropriate to assigned tasks

§ Summarizes information into clear and understandable tables and charts

§ For staff with spatial analysis responsibilities, produces clear and correct maps and spatial analysis

§ Ensures that data and information is thoroughly documented with appropriate sources and assumptions

§ Conducts interviews as part of research, as directed by Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director

§ Completes work within project timeline and budget as provided by the Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director

§ Proactively reports concerns and progress to the Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director on a weekly basis, unless more or less frequent reporting is requested

§ Manages their time based on the deadlines of each project they are working on, coordinating with Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director when there are competing deadlines

§ Requests a time budget for tasks and alerts Associate, Project Manager, or Project Director when work will exceed the time budget they were given

§ Discusses findings with other staff to evaluate validity of findings and explore implications; raises any concerns about how a research process addresses issues of diversity, equity, and inclusion, or any other concerns or issues with research alignment with ECONorthwest’s mission and statement of research integrity

§ Prepares sections of reports or memorandum under direction from Associate, PM, or PD, including inserting tables and charts and writing narrative

§ Assists in developing presentations, as needed

§ Related duties, as assigned


Required Competencies

Technical

§ Proficiency in Python and GIS/spatial analysis required

§ Knowledge of web development and R preferred

§ Knowledge of and ability to appropriately apply principles of research, including interviews, documentation and analysis of data, documentation of analysis, understanding and application of relevant theory, use of database, spreadsheet, and statistical software

§ Familiarity with public data sources (e.g., U.S. Census Data, Bureau of Economic Analysis, USDA agricultural statistics, population forecasts, etc.) and an understanding of their limitations and biases

§ Ability to write clearly about technical information

§ Ability to learn and adapt new principles

§ For staff with spatial analysis responsibilities, produces clear and accurate maps

§ Ability to understand appropriate use of data sources and their limitations, including how they may over- or under-represent specific populations

§ Ability to understand and help with formulating a research question

§ Ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment

§ Ability to incorporate existing knowledge into projects


Project and Team Management Skills

§ Ability to meet deadlines and produce quality analysis in the form of tables, charts, and narrative

§ Ability to work collaboratively and respectfully in team environment

§ Ability to develop a network within ECONorthwest

§ Demonstrated ability and willingness to adapt appropriately to business culture

§ Demonstrated awareness of the pertinence of the research with the project and across similar project


Personal Aptitude / Skills

§ Proactively contributes to a collegial and inclusive work environment

§ Ability to self-assess and course correct

§ Self-starting and proactive in soliciting work to maintain an appropriate billable rate

§ Ability to clearly communicate with staff, both verbally and in writing

§ Innate intellectual curiosity and the desire to seek out new ideas and solutions

§ Open-minded approach, flexible when needed

§ Motivated to produce high quality, relevant work

§ Adaptability

§ Takes responsibility for own work

§ Reliability, timeliness, and efficient management of time and workload


Qualifications

§ Bachelor’s degree in economics, mathematics, computer science, planning, political science, environmental policy, or a related field

§ Strong writing and communication skills

§ Experience using relevant qualitative, quantitative, or statistical methods


Physical Requirements

§ Ability to work for long periods at a computer.

This job description is a general description of the duties and requirements of the position. It is subject to revision by the management of ECONorthwest, as needed.

REQUIRED APPLICATION MATERIALS

All materials should be submitted in PDF format. Please contact king@econw.com if you have any questions or concerns about these requirements.

• Resume• Cover Letter (1 page limit). Please address in the cover letter how yourpersonal and professional experiences can help ECONorthwest deliver high-quality products to our clients.

• (Optional) List of relevant courses taken in college or elsewhere. This may be a college transcript or a list of courses, descriptions, and where you took them.

ECONorthwest is not a sponsoring organization.ECONorthwest is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ECONorthwest is committed to the work of improving its diversity and inclusiveness as a workplace. Our best work draws on teams within and beyond ECONorthwest who have diverse backgrounds and experiences that reflect the multifaceted communities we work in. Thus, we encourage applicants who would expand the diversity of lived experiences within our team and who share our values and commitments to advancing equity through research and data justice.

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Data Engineer/ Data Analyst




Experience 8 - 12 Yrs




Location Seattle Remote until end of COVID




Job Description




CRE Business Data Architecture team is responsible for driving critical cross-functional projects in support of designing, building, and implementing customer-centric data assets for use by the CRE stakeholders across the firm. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, metadata, data security, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate should have a good understanding of CB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of modeling data.




We are searching for a Data engineer who is very enthusiastic about data and building high-quality data solutions as part of our team committed to continuous learning and building a diverse & inclusive environment. The candidate must have the ability to collaborate with stakeholders and partners inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust data solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.




Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Title: Reporting and Insights Analyst
Description:
Want to be part of an amazing team, hell-bent on crafting a better future in the customer advocacy space? We're always looking for strategic people who are curious, data-driven, have a growth mindset, and excel at creating strategic points of view by levering data and learnings to inform internal stakeholders.

We are consultants. Strategists. Creators. Doers. Achievers. Explorers. Geeks. Hipsters. Leaders. Learners. Renegades. Seekers. Visionaries. And we fundamentally believe that we're better together.

Do you have a high bar for delivering effective actionable insights to B2B clients? Do you thrive in leveraging research and analysis to help inform teams around others to help create amazing work? If so, this role could be for you.

Although the ideation, development, and output of customer proof assets is driven by the content creators and product marketing teams, the Customer Proof Asset Reporting Insights Analyst supports the organization by digging into performance data to help identify trends and actionable insights ultimately informing how content should be created moving forward. We need someone who understands how to evaluate the performance of content with different stakeholders, and who can cross-reference data to derive insights that drive business decisions.

This is a 100% remote opportunity operating under a standard 8-5pm PST schedule.

Would you like to…

Build data visualizations with a strong understanding of the appropriate chart types to use and highlight patterns in the data for unstructured and structured data sets
Define reporting approach, develop reporting requirements, report design, report prototyping/testing, and implementation support
Develop ways of intelligently gathering and at times stitching data from multiple sources in an automated and efficient manner
Enhance existing and develop new reporting dashboards based on large sets of data that assist in answering key business questions and telling stories with data
Learn new tools, processes, strategies, and approaches fast and be able to apply them
Assist in the selection and implementation of analytics technologies based on client needs
Deliver in-depth analytical information in an organized, easily digestible format
Develop recommendations to solve or continue trends, outliers, and deviations from expectations
Work with a cross functional team of strategists and operations to formulate testing and learning opportunities
Identify trends, patterns, anomalies, spikes, standard deviations and other occurrences in data sets
Review data from multiple internal asset-management systems(esp. social, CRM, web, DAM) as well as data from the customers website and operational data generated through internal processes and services, like seller support resources.
Proactively identify trends, burgeoning issues, white space, and opportunity areas to optimize the advocacy program's operations and strategies
Help determine how prospective customers are accessing and using Advocacy content and case studies across their decision-making journey
Oversee the management and optimization of tools and technology for the Customer Marketing team, including the design and implementation of dashboards, regular program reporting, and addition and adoption of new tooling or tech as needed
Identify trends, patterns, anomalies, spikes, standard deviations and other occurrences in data sets.


What You Bring…

5-7 years of previous experience as a data and insights analyst supporting content marketing programs and campaigns analytical
Experience with pulling data from a variety of sources is preferred; typical sources include SQL-based data warehouses and both internal and external spreadsheets
Solid understanding of web analytics tools including Adobe Analytics and PowerBI
Curious and intuitive; able to see the big picture without losing sight of details
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to manage multiple conflicting priorities with very tight deadlines
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Proven ability to influence and drive cross functional collaboration across multiple levels of the organization
Experience working in cross functional teams comprised of various agencies all united to achieve the same goal
A high degree of skill at interpreting data to inform strategy and provide actionable insights
Interest and discipline to learn about our product portfolio
Exceptional organizational skills, with a deep sense of accountability and experience driving large projects from start to finish
A customer service mindset when working with stakeholders
Comfortable working remotely
Microsoft or enterprise experience is strongly preferred


Would you like to join a global organization that...

Embraces work-life balance – our employees' well-being remains a top priority for us
Encourages innovation and experimentation
Understands that changes will occur, and adaptability is crucial to assist when it does
Emphasizes and rewards collaboration
Strives for a diverse and inclusive culture
Works remotely. We continue to safeguard the health of our employees so our interviewing and on-boarding process will remain virtual until further notice


Want to know more?

Check out our open jobs around the world. Just so you know, we don't have a dress code, but we do have a strict no jerk policy.

https://www.designit.com/

Designit is committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to be considered for employment. Please let us know if you need any reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Job Description




Role: Data Analytics




Location: Seattle, WA




Role Summary




The Senior data Analytics is responsible for analytics strategy, data science, and business intelligence reporting, provide all aspects of business intelligence, advanced analytic modelling, and analysis to business stakeholders in order to drive performance, growth, and profitability.




Responsibilities




Proven knowledge working with relational databases including design, structure, and database management functions.
Demonstrated experience working with large, complex data sets and disparate data sources across various platforms.
Advanced SQL skills
Demonstrated experience working with NoSQL data sources.
Proven proficiency in visualization techniques, dashboard design, decision support tools, and automation, with experience using data visualization
Proven proficiency in programming languages
Excellent communication skills, including experience presenting to executive level leadership and communicating complex ideas in an understandable manner to management
Experience with version control software and tools (Git, GitHub, Azure DevOps)
Experience in developing KPIs / management system dashboards and reporting
Experience with Azure or other cloud providers
Proficiency using Databricks for data engineering, modeling, and deployment
Experience with distributed computing platforms (Hadoop, Apache Spark, Pig, Hive, etc.)
Experience with statistics/machine learning packages such as Spark MLlib, Python (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, scipy, Matplotlib), Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch etc
(SQL Server, PostGres, Oracle)
Experience in ETL / ELT processes (specifically through linked servers / Open Query)
Experience creating dashboards / stories in Tableau
Experience with process design and Agile practices




Preferred




Experience with operations research techniques (Monte Carlo, Markov Chain, queuing theory, etc.)

Title: Data Analyst-Employee Benefits
Description:
Propel is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team!




Are you looking to be part of a company where you have exciting opportunities to learn, grow and make a positive impact?




Join a team where each employee is empowered to listen generously, speak straight, collaborate, and build each other up through mutual accountability and shared success?




If that is what you’re looking for, this is your chance to be part of an amazing organization!




Under supervision of the Analytics Team Manager, the Data Analyst position primarily maintains a range of technical client deliverables for the Sales Executive/Consultant and the Account Management teams. The Data Analyst also works on ad hoc reporting and requests, assisting with more technical tasks, and acting as a client facing plan expert. Other common responsibilities include communication with carrier and vendor partners to negotiate quotes for coverage, and secure competitive pricing. Experience in the insurance industry, and specifically Employee Benefits, is highly desired.




Generate new and first time client initial deliverables
Roll over existing client templates to new plan years / structures
Provide monthly / quarterly client utilization, experience and financial reporting for the largest and most complex clients
Make adjustments to report inputs and visuals as needed
Generate custom contribution models
Analyze funding arrangements, including fully insured, self-insured, and level-funding
Prepare and create ASO spreads for self-funded plans
Create fully insured equivalents for self-funded plans
Generate benchmarking and trend analysis
Project client renewals and advise on overall client position
Negotiate with incumbent and bidding carriers to ensure most competitive rates and products for clients and prospective clients
Provide client deliverable feedback in client facing team calls and monthly / quarterly / annual emails communications
Track and store workflow in ImageRight
Remain current on industry trends and information, new product development, legislation, coverages, and online technology systems (e.g. carrier websites)
Participate in meetings, industry seminars and training programs
Provide training and act as a resource for the Employee Benefits department
3-5 years in the Employee Benefits industry
Four year degree; preferably focused on mathematical field
Minimum 1 year in an excel intensive technical role
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel in creating and working with pivot tables, complex charts / formulas, large datasets, and data visualization
Knowledge of ImageRight / Benefit Point / Springbuk / Deerwalk / Domo a plus
Analytical, able to analyze claims data, compare quotes and have accuracy and decisiveness
Strong organizational, verbal and written communications skills
Show more Show less

The Data Analyst also works on ad hoc reporting and requests, assisting with more technical tasks, and acting as a client facing plan expert. Other common responsibilities include communication with carrier and vendor partners to negotiate quotes for coverage, and secure competitive pricing. Experience in the insurance industry, and specifically Employee Benefits, is highly desired.


  • Generate new and first time client initial deliverables
  • Roll over existing client templates to new plan years / structures
  • Provide monthly / quarterly client utilization, experience and financial reporting for the largest and most complex clients
  • Make adjustments to report inputs and visuals as needed
  • Generate custom contribution models
  • Analyze funding arrangements, including fully insured, self-insured, and level-funding
  • Prepare and create ASO spreads for self-funded plans
  • Create fully insured equivalents for self-funded plans
  • Generate benchmarking and trend analysis
  • Project client renewals and advise on overall client position
  • Negotiate with incumbent and bidding carriers to ensure most competitive rates and products for clients and prospective clients
  • Provide client deliverable feedback in client facing team calls and monthly / quarterly / annual emails communications
  • Track and store workflow in ImageRight
  • Remain current on industry trends and information, new product development, legislation, coverages, and online technology systems (e.g. carrier websites)
  • Participate in meetings, industry seminars and training programs
  • Provide training and act as a resource for the Employee Benefits department
  • 3-5 years in the Employee Benefits industry
  • Four year degree; preferably focused on mathematical field
  • Minimum 1 year in an excel intensive technical role
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel in creating and working with pivot tables, complex charts / formulas, large datasets, and data visualization
  • Knowledge of ImageRight / Benefit Point / Springbuk / Deerwalk / Domo a plus
  • Analytical, able to analyze claims data, compare quotes and have accuracy and decisiveness
  • Strong organizational, verbal and written communications skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Since 1917, Globe Machine has been a manufacturer of industrial machines, systems, and plants for advanced composites, building products, and pulp & paper. The Data Analyst is a key role within our IT team and will be responsible for evaluating business processes and identifying ways to automate and optimize ERP solutions. This role will successfully support the organization by proactively ensuring the reporting needs of internal customers are met a s well as drive change throughout the organization by providing new technological initiatives. This position is located in our Tacoma, WA office. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Manage Globe's ERP system, integration, and operations. Create, maintain, and improve performance of corporate reports while enhancing and contributing to corporate reporting center of excellence. Develop SQL queries to provide requested data insight. Move them to reports or Power BI dashboards when required. Initiate solutions to circumvent and correct issues and champion future system and reporting initiatives driving changes throughout the organization. Identify opportunities to further evaluate business processes and find additional ways to automate, integrate, and optimize ERP solutions to create efficiencies, improve management visibility, enrich customer information, and improve data quality throughout the business. Monitor status of work in progress and review completed work to ensure its validity. Proactively identify detailed business requirements, managing projects and priorities, supporting operations, and delivering ongoing solutions. Provide progress and activity reports to managers on a regular, set basis. Maintain an awareness of new applications, technologies, technical methods, trends, and advances in the profession. Perform special projects as needed. Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field required. Five years of experience in a centralized information technology organization required. Excellent knowledge of technical management, information analysis, and computer hardware/software systems required. Hands-on experience with computer networks, network administration, backup, troubleshooting and network installation desired. At least 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server as well as experience developing reports using Crystal Reports, SSRS and Microsoft Power BI required. Experience publishing and automating Power BI dashboards as well as performing in a Business Analyst capacity including mapping business processes required. Experience with Microsoft Excel data functions helpful. Knowledge and experience with user roles and Security preferred. Strong Knowledge of T-SQL, Stored Procedures, SSIS, table design, indexes & query optimization necessary. Previous experience with Made 2 Manage ERP system a big plus. At least 3 years of experience in Discrete Manufacturing preferred. Strong u nderstanding of Virtualization technologies (VMWare, Hyper-V, etc.) Proven track record of being self-motivated, working with minimal supervision, and partnering with diverse team members and outside sources required. Ability to handle multiple priorities efficiently, retain a sense of urgency and meet strict timelines required. Excellent oral and written communication skills required. Conduct oneself with the highest level of professionalism, discretion, and ethical standards. Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Title: Data Engineer/Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Data Engineer/ Data Analyst




Location Seattle Remote until end of COVID




Job Description




CRE Business Data Architecture team is responsible for driving critical cross-functional projects in support of designing, building, and implementing customer-centric data assets for use by the CRE stakeholders across the firm. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, metadata, data security, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate should have a good understanding of CB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of modeling data.




We are searching for a Data engineer who is very enthusiastic about data and building high-quality data solutions as part of our team committed to continuous learning and building a diverse & inclusive environment. The candidate must have the ability to collaborate with stakeholders and partners inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust data solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.




Key Qualities




A team player and adaptable to changing environment
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, ability to drive the stakeholders to determine the Requirements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to present information in differing degrees of detail and form depending on the audience
Excellent organizational skills, time management skills, sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and perform in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines and demanding environment
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team.
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Experience working both independently and in a virtual, collaborative environment is essential. Comfortable working in a matrix management model with stakeholders and virtual teams across global locations
Ability to navigate and understand technical documentation and/or system documentation
Strong knowledge of back-end and front-end application components




Required Skills And Qualifications




3 to 5 years of experience with in a financial services organization, exposure to any Regulatory or compliance product is a Plus.
3 to 5 years of experience in gathering business requirements, understanding and articulating them in forums where need be, interaction with Stakeholders and Business owners is a must have
5+ years experience working in AWS
10+ years of industry experience, including deep technical experience with big data platforms and data management organizations doing hands-on Data Engineering or data-related Software Engineering.
Strong design, coding, debugging and analytical skills, especially across the big data ecosystem (e.g. Cloudera Hadoop)
Excellent command of the SQL language
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and big data tools (Spark, Hive, HDFS, etc.). Experience in architecture, data management, application ownership, AWS, Qlik Sense and other IT role experience a plus
Plug-and-Play Area Product Owner who can create JIRAs, groom them with tech partners and supervise testing.
Prior Project Managements and test management experience would be helpful.
Must have ability to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines and be comfortable manipulating and summarizing large quantities of data




Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
OBS Business School es la 1ª Business School 100% born online en España. Con más de 36.000 alumnos formados desde nuestra fundación, ofrecemos MBAs y Másters online que se adaptan a las necesidades del mercado nacional como internacional en constante evolución. OBS Business School forma parte de Planeta Formación y Universidades (división educación de Grupo Planeta), unos de los grupos líderes en el sector educativo en el mundo hispanohablante.

Para apoyar a nuestro crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, estamos en la búsqueda de Data Analyst, apasionado de los datos para el Departamento de Admisiones.

Misión del Puesto:

Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar el reportings necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.


Funciones:

Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
Identificación y creación de KPI’s
Optimización y gestión de BBDD
Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato Indefinido y a jornada completa (Horario de 12h a 21h)
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Requisitos:

Conocimientos:

Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportings
BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: SQL, QLIK, Programación PYTHON, Programación R


Habilidades:

Persona proactiva, resolutiva y exigente
Aporte ideas y soluciones
Anticipación problemas
Facilitador de toma de decisiones
Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
Fiable, confiable y metódico
Visión de negocio
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Nebeus

Nebeus is the leading European financial app for crypto hodlers which offers dedicated user IBAN accounts connected to a full crypto service ecosystem, all within one app. Join Nebeus in its mission to bridge crypto and cash!




Key facts:




Founded in 2014, backed by ex-VC executives, Seedrs, and the UK government’s Future Fund.
Nebeus is a multi-cultural and international team spread out between London and Barcelona.




To help carry us even further, we’re searching for an experienced data analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.




What You'll Be Doing

Understanding our business and its processes through our data.
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams.
Developing documentation and data governance.
Owning the entire ETL process.
Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks.
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets.
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Work directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.




Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

Work closely with the Head of Product and CEO to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and delivering actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts to make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.




Who You Are & What You'll Need

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics.
3+ years of experience mining data as a data analyst.
Experience with CRM platforms such as Zoho, etc.
Native English is a must.
Native or Advanced level Spanish is a big plus.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.
Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools.
Like everyone at Nebeus, you have a passion for creating high-quality products .




Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
Strong programming experience with frameworks, including Javascript, etc.
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, SPSS, and SAS.
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.




What we offer

A competitive salary.
25 days' holiday.
Health insurance package.
Apple equipment.
Free coffee and tea.
Regular on-site & off-site team events, summer & Christmas parties, and much more to come.
Unlimited monthly cashback on books - non-fiction, business, and especially crypto & fintech.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.

Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team




Required skills:

At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Knowledge of front-end web and mobile technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SDKs)
Experience in digital data collection (tracking), Firesbase and/or tag management systems
Experience in standard digital analytical tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Experience with AB testing, personalization, customer data platforms, and/or data activation is a plus
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Knowledge of script languages such as Python, R, Scala e.g., with Apache Spark is a plus
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language







Apply to our offer…

💟 If you are passionate about technologies

💟 If you define yourself as a team worker

💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

💟 If you want to work in an international environment




Our offering:

✨ Permanent contract

✨ Competitive salary

✨ 22 days of vacation

✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas

✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter

✨ Flexible working time

✨ Continuous working days in summer




Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Show more Show less
HTML:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.

Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.


We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.


As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!


What you will do:

  • You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
  • You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
  • You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
  • You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
  • You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
  • You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
  • You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
  • You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
  • You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team


Required skills:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
  • Knowledge of front-end web and mobile technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SDKs)
  • Experience in digital data collection (tracking), Firesbase and/or tag management systems
  • Experience in standard digital analytical tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
  • Experience with AB testing, personalization, customer data platforms, and/or data activation is a plus
  • Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
  • Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
  • Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
  • Knowledge of script languages such as Python, R, Scala e.g., with Apache Spark is a plus
  • Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
  • Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
  • Very good command of English language



Apply to our offer…

💟 If you are passionate about technologies

💟 If you define yourself as a team worker

💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

💟 If you want to work in an international environment


Our offering:

✨ Permanent contract

✨ Competitive salary

✨ 22 days of vacation

✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas

✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter

✨ Flexible working time

✨ Continuous working days in summer


Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Title: DATA ANALYST JUNIOR
Description:
Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados




Se precisa incorporar a una persona de perfil analítico con ganas de aprender y desarrollarse en consultoría especializada en marketing y transformación digital.




Tareas:




Buscamos un Digital Analyst para nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, con un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de analítica y reporting que formará parte del equipo de Analytics y Customer Insights.




Trabajará en proyectos donde desarrollará las siguientes funciones:




Analizar grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos para generar insights sobre comportamientos de clientes.
Desarrollar marcos, modelos, herramientas y procesos para garantizar que los datos influyan en las decisiones en todos los niveles.
Análisis avanzado de los resultados de performance Marketing y atribución.
Presentación de resultados a cliente y propuesta de implementaciones para la mejora de resultados.
Configuración de reporting avanzado en herramientas de visualización unificando diferentes fuentes de datos.
Procesar datos utilizando Excel de forma rápida y generando confianza
Diseño y e implementación de Cuadros de Mando.




Requisitos:




Formación: ADE / Marketing / Marketing Digital / Tecnologías de la información / Informática o Ingeniería similar.
Experiencia: Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos similares a las funciones descritas.
Habilidades básicas en el uso de herramientas y lenguajes de análisis utilizados para manipular y exportar datos en grandes conjuntos de datos (SQL) y para analizar / automatizar (Python/ R).
Nociones básicas en herramientas BI (Qlikview, Tableau o PowerBI).
Pensamiento crítico y capacidades de resolución de problemas.
Apasionado por el mundo de los datos y de la analítica de clientes
Personas con capacidades comunicativas y de interlocución con clientes. No buscamos sólo perfiles de “back-office”.
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.
Alto nivel de inglés




Ofrecemos:




Puesto de trabajo en nuestras oficinas situadas en el centro de Barcelona.
Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (online/ presencial)
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.




Descripción de la Firma




Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.




Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. La compañía ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.




Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.




Nuestro verdadero éxito depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?




Descripción de la Línea de negocio de Digital




La unidad de Digital es un equipo creativo e innovador dentro de la firma.




Nuestro trabajo se basa en el conocimiento profundo de los clientes, el mercado potencial y el entorno competitivo para generar una experiencia de cliente diferencial. Nuestras soluciones se centran en las áreas de modelos de negocio de digital, gestión de campañas, analítica web, redes sociales, gestión de contenidos y optimización en medios digitales.




¿Qué nos hace diferentes?




Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.




¿Quieres trabajar con nosotros?




Ofrecemos proyectos de alto nivel, atractivos, dinámicos y con visión de futuro.




Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡No lo dudes, únete a nosotros!

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Prácticas
Description:
¿Te gustaría trabajar para la consultora líder en el sector inmobiliaria en todo el mundo?

¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo que ayuda a los clientes a impulsar su negocio aplicando modelos y algoritmos complejos a grandes cantidades de información? ¿Quieres desarrollar tus habilidades en gestión de datos, automatización de procesos y visualización de resultados para conseguir un modelo de negocio data driven? ¿Eres una persona proactiva, creativa y que le gusta trabajar en equipo? Si es así, queremos conocerte.

En el departamento de Data Science de CBRE, estamos buscando jóvenes profesionales, con conocimientos en gestión de datos, para automatizar los procesos de modelización del departamento y ayudar al desarrollo de soluciones predictivas innovadoras que aborden los nuevos desafíos comerciales de nuestros clientes.

FUNCIONES


Participación en la estructuración de las bases de datos del departamento y la automatización de los procesos de modelización
Generación de informes y presentaciones de las tendencias futuras del sector inmobiliario y de la economía.
Presentaciones internas para explicar los análisis realizados.
Participación en proyectos de modelización, tanto econométrica como de Machine Learning, a nivel nacional e internacional.
PERFIL

REQUISITOS IMPRESCINDIBLES


Experiencia en programación en software de inferencia estadística, principalmente R, Python y SQL.
Se valorará la experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos econométricos o de Machine Learning.
Habilidad en pensar de forma analítica, cuantitativa y creativa.
Orientación en encontrar soluciones prácticas a problemas de negocio complejos.
Capacidad de redactar y estructurar informes.
Dominio del Inglés.
Capacidad de comunicación.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Se valorará el conocimiento del Sector Inmobiliario.
REQUISITOS DESEADOS


Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística o similares.
Preferiblemente Máster en Data Science o similares.
Habilidad para resolver tareas complejas.

OFRECEMOS


Proyecto innovador y diferencial.
Posibilidad de iniciar la carrera profesional en la consultora Nº1 Líder en Real Estate.
CBRE está comprometido con la igualdad y no discriminación, por lo que, en coherencia, espera que, en el marco de las presentes relaciones, se respete tal compromiso y se evite cualquier conducta, expresión, referencia o decisión que pudiera lesionar la igualdad pretendida.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world's largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world's largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe's fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world's most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.


Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our opportunity

Zurich Global Employee Benefits Solutions (ZGEBS) is a business unit within Zurich Insurance Group whose objective is to support multinational customers in structuring global employee benefits solutions that cover local and/or international employees in multiple countries. ZGEBS manages and operates captive, pooling and International Program (ZIPE) solutions that combine local insurance policies – provided by local Zurich units or selected external partners – into a reinsurance arrangement for multinational customers. These offerings cover employee benefits insurance risks such as death, disability, accident and medical coverages.

We are excited to invite applications to implement our ambitious objective to grow and expand our business around the world.

Data & Reporting Analyst strives to apply a portfolio management approach and work cross functionally with Sales, Underwriting and Finance to develop, manage and oversight activities in relation to the end to end delivery of life insurance services to our customers.

You have experience in working in a fast paced international business environment, analytic thinker who likes to drive topics from prototyping to final implementation in collaboration with different stakeholders. You like to work in a dynamic team where activities are based on capabilities, skills and willingness to help each other.

Your role

As a Data and Reporting Analyst your main responsibilities will involve:


Manage relationship and activities related to our Network Partners and Customers
Producing Customer and Network Partners reports
Streamlinining processes and data analysis to ensure excellent delivery standard
Monitoring portfolio data and performance
Proactively ensuring customer satisfaction through the monitoring and implementation of related metrics.
Establishing best practice to optimize end service delivery
Ensuring financial and accounting closing are performed according to deadlines
Actively collaborating with other teams and Subject Matter Experts to identify relevant data sources, help develop and improve operational and customer reports


Your Skills And Experience

As a Data and Reporting Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


A university degree, preferably in an analytical field (Math, Statistics, Physics, Finance or IT)
Relevant work experience of 3-5 years related to the above mentioned responsibilities
Basic knowledge in the insurance business is preferred.
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
Ability to work with large data sets across different business segments and extrapolate findings to support decision-making
A good understanding of SQL, Python /R and experience in visualizing data using tools is an asset
Basic knowledge in additional data analytics / visualization tools such as SAS, Microsoft BI or similar tools is considered as an asset
Communication, presentation, project management and relationship skills


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working:
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Santamaría Rodríguez Laura
Closing date:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Empresa del sector energético.|Ubicada en la zona del Vallés Oriental.




About Our Client




Empresa del sector energético en pleno crecimiento ubicada en el Vallés Orienta.




Job Description




Liderar los proyectos de análisis de datos coordinándose con el equipo de datos.
Poner foco en el impacto de la aplicación de la tecnología en el negocio.
Liderar los proyectos asignados de business analytics y casos de uso de extremo a extremo, reportando a la dirección del proyecto.
En colaboración con el equipo de data: diseñar, implantar y optimizar una estrategia a largo plazo del tratamiento de la información.
Documentar las distintas fases de los proyectos.
Realizar análisis del entorno y diseñar un sistema de reporting para la visualización de las datos.
The Successful Applicant




Grado en matemáticas, estadística, ingeniería, ADE o Informática
Experiencia consolidada R, Python, SQL/PLSQL.
Conocimientos de Talend.
Dominio de técnicas de aprendizaje automático, técnicas estadísticas y minería de datos.
Experiencia en Power BI i Tableau
Nivel de inglés B2.
What's on Offer




Oportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional.




Contact: Alejandro Mediano




Quote job ref: JN-022023-5959095

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge? Do you enjoy Data Management? This opportunity is for you!

Multinational inside the industrial and medical sector responsible for the production and distribution of gases is looking for several Data Analysts located in Barcelona, Madrid, Porto or Lisbon.

Tasks

You will be in charge to generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics
This role is aimed to support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics
The Data Analytics Expert acts as the interface between Business and IT area - defines and discusses content related requirements with business and transform into IT / implements requirements using state-of the art technology
Moreover, you will be in charge of the execution and management of projects within business analytics closely aligned with business, IT
Last but not least, responsibilities like coaching and training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics (e.g. Tableau training)


Requirements

You have a University diploma in Computer Science, Business Economics or Business
Advanced level of English language is mandatory
Solid computer skills, including Microsoft Office, databases, web-based applications
Further you have the ability to write and execute complex SQL queries to extract data from a variety of internal sources
Significant experience with Tableau or any Data Visualization Tool is require for this role
Python and/or R development skills would be a plus
You are highly organized and adaptable individual with effective time management
Travel availability (for dedicated meetings, for training purposes or knowledge exchange experiences)


Benefits

Competitive salary
Possibility of growth inside the company
Multicultural atmosphere


Show more Show less

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




What makes Netcentric a great fit for you?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the world’s leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We’re energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization. Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch people’s lives.




Job Description




Job Description




We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst professional who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects. You will consult internal stakeholders by leveraging data insights. You will be the interface between the product team and the business. You are a good fit, if you are a sharp mind that gathers insights and turns them into business value.




You have a strong analytical mindset and are a great communicator to convey your insights.




Roles & Responsibilities in your day-to-day activities you will:




Consult internal stakeholders on using data to gain meaningful insights
Collaborate with members of the digital, product marketing, and business stakeholders to provide actionable insights on the performance of digital channels.
Guide product marketers in identifying key performance indicators for their areas and build appropriate reporting that provides insight into the performance of initiatives within each area.
Derive actionable consumer insights from trends observed data and reports for the business owners and stakeholders
Extract existing data to calculate/format into presentable reports, charts, and graphs
Examine and evaluate the purpose and content of business reports to develop new or improve existing format
Design, build and implement new report formats and layouts on a customized basis as requested by the process owners
Validation and clean-up of the production data. Individual productivity tracking and scorecard preparation
Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.
Apply data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with the products.
Ensure the accuracy of the reports
Continuously work with product teams and improve the product
Responsible for product reporting and guiding team along with Product Owner
Consult on projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touchpoints.
Advocate customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.
Added advantage:
Experience in Tag Management with the ability to read and write code
Model business processes in data architecture for analysis and optimization
Workshop attendance - online, as well as some onsite travel required.
Qualifications




Required Skills:




5 years of experience as Data Analyst
Products, MS Power BI, Google Data Studio / Looker
Basic understanding of SQL and queering data to derive insights for business
Good communication skills (verbal and written) and Strong Interpersonal Skills
Report writing, presentation and insight generation
Creating Dashboards in (Excel, PowerBI, Google Data Studio etc.)
Understanding of Marketing needs
Data Science interface
Creative skills on visualization
Can inspire, gather insights and convey key messages to the business
Out of the box thinking, linking data sets
Abstract thinking
Working hours CET +/- hour




What makes us smile when we look at your profile:




Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
Not afraid to run workshop and knowledge sharing sessions




Additional Information




At Netcentric you get:




Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Description:
AVL is the world's largest independent company for development, simulation and testing technology of powertrains (hybrid, combustion engines, transmission, electric drive, batteries and software) for passenger cars, trucks and large engines.

Develop and maintain data analysis tools and algorithms to support the development and testing
Perform statistical analyses and modeling of the data to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate with engineers and team members to interpret data and provide insights and recommendations
Develop and present reports and visualizations to communicate data insights and findings to non-technical profiles
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the systems through data-driven decision making
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering.
High level of English.
Strong analytical skills and experience with statistical analysis, data modeling and machine learning techniques is a plus.
Medium\Advanced programming skill with Python.
Experience with data visualization tools is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
An exciting and challenging job in an innovative and dynamic company
An international working environment with opportunities for personal and professional development
Competitive salary and benefits package
