Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

As a People Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a passionate and dynamic team of people analytics professionals to drive data-informed decisions related to our people operations, with a particular focus on Talent Management.

This role will be embedded within our People team, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of team members who share your passion for using data to drive business outcomes.

The main responsibilities will be:

Partner with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and develop dashboards that provide insights into our people operations.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and patterns that inform business decisions.
Participate and co-drive the creation of an People data platform and develop models and frameworks to support strategic
workforce planning, talent acquisition, retention, and performance management.
Collaborate with HR, Finance, and other business functions to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.
Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for various audiences including the Company’s Board of Directors.
Proactively seek out new opportunities for data analysis and continuous improvement within our people analytics function, helping to shape the future of our organization.


Qualities we value for the role:

>2 years of experience in a People Data Analyst role or similar roles.
Knowledge of People functions and metrics.
Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively.
Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients.
Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets, alternatively, Excel.
Working knowledge in data visualization tools (Looker Studio, or other data visualization tools).
Understanding of and experience with SQL and relational databases.
Experience with ETL tools and Python knowledge is highly valued.
Ability to communicate fluently in English, as it is our main working language.


What do we offer?

A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.
Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons as well as a subscription to Coursera Online Learning.
Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!
A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.
New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.
Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.
Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!


… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🌎 About Localyze

Created in 2018 by three female founders, Localyze is reimagining how people move for work by bringing together seamless technology, transparency and unrivalled service. We believe in freeing talent from borders, so we're building a centralised platform for a decentralised world. A world where companies can hire from everywhere — and people can work and live where they want to.

With almost one hundred Localitos from more than fifteen unique nationalities distributed across four continents we embody the diversity of the talent we relocate. After closing our $35m Series B, we are now expanding the team and looking for more Localitos to join the ride.

📈 About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our global team at Localyze! In this role, you'll be turning data for sales and product into compelling insights for our leadership team, helping them make better decisions and drive our mission to create a borderless world.

Get ready to analyse the impact of our strategic initiatives on key metrics, analyse how these initiative contribute to our core OKRs and product strategy, set up and own end-to-end dashboard development, and maintain our existing dashboards in production using Metabase. You'll even have the opportunity to identify new opportunities, manage stakeholder reporting expectations, and influence Localyze partners to take action.

So if you're a self-driven, hands-on data lover with strong SQL and Python skills, come join our team of passionate Localitos from all over the world!

As our first Senior Data Analyst, you will:

Develop a thorough understanding of specific areas of the business and the key metrics to drive data-driven performance measurement of product strategies.
Create key performance indicators (KPIs) based on business requirements and align them with the key stakeholders.
Generate reports and presentations of the findings to promote a data-driven organisation.
Analyse data sets to identify trends and patterns that can be translated into actionable insights.
Collect data from various sources using SQL and assess the data's quality.
Collaborate with analytical engineers to build data products, provide clear documentation, and ensure the quality of data models.
Apply technical expertise to perform quantitative and statistical analysis, conduct experiments, and mine data.
Present findings in an easy-to-understand manner to inform data-driven decisions.
Build and maintain a robust communication network with key stakeholders.


💫 About You

You'll thrive in this role if you have:

5+ years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the B2B SaaS startup industry.
Strong SQL and Python skills.
Experience with Airflow, Docker, BigQuery, Metabase, or similar tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
A self-driven, hands-on, and highly motivated approach to work with strong attention to accuracy and detail.
The ability to efficiently manage multiple priorities.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Team leadership experience is a plus!


🦙 What We Offer

Join our passionate and internationally diverse team, with three female founders and over 55% female Localitos.
Work remotely across Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, the UK, the US, or Canada (depending on the time-zone requirements for the role).
Kit out your home office with a stipend for equipment, including a Macbook.
Benefit from statutory healthcare and perks.
Earn a market-related salary, including employee stock options, and 401K + matching for US-based employees/roles.
Expand your knowledge with an annual learning & development budget.
Balance work and life with a monthly wellness stipend.
Make the most of our paid time off and parental leave, plus an additional day of celebration!
Get to know your team during our company-wide events and international retreats. We went to Portugal in 2022 and Italy in 2023!


💙 Diversity & Inclusion @ Localyze

As an equal opportunity employer and advocates of Diversity and Inclusion, we proudly welcome applications from people of all races, ethnicities, disability statuses, ages, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations. We encourage you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the criteria above but are still interested in the role and mission. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for team members who are genuinely excited to join Localyze!

For more information on the processing of your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst - Operations
Description:
Description

📍Location: Barcelona, Spain

🌍 International environment

💰Competitive salary and perks

The revolution starts with small things: driving EVs, taking profit from renewable energy sources to avoid fuel... At Wallbox we work to make the world greener!

Why join Wallbox?

We create smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger. We work with electric cars, build smart chargers, use solar panels and inverters and integrate everything into solutions for users around the world. Founded in 2015 as a Barcelona based start up, we have since grown to over 1000 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities with a presence in Europe, Asia and the Americas!

From a top Spanish start-up to the first Spanish company to be listed on the NYSE, we are growing rapidly and we want you on board!

Our Data Journey:

Wallbox is committed to become a data driven company, not only for improving our decision making processes but also for helping us drive better our product development and incorporate data into our existing products or even create new business models.

We started our data journey just one year ago and it has already been an amazing drive! We’ve built a passionate and vibrant team, organised in a hub & spoke model, with roles such as data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers.

Also we’ve been building a modern data stack, with technologies like Snowflake, Airflow, Fivetran, DBT, Tableau and Databricks. Our long term vision is to walk towards a data mesh model, where we will split people into producers and consumers domains.

Today our data lake is ingesting more than 1M events per hour coming from more than 350 sensors in our chargers. And this is just the beginning, as our goal is to reach one million online chargers by 2025.

Requirements

What will you be doing?

Work as a Data analyst for our Operations team which is responsible for production planning, continuous improvement, material management and process optimization at Wallbox
Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasks
Enable data driven process improvements through analysis of sales, production, logistics and external data
Extract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.
Utilise SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions.
Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a monitoring tool for diverse stakeholders and assess the impact of new process improvements
Work with Data Engineers to identify and add new datasets to the data platform. Collaborate with them for roadmap definition.
Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalogue of dashboards and data products
Have a key role in building data culture within the company
Define the direction, structure, processes, and standards for Data across the company (e.g. experimentation framework)
Drive a culture of data-informed decision making as we scale.


Must have:

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background
2+ years experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makers
Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problems
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R)
Very good knowledge of SQL and experience in working with large data sets
Fluent in business English


Nice to have:

Experience in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)
Experience in Manufacturing, Operations,Energy, Mobility or Automotive industry will be good to have
Experience in working with predictive models


Benefits

Half-day Fridays!
Hybrid policy: 2 days of remote work
First-class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox
Online group training sessions twice a week
Free online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a week
Flexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation,
childcare, and learning & development.
Hundreds of discounts on different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits
platform
Car discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!
Learn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting!
Show more Show less

  • Free online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a week
  • Flexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation,
  • childcare, and learning & development.
  • Hundreds of discounts on different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits
  • platform

Title: Data Analyst It · Barcelona
Description:
Malthus Darwin es una empresa de Consultoría, especializada en la búsqueda, selección y evaluación de perfiles IT. Nuestro principal objetivo es proporcionar los mejores recursos humanos a nuestros clientes con la mayor rapidez y la máxima eficacia ofreciendo siempre un servicio de calidad.

Actualmente estamos buscando un perfilData Analystpara trabajar con un importante cliente del sector IT. Se trata de un puesto de larga duración enBarcelona.

Requisitos

Experiencia en Excel avanzado, Powerpoint, SQL, R y QLIK.
Capacidad y habilidad para procesar, analizar y representar datos.
Capacidad para comunicar.
Experiencia como analista de datos aproximadamente un año.

Funciones

Proporcionar asesoramiento empresarial basado en datos y en informes.
Sacar conclusiones de los datos, presentaciones en PowerPoint
Realizar Gráficos Excel.

Si buscas nuevos retos profesionales y tu perfil encaja con la descripción, ¡anímate a saber más! -->******

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
¿Quiénes somos y qué queremos conseguir?

GoTrendier es una startup que ha creado el marketplace de moda de segunda mano líder en México y Colombia desde 2017, ayudando a millones de personas a consumir moda de una forma más sostenible y obtener ingresos extra para su familia.

Ya somos 90 compañeros y tenemos oficinas en Barcelona, Ciudad de México y Bogotá.

En nuestra plataforma se hacen más de 200.000 transacciones al mes. Somos una comunidad de más de 6 millones de usuarias y más de 10.000 se unen cada día.

Nuestra Misión es cambiar la manera en que las mujeres consumen moda e inspirarlas a hacerlo de una forma más social y sostenible.

Se estima que la moda de segunda mano duplicará a la fast fashion en 2030, a nivel global, evitando un enorme impacto ambiental. ¡Y en GoTrendier somos protagonistas de este cambio!




¿A quién buscamos?

Buscamos un Analista de NEGOCIO con excelentes skills y conocimientos de DATA, que nos ayude a monitorizar, analizar y obtener insights relevantes sobre la evolución del negocio, y detectar oportunidades que puedan impactar en el performance de la compañía.
Trabajarás en el equipo de Growth/Producto, apoyando a los principales líderes de la empresa con análisis de datos que serán claves en la toma de decisiones de negocio.
Buscamos una persona proactiva, con muchas ganas de crecer profesionalmente y con potencial para asumir nuevos roles en la compañía a medio plazo.
Muy Importante: debes ser 100% Data-Driven, pero sobre todo con visión y mindset de NEGOCIO.




Requisitos mínimos:

Residencia en Barcelona
Trabajo híbrido flexible: 2-3 días a la semana en la oficina (Poble Nou), con flexibilidad.
2+ años de experiencia (preferiblemente en entorno startup) como analista de negocio.
Vocación y visión de Negocio.
Data-Driven. Excelentes skills analíticas.
Dominio de herramientas de análisis y visualización de datos. Excel avanzado + estar familiarizado con aplicaciones de BI.
Conocimientos de estadística.
Proactivo y resolutivo. Si se puede hacer hoy, mejor que mañana.




Además, nos encantaría que tuvieses (nice to have)...

Experiencia en entorno startup, marketplaces o ecommerce de moda.
Experiencia en análisis de empresas.
Conocimientos avanzados de SQL.
Experiencia en consultoría estratégica.
Formación MBA.
Experiencia o formación específica en Data (Master en Business Analytics & Data o similares)




¿Cómo somos en GoTrendier?

Somos conductores, no pasajeros. Somos gente de acción y nos implicamos en conseguir los objetivos.
Buenos compañeros de Equipo. Colaboramos, nos ayudamos, y también sabemos divertirnos.
Nos encanta crecer y aprender. Somos curiosos e inconformistas y nos motivan los retos.




¿Qué valoramos más de trabajar en GoTrendier?

El enorme impacto que estamos generando. Formar parte de una empresa en crecimiento que logra impactar en millones de personas y en el planeta.
Flexibilidad para organizarse y conciliar.
Trabajar con un equipo top con oportunidades para aprender con gente muy buena y con amplia experiencia en startups exitosas, como Jesús Monleón (uno de los mayores expertos en España de eCommerce e Internet, fundador de emagister, Trovit, Offerum, SeedRocket,…) y Yair Martínez (ex CEO de Social Games Online, BeRepublic, Accenture,...).
Proyecto de producto, negocio, y tecnología muy atractivo, con una clara hoja de ruta, y retos profesionales que nos hacen crecer a todos junto a la empresa.
Salario acorde al perfil y a lo que aporta cada uno.
Seguro de Salud privado pagado por la empresa al empleado (con compañía top: DKV), con posibilidad de incluir a familiares en modalidad de retribución flexible.
Trabajar con compañeros que, además de ser grandes profesionales, nos hacen agradable el día a día.
Entorno internacional: compañeros de España, México y Colombia, colaborando cada día.
Iniciativas continuas de formación y aprendizaje (cursos, libros, conferencias, …)
Acceso a un Club de Descuentos para empleados en tiendas top (Amazon, AirBnB, Cepsa, Atrápalo, Ticketmaster, Nintendo,...), a través de Cobee.
Plan de People & Culture para seguir mejorando cada día.
Show more Show less

  • Trabajar con compañeros que, además de ser grandes profesionales, nos hacen agradable el día a día.
  • Entorno internacional: compañeros de España, México y Colombia, colaborando cada día.
  • Iniciativas continuas de formación y aprendizaje (cursos, libros, conferencias, …)
  • Acceso a un Club de Descuentos para empleados en tiendas top (Amazon, AirBnB, Cepsa, Atrápalo, Ticketmaster, Nintendo,...), a través de Cobee.
  • Plan de People & Culture para seguir mejorando cada día.

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
Who We Are




At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 2,700 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and share successes. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising.




This is a 6-month internship opportunity based in Barcelona starting January 2023*




The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide market level analytics insights to internal stakeholders and also derive action plans from them. Insights on business performance drive sales or operational actions that maximize revenue and margin. Thanks to a global geo coverage, BPAX has the ability to address country, market and global level topic, and ensure timely sync with every in-market team and leader. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities.




As an Analyst Intern in this Business Performance team you will provide a data-driven approach to understand the business.




This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.




Missions




Provide analytical insights on changes of market environment and competition.
Size business growth opportunities/threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders.
Based on external and internal data, understand client’s behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business.




Academic Background / Skills / Experience




Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Business School).
Strong intellectual curiosity and analytics skills. Ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
Experienced in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus.
A good grasp of statistical modelling.
Very good communication skills.
Fluency in English.
Proactivity and commitment.




At Criteo, we believe the future is wide open when it includes everyone. We are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed. We want you to come as you are so we can succeed together.




We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!




Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.




Show more Show less
HTML:
Who We Are


At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 2,700 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and share successes. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising.


  • This is a 6-month internship opportunity based in Barcelona starting January 2023*


The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide market level analytics insights to internal stakeholders and also derive action plans from them. Insights on business performance drive sales or operational actions that maximize revenue and margin. Thanks to a global geo coverage, BPAX has the ability to address country, market and global level topic, and ensure timely sync with every in-market team and leader. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities.


As an Analyst Intern in this Business Performance team you will provide a data-driven approach to understand the business.


This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.


Missions


  • Provide analytical insights on changes of market environment and competition.
  • Size business growth opportunities/threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders.
  • Based on external and internal data, understand client’s behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business.


Academic Background / Skills / Experience


  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Business School).
  • Strong intellectual curiosity and analytics skills. Ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
  • Experienced in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus.
  • A good grasp of statistical modelling.
  • Very good communication skills.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Proactivity and commitment.


At Criteo, we believe the future is wide open when it includes everyone. We are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed. We want you to come as you are so we can succeed together.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!


Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI (inglés alto) - sector Farma
Description:
Si tu objetivo es seguir creciendo profesionalmente en el área de los datos, ésta es tu oferta!




¿Qué puede ofrecerte atSistemas?




👩‍💻Plan de Carrera: Todos nuestros profesionales tienen a su disposición procesos diseñados específicamente para sus funciones dentro de la compañía: modelo de competencias, evaluaciones, planes de formación y certificación, proyectos y eventos.

✈Vacaciones: 22 días laborables + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre (cierre empresa)

✨Formación: Tendrás opciones para formarte en las últimas tecnologías y en INGLES! Además podrás contar con nuestro programa de certificaciones oficiales y las licencias de Udemy Business. Consulta nuestro calendario formativo: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/formacion

🎁Sorpresas: Recibirás sorpresas en momentos especiales

🎈Plan Amigo: Puedes ser Embajador de nuestra marca a través de nuestro Plan Amigo

🌱Quokka: programa de actividades para promover el bienestar emocional, la actividad física, y la nutrición saludable

🏆Club de ventajas: Programa de beneficios y descuentos (ocio, tecnología, bienestar y salud...)

🤍Kudos: Iniciativa para fomentar una cultura de feedback y reconocimiento




¿Qué es relevante? Cuanto más mejor, pero tenemos ofertas tanto nivel medio como senior




- Elaboración de informes y cuadros de mando con Power BI. Conocimiento medio/alto

- Creación de modelos, ETL (extracción, transformación y carga) y transformación de consultas

- Documentación y gestión de evolutivos

Experiencia con Cloud (Redshift)




Es necesario aportar nivel alto de inglés y tener disponibilidad para desplazarte 1 día a la semana a sus oficinas, ubicadas en Barcelona ciudad.







Si te identificas con estos valores, no lo dudes y únete a nuestro equipo!

Title: Data Analyst BI (Barcelona)
Description:
Desde Azertium IT nos gustaría contar con los mejores profesionales del sector, y actualmente, estamos en búsqueda de un Analyst Business Intelligence con al menos 3 años de experiencia laboral, para formar parte de nuestro equipo, con gran desarrollo profesional.




Modalidad de trabajo hibrido (Barcelona).




Requisitos técnicos:




Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Responsable de la definición técnica, desarrollo, ejecución técnica de todos los proyectos de BI




dentro del área de tecnología de la compañía.




Experiencia en entornos analíticos Big Data y de Business Intelligence Tradicional.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ETL/ELT Pentaho.
Experiencia en modelado de datos para soluciones analíticas.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de BI sobre en Power BI.
Experiencia en el uso del entorno de Azure Cloud (Data Lake, Synapse, DataBricks) pero sobre todo en Azure Synapse ya que la actual infraestructura que tenemos.
Conocimientos de SQL SERVER.
Conocimientos de JIRA.
Conocimientos de Python.
Se valorará conocimientos de Navision aunque no es imprescindible




Ofrecemos formación, contrato indefinido, desarrollo y flexibilidad laboral.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) Power BI expert
Description:
Job description:



We are looking for a talented and motivated colleague to join our team in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to drive revenue growth, improve market share, and enhance customer satisfaction. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans, identify new business opportunities, and optimize pricing and product offerings.



The aftermarket environment is undergoing a massive shift in electrified, connected, intelligent, and shared mobility, and we invite you to watch the following keynote speech from our Vice President outlining ZF's exciting new strategy in this space. At ZF, we are looking for talented professionals who are passionate about data-driven innovation and eager to help shape the future of the automotive industry. If you are a driven, curious, and dedicated professional looking to join a dynamic and innovative team. Join ZF and be part of a team that is at the forefront of automotive innovation!



Job Location: Near 22@Barcelona "Districte de la innovació"

Your tasks:



Communicate data in visual ways that are useful for both subject matter experts as well as business users
Transform, improve, and integrate data, depending on the business requirements
Provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance
Acquire understanding of the business needs by asking the right questions
Maintenance and Monitoring – ensure the final products are working seamlessly over time, with continual improvements, while understanding / analyzing the usage and feedback from the user groups



Profile description:



Your profile:



Experience in Mobility / Automotive Aftermarket (or similar business) - is preferred
Experience with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS), and the Structured Query Language (SQL)
Advanced skills in working with data visualization tools (Tableau / Power BI)
Excellent Communication skills
Critical thinking: able to look at numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it’s a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.




Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It’s demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.




In a nutshell, we love what we do and it shows! 😀




THE ROLE




We are looking for an Analytics Specialist, highly motivated self-starter who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and proficient at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment as a data-driven marketer.




You'll be the owner of the technical analytics framework collaborating with Global Digital Director on insights from audiences engaging in other Product tools to inform conversion opportunities and growth, helping ALOHAS to improve and optimize its online marketing activities.




YOUR CHALLENGE




Measure and analyze marketing channel and campaign performance to enhance effectiveness (e.g., Web, SEO, Paid Ads, Affiliates, Email, Social Media, etc.)
Work with the CRO on the design of site experiments, implementing and testing opportunities via Personalization or A/B testing and researching new data sources
Be the owner of the tracking platforms, setup, new implementations, bugs, event creation, etc
Work in Big query to set up queries and extract data
Support the team in implementing additional analytics toolsets
Create a data governance framework and roadmap for analytics, giving guidance where required
Lead the build of cross-channel dashboards through the use of data visualization tools
Support work on integrating digital data with other data sources
Share insights and reports to senior management and other internal stakeholderd
Ensure that analytics data is accurate and there is sufficient monitoring in place to spot issues
Use project management techniques to ensure all changes are delivered on time, to scope and to budget




YOU WILL ROCK AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE




Degree in data science, statistics, computer science, business analytics or related field
Hands-on analytical and measurement experience of digital channels such as Web, SEO, E-mail, Affiliates, Paid Ads, Social Media
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations for stakeholders with varying levels of analytic expertise
Experience with Shopify is an asset
1 year’s experience in an internal/client-facing digital data analysis role
Strong technical abilities and skills specific tool knowledge Google Analytics, Power BI, 365 dynamics, 365 CRM, GTM, Big query and powerapps
Experience with dashboarding and reporting and building end-to-end real-time reporting
Works well cross-functionally to drive tangible business outcomes leveraging analytics




BENEFITS Of Being Part Of ALOHAS




Culture of freedom, diversity & inclusion, and responsibility ✨
Flexible schedule: Fit it into your routine! ⏰
Discounts: You will have special discounts 💯 and we do not forget your family and friends either!
Office: In the heart of Barcelona, in the Gracia neighbourhood, where we take care of coffee ☕ and fruit 🍎
Work remotely: live and work wherever you want 🌍 within the CET time zone!
Home office setup: You will get a laptop + electronic devices like a keyboard, mouse, and second screen 💻
Keep learning with ALOHAS 🎓 We offer English courses to our employees, more languages coming soon!
We take care of your happiness 🌈 and professional growth with constructive feedback 💪
After-work events in Barcelona and Madrid every month 🎉




Ready for the challenge?🚀




About ALOHAS




Want to know more? Video Presentation




Apply to work with us: careers.alohas.io




Our website:alohas.io/ IG: @alohas

Title: Procurement Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities


Overseeing the complete data lifecycle – from data creation and capture, to data processing and usage
Understanding the meaning of data, at a high-level, as well as down to specifics, such as the meaning of the data stored in fields across datasets
Choosing metrics for data quality measurement , depending on the nature of organizational data
Performing statistical tests, running data queries on large datasets to determine data quality and integrity
Monitoring data quality, cleaning data, fixing issues that may arise, and implementing data quality improvement plans
Developing cross DB analytic reports, develop and maintain dashboard
Developing cleansing and enrichment data processes to ensure result accuracy
Documenting data quality assurance processes
Adhering to best practices in data analysis and collection
Evaluating system performance and design, as well as its effect on data quality
Helping co-workers to use data as a competitive advantage and making them data literate
Contribute to continuous improvement efforts to enhance reporting capabilities
Create informative & actionable reports which highlight relevant business process inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.


Skills & Requirements


Bachelor's degree in statistics, information management, business administration or similar.
General knowledge and understanding of procurement fundamentals
At least 5 years of working experience in data analysis and/or Procurement
Expert knowledge in Ariba S2C, P2P and/or Spend Visibility
Solid knowledge of Relational Data bases
Knowledge of Phyton, SQL, R., Julia is an advantage
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills; Creative mindset – and the ability to approach a problem creatively
Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of IT systems
Strong analytic and conceptional skills, affinity for numbers and attention for detail
Knowledge of best practices in data analysis
Proven passion for the data quality discipline; a strong drive for results
Extremely meticulous in approach to work; outstanding attention to detail
Talent for quickly learning new tasks
Good multi-tasking skills
Good influencing skills, strong character, team player
Demonstrated focus for customer satisfaction
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
High proficiency in English; German skill advantageous


What do we offer:


Steady job, you'll get a permanent contract since the first day.
Competitive salary.
Fringe benefits: meal and supplies compensation, life and accident insurance, private pension plan and studies fund. We also offer discounts on other products from the company and shares as well as a Christmas gift card among others. Dare to discover a world of benefits!
Actual work-life balance policies: entry-leave flexibility of 2 hours every day, reduced schedule on Fridays and during the summer, 26 holiday days per year, recoverable working hours, as well as, hybrid workplace model.
Career development: Digital learning platforms, mentoring programs and training sessions give employees the opportunity for personal and professional development.
Relocation Service for international transfers.
Open and international working environment.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Data2Diamond 

Somos un equipo de expertos en analítica de datos, impulsados por la pasión de construir soluciones de análisis de negocios de vanguardia. Ayudamos a los responsables de la toma de decisiones, a entender y analizar sus datos para hacer llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel. Hemos entregado soluciones en toda Europa y EE.UU. para múltiples industrias como la aviación, el comercio minorista, las finanzas y los seguros. 

 

Acerca del puesto de trabajo 

Actualmente, estamos buscando un (Ella/El/Elle) Analista de Datos Senior que liderará las iniciativas de Business Analytics, incluyendo la recopilación de requisitos, análisis exploratorios, visualización de datos y storytelling para presentar los insights a los usuarios finales. 




Lo que harás 

Extraer datos de fuentes primarias y secundarias, evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos, traducir los datos a un formato legible. Utilizar herramientas estadísticas para identificar, analizar e interpretar patrones y tendencias en conjuntos de datos complejos que podrían ser útiles para el diagnóstico y la predicción. 
Colaborar con desarrolladores de ETL, desarrolladores de inteligencia empresarial, científicos de datos y líderes de alto nivel para identificar oportunidades de mejora de procesos, proponer modificaciones del sistema y diseñar estrategias de gobernanza de datos para incorporar las mejores prácticas. 
Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos y examinar los datos para reconocer e identificar patrones. Utilizar técnicas de modelación de datos para crear resúmenes y observaciones clave para líneas de servicio funcionales, por ejemplo, arquitectura de datos, gobernanza de datos, inteligencia empresarial y ciencia de datos. 
Colaborar con el equipo de ciencia de datos para obtener datos externos e introducirlos en el entorno de desarrollo de ciencia de datos. Mantener la instancia de la base de datos de Data Science y todos los conjuntos de datos que se han definido para el análisis. 
Desarrollar y dirigir múltiples proyectos interdepartamentales, establecer relaciones de trabajo eficaces con los grupos de clientes asignados para obtener resultados empresariales. Participar con equipos interfuncionales en los esfuerzos de integración para fusionar plataformas de datos con sistemas y aplicaciones empresariales. 




Lo que buscamos 

Actitud positiva con una gran pasión por aprender y siempre estar abierto a nuevos retos. 
Licenciatura en Informática, Sistemas de Información, Administración de Empresas, Finanzas, Sistemas de Información de Gestión, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería, Estadística, Economía, y / o campo relacionado. 
Mínimo 3 años en Análisis de Datos/Informes, Sistemas de Gestión de la Información, Herramientas de Inteligencia de Negocio, y/o afines. 
Se valorará muy positivamente la experiencia en Analítica Comercial. 
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de programación SQL y Python. 
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de herramientas de Business Intelligence (Preferiblemente Tableau, pero también se valorará experiencia en otras herramientas como Qlik, PowerBI). 
Fuertes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita para Storytelling. 
Nivel avanzado de inglés. 

 

Qué ofrecemos 

Salario competitivo entre 40k y 60k euros/anual. 
Equipo de alto rendimiento. 
Horario de trabajo flexible. 
Programa de aprendizaje continuo. 
Increíbles eventos de Team building. 
Remuneración flexible: seguro médico, tickets restaurante. 




💪💪💪 Únete a nuestro equipo 💪💪💪

Show more Show less
HTML:
Data2Diamond 

Somos un equipo de expertos en analítica de datos, impulsados por la pasión de construir soluciones de análisis de negocios de vanguardia. Ayudamos a los responsables de la toma de decisiones, a entender y analizar sus datos para hacer llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel. Hemos entregado soluciones en toda Europa y EE.UU. para múltiples industrias como la aviación, el comercio minorista, las finanzas y los seguros. 

 

Acerca del puesto de trabajo 

Actualmente, estamos buscando un (Ella/El/Elle) Analista de Datos Senior que liderará las iniciativas de Business Analytics, incluyendo la recopilación de requisitos, análisis exploratorios, visualización de datos y storytelling para presentar los insights a los usuarios finales.

Title: Data Analyst Lead
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Fluidra, a multinational group listed on the Spanish Stock Exchange, is the global leader in the pool and wellness industry. Founded in 1969, Fluidra has long-standing experience in developing innovative products and services in the global residential and commercial pool market.

Fluidra has a clear mission: to create the perfect pool and wellness experience responsibly.

Purpose: You will take responsibility for creating and managing data sets, developing reports, and

troubleshooting data issues.

Support Regional data leads and business areas
Active Listening → Value Proposal → Deliver to customers
Data modelling and ETL process (SQL / SNOWFLAKE/INFORMATICA)
Create Dashboards and Reports (PowerBI)
Build advanced analytics algorithms (Python /R)
Propose new business value added solutions and data uses cases
Training & Engagement of Data users

Duties And Responsibilities

Lead data and analytics squads to develop and maintain a data models and infrastructure using a range of different storage technologies that enables optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from multiple data sources.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet both functional and non-functional business requirements.
Support the development of processes and standards for data mining, data modelling and data protection.
Build analytic tools that identify patterns and trends to deliver insights that can inform effective business decisions
Design and implement continuous process improvements for automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.
Assess and report on the unique data needs of key stakeholders and troubleshoot any data-related technical issues through to resolution.
Work with the broader data and analytics team to improve data models that support business intelligence tools, improve data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making.
Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition

Functions, Activities And Accountabilities

Data Analytics and Sales BI

Project leading
Proactively add value to the business
Data R&D
Data Adoption & Engagement
Project Timing & Budget Control

Skills And Abilities

Business and objective-oriented mindset.
Advanced written, verbal, and analytic skills, and demonstrated ability to influence and facilitate sustained change.
Ability to convey information clearly and concisely to all levels of staff and management about programs, services, best practices, strategies, and organizational mission and values.
Proven ability to focus on priorities, strategies, and vision.
Very Good understanding in Data Foundation initiatives, like Modelling, Data
Quality Management, Data Governance, Data Maturity Assessments and Data Strategy in support of the key business stakeholders.
Actively deliver the roll-out and embedding of Data Foundation initiatives in support of the key business programs advising on the technology and using leading market standard tools.
Coordinate the change management process, incident management and problem management process.
Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition.
Drive implementation efficiency and effectiveness across the pilots and future projects to minimize cost, increase speed of implementation and maximize value delivery

Education: Bachelor’s in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science discipline

Experience: 5 + Years of experience in enterprise-wide data governance, policies, procedures, and implementation

Tools: SQL/Snowflake, Informatica ETL, PowerBI, etc

Languages: A High Level of English and Spanish is mandatory.

Sant Cugat del Vallès

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
Overview




PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world-famous portfolio of brands is sold every day. Our Data & Analytics organization influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the roadmap across all our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world




Join PepsiCo’s Enterprise Data Operations Organization which develops quality data collection processes, maintains the integrity of our data foundations and enables business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.




Your mission




As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key domain expert overseeing PepsiCo's business process and drive a strong discussion for how Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category business needs to be defined and prioritize by working very closely with business leads, data science team and data engineering team. You'll develop an in-depth understanding of business processes in and translate business requirements to data engineering team in technical way.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Discover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data models
Gather and analyze data pertaining to various business processes such as forecasts, capital requirements, inventory, logistic, manufacturing and production capacity to develop supply chain models. geographics, POS, pricing and promotion, store profile, e commerce data to develop channel models.
Create high-level process models (system interface diagrams, workflow & swim lane diagrams, data flow diagrams) to represent processes for the area under analysis
Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
Responsible to improve the quality of data in relation to defined expectations
Perform analysis of system data to identify patterns, exceptions, and erroneous data




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed:




Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain and/or Operations Management is Required, Masters Preferred.
6+ years of experience with data analysis & data profiling in project, business requirements definition or data engineering in CPG or Manufacturing Industry.
5+ years’ work experience in the areas of Distribution Network Analysis, Manufacturing, Production Network Optimization, Transportation, Demand Planning, or other areas related to Supply Chain or other domains such as Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category etc.
4+ years of strong Data Profiling experience & ability to identify trends and anomalies in the data to in-form data model build out.
Experience in working with Datasets from POS Aggregators such as IRI, Nielsen, Kantar etc.
Experience working with structured/unstructured datasets, ability to clearly document and communicate requirement to technical team members.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools, SQLTools.
Strong knowledge and understanding of Supply Chain data elements and processes per the necessary inscope data domain (i.e., Customer, Material, Vendor)
Ability to translate business requirements into critical data dependencies and requirements
Able to challenge and align various stakeholders to a common set of standards
Self-starter with excellent written & verbal communication skills.
Self-learner and eager to understand data, business processes, concepts, and technologies




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability




#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

Title: Data Engineer _ Analytics and Modeling analyst
Description:
There will never be a typical day at Accenture Digital, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Our clients operate at scale in international markets – you’ll be working with famous brands and household names – no worrying about how to explain what you do to your family again!

We are looking for a Data Engineer for our projects in MK Operations

Responsabilities:


Develop Transformation and ETL logic to populate in a Centralized Repository by collecting data from the different sources in different formats.


Experience in Data Extraction, Transforming and Loading ETL between Homogenous and Heterogeneous Systems.


Exposure on development staging production environments.


Requirements:


Bachelors' degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent graduates


Minimum 2 years of experience


Strong data extraction & SQL query skills


Strong understanding of database design technique and dimension modelling.


Strong understanding of Data integration.


Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills.


Strong understanding of Python and Java applied to data processes.


Ability and willingness to acquire knowledge about the new technologies, good analytical and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with individuals at all levels.


Nice to have:


Fluent English


Proficient in implementing all transformations available using GCP tools.


Previous experience on developments with Apache Beam and Apache POI

Show more Show less
HTML:
There will never be a typical day at Accenture Digital, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Our clients operate at scale in international markets – you’ll be working with famous brands and household names – no worrying about how to explain what you do to your family again!

We are looking for a Data Engineer for our projects in MK Operations

Responsabilities:

  • Develop Transformation and ETL logic to populate in a Centralized Repository by collecting data from the different sources in different formats.

  • Experience in Data Extraction, Transforming and Loading ETL between Homogenous and Heterogeneous Systems.

  • Exposure on development staging production environments.

    • Requirements:

  • Bachelors' degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent graduates

  • Minimum 2 years of experience

  • Strong data extraction & SQL query skills

  • Strong understanding of database design technique and dimension modelling.

  • Strong understanding of Data integration.

  • Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong understanding of Python and Java applied to data processes.

  • Ability and willingness to acquire knowledge about the new technologies, good analytical and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with individuals at all levels.

    • Nice to have:

  • Fluent English

  • Proficient in implementing all transformations available using GCP tools.

  • Previous experience on developments with Apache Beam and Apache POI

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we’re passionate about creating the best product, so if you’re looking for an ambitious team that’s revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey: Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000 Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France !

Our values:

Ambition | We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the Qonto Way here .

Our beliefs: Diversity brings success. We actively recruit people from a range of backgrounds, employ inclusive hiring techniques; and work with our external partners to continually increase and improve our DEI initiatives. As a result, we obtained a rating of 87/100 in 2023 for the annual Index of professional equality and are happy to say that 44% of our teams are women.

To follow Qonto's ambition in terms of data we created the Data team, handling Data Analysis, Engineering, and Science. The data department has grown from 5 to 50 people within two years (and we're still hiring)!

Business Intelligence is key in any business and so it is at Qonto! As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the BI team (25 talented business data analysts), and be focused on supporting our growth team to grow our revenues and client base by optimizing the onboarding funnel, acquiring more and better clients, retaining and upselling our existing clients

You will be in charge of enabling functional teams in their decisions with self-service data monitoring and alerting.

⛳️ As Senior Data Analyst - Acquisition at Qonto, you will

Define the right performance indicators to help the business team measure without bias the performance of their teams, initiatives, or product features
Build Dashboards and cockpits that allow each business team to pinpoint abnormalities in the performance.
Monitor KPIs proactively and raise alerts to business teams when abnormalities happen.
Build and scale the data analytics stack: Write advanced SQL queries to build data marts and support best practices in developing documentation and training to enable self-serve analytics for functional team


🚀 Example of our projects

Build the acquisition cockpit to monitor the attributed volumes, spending, and value of our client acquisition strategy
Monitor the OKRs of our 4 markets (FR, DE, IT, and ES) to help Country directors to steer their teams
Build the monitoring of the retention of our clients once they started paying their subscriptions and deep dive into the reason for churn
Monitor the drops on the onboarding funnel starting from the website, through the register with both products & ops teams


🔥 What You Can Expect

Work in a fast-paced multicultural environment with a strong focus on quality
Be autonomously in charge of your own project passing through all stages: understanding business needs, data modeling, and visualizing data.
Find solutions for the business needs of different departments: Finance, Growth, Operations, Strategy, Product
Share Knowledge: across the whole tech team (internal & external talk, weekly meetings, tech monthly) and the community (articles & Meetups)


⚙️ The stack we mainly use

Warehouse and SQL: Snowflake ❄️
ETL: Airflow & DBT
Data Visualization: Tableau & Metabase


🤝 About Your Future Manager

Omar is in charge of 2 Data Analyst teams: Growth & Strategy/People.

Their Background?


After passing through french companies both in the airline & e-commerce industries, Omar grew Qonto’s Data Analysts team from 4 generalists to 20+ DA split into 5 specialized teams. He also reached to build robust guidelines for Qonto’s Data project management, Data Visualization, and QA standards.

What do they bring to the team?


Together with the Lead Data Analysts, Omar promotes healthy communication between team members, continuously improves the team’s operating system, accelerates all team members’ growth towards proficiency... and chases all sources of waste which can bring down the team’s morale and velocity!

🏅About You

Experience: You have at least 3 years of experience in data analysis, ideally in a start-up, tech, or consulting environment. You are familiar with attribution models, and marketing campaign data and you know the difference between Front End events tracking and back-end data. Experience with a/b testing is a plus

Business & solution-oriented mindset : You are able to understand business problems, curious to dive into detailed data, yet able to zoom out and see the big picture, which allows you to provide actionable insights to your business partners across varied scopes.

You have excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt messaging to technical and non-technical audiences.

Mastery: You are eager to improve. You know how to understand stakeholder challenges. You have a strong command of SQL, Data modeling, Data visualization. Knowledge of Tableau is a huge plus.

Languages : You speak English

Qonto is an open-minded company. Don’t tick all the boxes? Apply and we’ll let you know if we think you could fit the role. You never know ☺️

🎁 Perks

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed…

A central fully-renovated building in Barcelona with WeWork services
Monthly team events
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for
23 days of paid leave + 5 additional days of paid leave
Alan ( Seguro ) health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health and gym access with Urban Sports Club
An Edenred lunch card: 100% covered
50% public transportation reimbursement
A progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners


💪 Our hiring process:

Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised 486M€ in our Series D to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future here .

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Business Insider | Metropoli Abierta | Europa Press

Title: Data Strategy Senior Analyst
Description:
Overview




#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain




With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data allowing PepsiCo’s leaders to solve business problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.




As a member of the Strategy & Ecosystem team, the Enterprise Data Strategy Senior Analyst is responsible for researching, analyzing and supporting the development of global data strategy for PepsiCo.




This role joins the Enterprise Data Strategy team and will lead strategy projects. The role helps to align PepsiCo’s data strategy, with the strategic goals of the enterprise and the rapid development of data capability within the industry . The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of the value of all types of data assets, and have skills and experience in data and AI strategy, data products, data management and how these relate to business strategy.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Be responsible for the development of Enterprise Data strategy research projects, through the research, synthesis, analysis and evaluation of different elements of the data lifecycle
Create strategic approaches that enable the application of these elements into the PepsiCo business.
Lead cross-section data strategy discussions, develop data strategy roadmaps in conjunction with other teams in PepsiCo D+A and across broader PepsiCo’s portfolio – a highly matrixed organization – resulting in value-add and scalable plans to support the business with enterprise data
Communicate our data strategy to/with stakeholders, internal and external, developing clear and concise message that reflects the complexity of approach but ensures the strategy is clear and assessable for non-technical leaders
Partner with subject matter experts across delivery functions to validate business needs and create a baseline understanding of the as-is




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed?




Minimum 5 years working in strategy driven business functions
Minimum 3 years experience working within data lifecycle areas (data strategy, data management, governance, data science)
Experience consulting in Strategy preferred, ideally working with large, multinational enterprises
Bachelor’s Degree required
Master’s degree preferred




Skills, Abilities, Knowledge




Strong strategic thinking and analysis
Presentation and communication skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences
Deep knowledge in researching and creating strategy and position papers for senior and executive leaders
Deep knowledge of data products, the possibilities of AI and execution with CPG use cases
Working knowledge of common data science capabilities and techniques




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Sobre el rol, si tuviese que compartir un par de pinceladas, diria que estamos buscando un perfil backend que tenga esta vision integral end-to-end del proceso de ingenieria de datos, implementacion de modelos de datawarehousing, y experiencia en el uso de herramientas de automarizacion de ETLs.







- Contratacion directa con cliente final.
- Modalidad 100% Remoto desde cualquier lugar de España.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?




Onebox, líder en el desarrollo de tecnología para la venta de entradas de espectáculos y actividades de ocio, está en búsqueda de un nuevo compañero de equipo, un BI Specialist.




Nos encontramos en Barcelona y nuestro modelo de negocio nació para devolver a los organizadores de la industria del entretenimiento el control total sobre sus eventos, gracias a una plataforma innovadora con la que poder gestionar la venta de entradas de manera centralizada.




Los pilares de nuestra filosofía son: Innovación, Servicio al Cliente, Espíritu de Equipo y Atención a la Calidad. Para conseguirlo trabajamos con metodologías ágiles para el desarrollo de nuestro producto ¡Buscamos a profesionales que compartan el interés por la agilidad!




Si eres una persona motivada, enérgica, con ganas de trabajar en una empresa líder y en expansión

internacional, donde el ambiente de trabajo es dinámico, con posibilidad de aprender diariamente y

desarrollar tu carrera profesional ¡eres la persona que buscamos!




Puedes encontrar más información sobre nosotros en nuestra web oneboxtds.com




¿A quién buscamos?




Estamos en búsqueda de un nuevo compañero para el equipo de Business Intelligence. Un profesional motivado para desarrollar herramientas de toma de decisión, análisis y reporting.




A partir de la información existente en las bases de datos de negocio, el ámbito en el que opera el equipo incluye desde la creación, mantenimiento y mejora de los procesos de ETL hasta la explotación de la información obtenida y el mantenimiento y desarrollo del sistema de reporting interno y externo.




Tu día a día incluirá actividades como:




● Diseño y mantenimiento de procesos ETL (Extraction-Transformation-Load) para consolidar la información en el Data Warehouse (Almacén de datos)

● Diseño de modelos de datos en función de los requerimientos recibidos tanto de usuarios

internos como externos

● Modelización dentro de Microstrategy

● Diseño de informes, dashboards (cuadros de mando) y toda aquella solución para la

presentación/análisis de información que el cliente solicite

● Mantenimiento de la solución actual

● Diseño y ejecución parcial/inicial de las pruebas sobre el software desarrollado

● Mejoras de rendimiento del proceso de ETL y ejecución de informes




¿Qué skills valoramos?




Hard Skills:

● Conocimiento de herramientas de referencia en el ámbito de BI

● Conocimientos en SQL

● Conocimientos en bases de datos

● Formación en Desarrollo Software

● Inglés nivel conversación

Soft Skills:

● Buena comunicación

● Jugador de equipo

● Atención al detalle




¿Qué tecnologías usamos?




Nuestro ecosistema de BI se basa en las siguientes tecnologías:

● Microstrategy

● Talend

● Lenguajes de programación R, Python y Java

● Amazon Redshift como DHW (Data Ware House)

● MySQL, Oracle y Couchbase / Elasticsearch como motores de datos transaccionales desde los

que extraemos la información para nuestro DWH

● Github como sistema de control de versiones

● Nuestros scripts de ETL funcionan sobre servidores Linux




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Para Onebox la prioridad son nuestros trabajadores. Ofrecemos una serie de beneficios para ayudar a mantener un buen ambiente de trabajo.




Ofrecemos flexibilidad horaria de entrada, entre las 8 horas y las 10 horas. Así como un horario intensivo los viernes (6 horas), para poder disfrutar antes del fin de semana.




Posibilidad de trabajar un día a la semana desde la oficina y el resto de los días desde casa. Además de contar con fruta fresca en la oficina, masajes, gympass, seguro médico co-financiado, retribución flexible (restaurante/transporte y/o guardería), paquete formativo, entradas gratis para acudir a espectáculos, afterworks y dos eventos anuales, etc.




Si quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo, ¡no dudes en dejarnos tu candidatura!

Show more Show less

Ofrecemos flexibilidad horaria de entrada, entre las 8 horas y las 10 horas. Así como un horario intensivo los viernes (6 horas), para poder disfrutar antes del fin de semana.


Posibilidad de trabajar un día a la semana desde la oficina y el resto de los días desde casa. Además de contar con fruta fresca en la oficina, masajes, gympass, seguro médico co-financiado, retribución flexible (restaurante/transporte y/o guardería), paquete formativo, entradas gratis para acudir a espectáculos, afterworks y dos eventos anuales, etc.


Si quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo, ¡no dudes en dejarnos tu candidatura!

Title: Credit Data Analyst with English and Power BI - PageGroup SSC
Description:
Great opportunity to boost your career in Finance!|International Company SSC in Barcelona




About Our Client




At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.




PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.




In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally. Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre




Job Description




Being based in our Barcelona Shared Services Centre within the Order-to-Cash department, the role supports the creation and growth of a global team in charge of credit & litigation management. The position aims to provide support to the regional credit teams through data analysis, reporting & efficiency improvement. In the first few months the role will be dedicated to support the launch/stabilization of the activities and will evolve to data-driven/reporting activity.




Support customer data collection process (optimization of the credit application)
Extract information & data from the different systems (Sales, Finance & PowerBI)
Work with the credit bureau to interpret, automate & integrate data within reporting
Ensure data accuracy & consistency to ensure correctness of credit risk & litigation reporting
Work closely with the different stakeholders (Project team, IT, Credit Managers, local finance business partner) in order to design, maintain, automate and optimize PowerBI reports
Prepare monthly, quarterly and adhoc credit & litigation report, KPIs & analysis to be reviewed by the regional credit managers
Investigate inconsistencies, answer queries from the credit managers & resolve them in collaboration with the different teams
Produce mass credit scoring to be reviewed by the credit manager
Manage credit risk alert received from credit bureau
When needed produce Market & business risk report
Participate in Finance improvement projects through supporting the implementation of new processes, tools automation and best practices.
The Successful Applicant
Administrative, data analyst degree or
Ideally prior experience in:
working in finance/O2C and shared service center environment
collaborating effectively with international team/cross-team to deliver
Good knowledge of all core MS Office applications, especially
Knowledge in powerBi will be a plus
Analytical, problem-solving mindset understanding on how to handle, resolve issues
Dynamic, organized with a methodical
Proven ability to work independently and take
Continuous improvement mindset
Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent
Excellent communication
Fluency in English is a must
What's on Offer




Experience in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options
Contact: Dogukan Akin

Title: Consultor Power BI
Description:
Job Description

Buscamos gente como tú: ¡Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar más lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compañía Top Employer, te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro día a día!

¿Quieres recibir formación en últimas tecnologías y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?

¿Quieres trabajar en un ambiente dinámico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnología de última generación y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?

Buscamos en cualquier localización a varios Consultores Power BI , apasionados por los datos en todas sus formas y procesos. Extracción, transformación, procesamiento y visualización.

Imprescindible


Experto en PowerBI, tanto en las áreas de visualización, como especialmente, modelado
Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor,)
Optimización de rendimiento en PowerBI
Utilización de Data Warehouses y modelización usando metodologías Kimball/Inmon
Experiencia en entornos empresariales complejos y con grandes volumetrías de datos
Trabajo en equipo usando frameworks agile
Interlocución con áreas de negocio
Comunicación en inglés
Proactividad y ganas de aportar.


Deseable


Experiencia usando PowerBI en escenarios de tiempo real/streaming
Conocimiento de otras herramientas de la Power Platform (PowerAutomate, PowerApps)
Experiencia en plataformas de Datos cloud (Snowflake, Azure Synapse,..)


¿Qué beneficios ofrecemos en Avanade?


Horario que te permitirá conciliar vida laboral y personal.
Participación en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional.
Una atractiva remuneración compuesta por un salario bruto anual y un programa de beneficios corporativos y retribución flexible.


Puedes revisar la lista completa de beneficios en el siguiente enlace: benefits-spain.pdf (avanade.com)

¿Estás interesado? ¡Inscríbete ahora!

Te esperamos ¡Avanade es tu compañía!

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .
