Description:
Centria sigue creciendo.




En Centria Tecnología somos un equipo de personas donde nuestros principales valores son la profesionalidad, la transparencia y la cercanía a nuestros clientes.




Estamos ampliando nuestro equipo técnico y buscamos un persona con experiencia en PowerBI, con ganas de integrarse en nuestro equipo de Datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones en Centria?

-   Colaborar en Proyectos con Power Platform, especialmente Power BI y entornos datawarehouse.

-   Participar en la implantación de proyectos de clientes

-   Creación de laboratorios de nuevas funcionalidades

-   Ayudar en la documentación y organización del departamento.




¿Que necesitamos?

-   Experiencia en PowerBI de al menos 2 años, tanto en las áreas de ETL, visualización, como modelado

-   Optimización de rendimiento en PowerBI

-   Proactividad, ganas de aportar y de aprender.




Si tienes experiencia en los siguientes campos, se valorará:

-   Creación de entornos datawarehouse.

-   Conocimientos lenguaje DAX, DAX Studio o Tabular Editor

-   Conocimientos resto de Power platflorm(Power Automate, Power Apps)

-   Conocimientos de Python




Ofrecemos

•   Contrato indefinido.

•   Excelente ambiente de trabajo donde poder desarrollarse profesionalmente.

•   Formación de producto y servicios

•   Parking




Esperamos verte pronto

Title: DATA ENGINEER
HTML:
Join us at Allianz and become a part of a team that is making a difference in people's lives.

We're seeking individuals with a passion for big data and a drive to deliver insights that truly help people during their toughest times.

What are you going to do in Allianz? 

  • Engage directly with stakeholders to understand their needs;
  • Work in a highly collaborative team to find solutions to business problems,
  • Contribute to the solutions at the backend of the data stack, from ETL to data modelling. Also, including frontend, like dashboards;
  • Take ownership and responsibility for the quality of the solutions and ensure best practices are used;
  • Learn new technical skills and help the team succeed;
  • Collaborate with other teams within the Allianz Group.

What does Allianz need from you? 
  • Strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, IT engineering or similar;
  • Fluency in English and Spanish;
  • Previous experienice in Data Engineering roles;
  • Excellent SQL and query optimization skills and good understanding of data modelling techniques;
  • Solid Python programming and experience building data pipelines;
  • Azure or experience with other cloud vendors;
  • Ability to understand business needs and turn them into meaningful data products;
  • Self-starter with a drive and curious mindset;
  • Willingness to step outside their comfort zone to broaden skills and learn new technologies;
  • High level of collaboration and open to sharing knowledge and feedback.
  • Bonus skills include:
    • Experience with CI/CD automation and tools like Github Actions;
    • Experience with Luigi/Airflow;
    • Experience with BI and Analytics tools such as PowerBI;
    • Experience with Docker, K8s;
    • Experience with Insurance and SAS language;
    • Exposure to Agile workplace.

What does Allianz offer you?

  • A hybrid working model;
  • Offices that adapt to your needs, with a smart working model and collaborative spaces;
  • Flexible hours so that you can have a good balance between your personal and work life;
  • Specific training in your field of activity and You Learn We Pay program;
  • Multiple employee discounts in sports centers - mens sana in corpore sano;
  • Financial compensation for lunch and teleworking expenses;
  • Special prices in our insurance products for you and your family;
  • Many more benefits...

24397 | Ingeniería informática y tecnológica | Profesional / Senior | Non-Executive | Allianz Spain | Jornada completa | Indefinido

El Grupo Allianz es una de las compañías asesguradoras y de gestión de activos de mayor confianza en el mundo. Cuidar a nuestros empleados, sus ambiciones, sueños y desafíos, es lo que nos convierte en un empleador único. Juntos podemos construir un entorno en el que todos se sientan empoderados y con la confianza para explorar, crecer y dar forma a un futuro mejor para nuestros clientes y el mundo que nos rodea.

En Allianz creemos en una plantilla diversa e inclusiva y estamos orgullosos de ser un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Te animamos a dar lo mejor de ti en el trabajo, sin importar de dónde eres, tu aspecto, a quién amas o en qué crees.

Por lo tanto, consideramos solicitudes de empleo independientemente de su origen étnico o cultural, edad, género, nacionalidad, religión, capacidad diferente u orientación sexual.

Únete a nosotros. Let´s care for tomorrow.

Nota: La diversidad de mentes es una parte integral de la cultura empresarial de Allianz. Una forma de lograr equipos diversos es a través de la rotación regular de los empleados Executive de Allianz entre funciones, entidades de Allianz y geografías . Por lo tanto, la compañía espera de sus empleados una apertura general y una alta motivación para cambiar de puesto con regularidad y recopilar experiencias en todo el Grupo Allianz ".

Title: Senior Game Data Analyst
Description:
At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success.

As the Senior Game Data Analyst, you will work closely with game teams to help inform decision-making regarding features of the game, balancing, player interactions, finding hidden opportunities and much more.

Your Future at Tilting Point

Analyze large, complex datasets to address ad-hoc and long-term operational and strategic business questions
Draw meaningful conclusions and provide actionable insights from data to shape and influence in-game features, economies, and future product roadmaps
Own the taxonomy for game data, ensuring all key performance metrics are measurable and can be analyzed efficiently.
Present analytical findings as both written communication and visual representations that are clear, concise, and understandable, to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Build relationships with stakeholders and processes around data deliverables to ensure data driven decisions can be made at all levels across Tilting Point
Collaborate with all teams at Tilting Point, driving and supporting data and analytics related projects with game team, User Acquisition, Marketing, Engineering, and more


Your XP & Skills

Effectively communicate in English across verbal and written form.
University degree (BA or BS) in Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field
3+ years of work experience as a data analyst or scientist, supporting consumer-facing products, mobile app/game preferred
Proficient with SQL
2+ years with Python/R a plus
Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau
Familiarity with PySpark and/or Amplitude a plus
Passionate about mobile/social gaming with a good understanding of the market.


Location

This position is 100% hybrid from Spain, preferably in the Barcelona area.

What We Offer

Unlimited Vacation Policy, on top of the 23 official vacation days.
Home office expenses bonus & WFH setup support
Wellness & Sports monthly allowance
Daily Meal allowance [Flexoh]
Flexible retribution program for Childcare and Public Transportation [Flexoh]
Private Health Insurance, covering you and your first family circle (Partner, Children) [DKV Integral Elite]
Training & Development support
Sabbatical program for your 5th and 10th anniversary at Tilting Point
4 Office Closing days, on top of the regular Bank Holidays (distributed throughout the year)
Spanish, Catalan and English group language lessons (online)
Annual Tax Declaration aid bonus
Work time reduction for new parents upon returning from Parental Leave
Office in Gracia with drinks, coffee, healthy snacks, plug & play set up, and events.


Interested? We would love to hear from you!

All submissions are confidential.

Direct applicants only - No agencies/headhunters.

Tilting Point provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, promotion, termination, time off, and compensation.

  • When needed produce Market & business risk report
  • Participate in Finance improvement projects through supporting the implementation of new processes, tools automation and best practices.
The Successful Applicant
  • Administrative, data analyst degree or
  • Ideally prior experience in:
    • working in finance/O2C and shared service center environment
    • collaborating effectively with international team/cross-team to deliver
  • Good knowledge of all core MS Office applications, especially
  • Knowledge in powerBi will be a plus
  • Analytical, problem-solving mindset understanding on how to handle, resolve issues
  • Dynamic, organized with a methodical
  • Proven ability to work independently and take
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent
  • Excellent communication
  • Fluency in English is a must
What's on Offer


  • Experience in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options
Contact: Dogukan Akin


Quote job ref: JN-032023-5983217

Title: Data Partnerships Senior Analyst – Insights
Description:
Overview




With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data allowing PepsiCo’s leaders to solve business problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.




As a member of the Strategy & Ecosystem team, the Senior Analyst of Data Partnerships – Insights will be a key player on the emerging Global Data Partnerships team. This role will develop and leverage/manage strategic data partnerships, data acquisition, data asset optimization, data acquisition efficiencies and innovative solutions to drive business value, speed, and impact.




This is a strategic and dynamic role that is positioned to drive effectiveness creating value through centralized data partner management and data acquisition, with close collaboration across Commercial, Procurement, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Information Technology, Governance and more (navigating account team through to contract and incorporation planning).




Moreover, this person will support building capabilities and best practices in data acquisition and data partner management by bringing together a deep understanding about CPG business and partner assets.




This role will manage a subset of Commercial data partnerships focused on Insights, internal customers and the Enterprise Master Data Management Team and Enterprise Data Governance Team.




Responsibilities




Your day with us:




Help support building a Global Partnerships Center




Manage an assigned group of existing data partnerships
Assist with the onboarding of new data partnerships, assets and tools
Optimize partner asset mix to produce best-in-class solutions




Support building the Global Data Acquisition Strategy & Governance




Determine if existing data partnerships meet the needs of the Commercial organization
Proactively research and understand the global landscape and identify new data opportunities.
Ensure existing data partnerships are delivering quality data, on time and without issues




Help Implement Strategy & Drive Customer Satisfaction




Support the Strategy & Transformation Product Portfolio created out of existing or purposely acquired data that can be used to improve decision making and intelligent action by consumers, the enterprise or other organizations
Support ensuring the Data Partner offers a satisfying service to the business in a timely manner and proactively helps our business partners chose the most effective and valuable External Data Products




Optimize Data Acquisition




Help manage and optimize the respective relationships/contracts with our current and emerging vendors, including third party agreements, data sharing and contracts
Help identify and raise redundancies in data acquisitions and redundancy in resources who are involved in this activity




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed:




Minimum 4 years experience managing data partnerships in the insights, syndicated, research or similar space
Minimum 4 years data management experience (data automation, data quality, data governance, data stewardship)
Minimum 3 years experience in CPG goods industry experience, or related
Commercial, Legal and Regulatory basic knowledge with respect to data acquisition and usage.
Bachelor’s Degree, Masters a plus
Experience with building strategic relationships with partners, leading to valuable business outcomes
Understanding of various types of external data, including retail audit data, transaction data, consumer/household panel, traditional consumer demographic data, category trends and forecasting and more
Exposure to risk assessment and legal reviews of vendor contracts and licensing agreements related to external data
Demonstrated analytics skills and use of multiple software tools
Relevant business experience in meta data management/governance
Contractual Negotiations
Strategic Contract/Account/Vendor Management




Differentiating Competencies Required




Robust data knowledge in CPG industry
Metadata Management and Governance
Knowledge of Consumer Privacy Laws at the Global, Regional and Local Levels
Knowledge of Data Privacy Laws at the Global, Regional, and Local Levels
Willingness to learn
Can operate in a fast moving, changing environment
Advance Negotiation Skills




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world, competing with American-based Liftoff and Korean-based Moloco, both in the pre-IPO stage and averaging about $500M in yearly revenues.




We are looking for a Junior Programmatic Ad Operations Analyst with strong Microsoft Excel and analytics experience to join our Ad Operations team. Working alongside our Programmatic Campaign Managers, the candidate should have a mix of business-oriented and analytical mindset, to understand the short and long term challenges the mobile advertising campaigns are facing, and use the tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them and create the most effective strategies and algorithms to help improve the Smadex platform!




The role is based in Barcelona.




Your tasks and responsibilities:




Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behavior of millions of mobile users worldwide to address strategic and operational questions
Obtain insights from our campaign portfolio, in order to make decisions that will directly impact our revenue-making options
Develop tools and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company
Manage and monitor programmatic User Acquisition campaigns' performance on a regular basis, striving to consistently refine tactics and produce exceptional results for our customers




Skills and requirements:




1+ year of experience in a similar role is a big plus
Bachelor or Master's Degree in Business, Marketing or Engineering
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Working knowledge of SQL would be a great plus
Comfort working in large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Python/R experience is a plus
Knowledge of digital programmatic buying is a great plus
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze key metrics to optimize campaigns and meet client’s KPIs
Ability to adapt and adjust to regular changes in priorities and focus based on campaigns' performance
Proven ability to solve data-related problems using creative thinking
Desire to build the biggest company in the world




Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.




What is in it for you:




Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona in a penthouse office with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home, flexible hours
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Tickets Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 27 countries
Exposure to leading global app publishers (Zynga, King, Rovio, EA, etc.) and media partners in the digital advertising industry
And more!




Powered by JazzHR

Title: Científico de datos
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

En ADAPTICAL proveemos al sistema educativo de soluciones innovadores para mejorar la educación.

 

¡Nuestro primer producto está revolucionando la educación! Mathew es una solución transversal que permite a los centros formativos:

1.    La gestión íntegra de materiales a través de contenido propio.

2.    La generación de actividades basándose en el contenido.

3.    El ahorro de tiempo en la preparación de actividades para sus clases.

Además, Mathew permite generar contenido propio de forma automática, ahorrando tiempo y consiguiendo un salto tecnológico digitalizando su contenido.

 

Somos una startup innovadora y donde el buen ambiente de trabajo y la confianza rigen el día a día. Actualmente contamos con un equipo joven, dinámico y en constante crecimiento. Nuestra sede central está ubicada en Sant Cugat (Barcelona).




¡Te buscamos a ti!

Si… Eres una persona:

Proactiva
Perseverante
Eficiente
Decisiva
Creativa
Innovadora
Orientada a resultados
Con vocación por aprender
Con ganas de conocer las últimas novedades de la IA

 

Esperamos de ti que puedas liderar la implantación de la IA en nuestros productos, permitiéndonos continuar a la vanguarda tecnológica.

 

 Es por ello, que debes tener:

Título de doctorado (PhD) en el ámbito de la IA, ingeniería informática, matemáticas, física o similares.
Conocimientos y experiencia en ML, DL, y NLP/NLG.

 

Valoramos positivamente:

Publicaciones científicas
Experiencia laboral
Colaboración en proyectos Open Source o retos de Kaggle o similares
Conocimientos sobre predicción de series temporales
Conocer las bases del graphDB
Conocimientos de explicabilidad de la IA
Experiencia trabajando con metodologías ágiles
Conocer técnicas de RL
Programación en Python




¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Trabajarás dentro del equipo de tecnología
Deberás desarrollar un proyecto de innovación junto a un equipo de otras cinco personas.
Al ser un proyecto innovador, deberás estar al día de las últimas novedades de la IA, para ser capaz de crear tecnología disruptiva.
Junto al equipo, deberás ser creativo para diseñar sistemas de IA que resuelvan retos que todavía no se han abordado.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido
Trabajo híbrido (2 días presencial en la oficina y 3 en remoto)
Posibilidad de crecimiento dentro de la empresa
Buen ambiente
Un entorno y un equipo basado en la confianza en las personas y la comunicación desde la honestidad y el respeto

Title: Data Science Sr Analyst
Description:
Overview




Are you interested in a career in Data Science in PepsiCo? Are you passionate about Data Science and into our organization?




Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: join us as the next Data Science Sr Analyst.




Working with inspiring and experienced colleagues, you'll find that the atmosphere in our office in Barcelona or Vitoria is informal and engaging. With an active, get-things-done culture, this is a place where your dynamism and agility will make a difference.




Your mission:




You will be part of a growing team to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo around topics related with Finance Management, Revenue Management, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Logistics. You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work with process owners, product owners and final business users. As a member of the Data Science team, you will explore and analyze financial data to attain a deep understanding of it, both from data science and from a business perspective. This will enable you to create accurate forecasting models as well as to explain the insights of the results obtained to the business stakeholders.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Explore and analyze financial data to gain powerful insights, both from a data science as from a business perspective
Create, evaluate, compare and improve forecasting models to attain a business-grade AI forecast of financial variables
Integrate your forecasting models into the existing DataOps/MLOps environment so that they are scalable, robust and production-ready
Explain your findings and conclusions both to a Data Science audience as well as to a business audience. Always keep in mind the business relevance of your work
Integrate into a multidisciplinary team, collaborate with other members to improve the overall team efficiency and results
Supervise the models in production to detect failures or performance issues
Create and maintain documentation for insights and knowledge transfer
Research and apply novel technologies that may improve the existing processes




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed?




Building complete solutions in machine learning, including data exploration, model design and evaluation, and deployment in production years)
Statistical/ML techniques and concepts. Python, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, SQL
Experience with Azure and/or DataBricks is a big plus
Experience with time series forecasting is a plus
Experience with financial forecasting is a plus
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format.
Agile methodology for team work and analytics 'product' creation




What makes us different?




Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Flexible work schedule
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Space to be you to promote our Diversity & Inclusion strategy




Being you at PepsiCo:




PepsiCo is an equal opportunity employer, committed to helping people lead healthier lives and supports workforce diversity. We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.




Planet + People:




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is how we’ll transform the way we create value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people in the global food system.

Title: DATA ENGINEER (CLIENTE FINAL)
Description:
Sebastián Consultores, Headhunter especializado en perfiles tecnológicos, selecciona para importante empresa nacional orientada a servicios de geomarketing y bigdata, un DATA ENGINEER para ampliar el departamento de tecnología.




La persona seleccionada se encargará de:




Diseño de Arquitectura de Datos y procesos de ETL
Construcción y mantenimiento de estructuras de datos. Velar por las políticas de datos de la compañía.
Sincronización con los datos resultantes de los clientes en cada una de las integraciones del producto..
Mantener los programas desarrollados, procurando una continua mejora de los mismos y solventando problemas que limiten su eficiencia.
Colaborar en el diseño técnico de las aplicaciones con los analistas.
Satisfacer las políticas y prácticas relativas a la seguridad de la información




Se ofrece:




Contratación directa por cliente final.
Contrato indefinido.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo (50%) y horario de entrada flexible.
Ambiente laboral técnico. Estructura plana donde se pueden aportar ideas y conocimientos.
Ubicación: Barcelona. Zona L´ Antiga Esquerra de L´ Eixample
Salario Fijo (50-55K) + beneficios sociales (Seguro médico, tickets restaurant, formación…).




Requisitos:




El perfil que buscamos:




Formación Académica: Grado en informática o Matemáticas. Se valorarán otro tipo de formación relacionada con el puesto.




Experiencia de, al menos, 4 años en el desarrollo de las funciones con:




Dominio de Ingeniería de datos a través de Python y SQL.
Conocimientos DataCloud: Snowflake.
Domino con desarrollos de ETL y Statistical Programming.
Experiencia demostrable con Pipeline de Datos y herramientas de catálogos de datos.
Experiencia en diseño de modelos analíticos y Data Visualization.
Conocimientos de Machine Learning y Analítica Predictiva.
Metodologías Agiles (SCRUM, Kanban)




Se valorará:




Nivel de inglés alto.
Conocimientos sobre Geomarketing, geoposicionamiento y mejoras funcionales sobre producto tecnológico.

HTML:
Sebastián Consultores, Headhunter especializado en perfiles tecnológicos, selecciona para importante empresa nacional orientada a servicios de geomarketing y bigdata, un DATA ENGINEER para ampliar el departamento de tecnología.


La persona seleccionada se encargará de:


  • Diseño de Arquitectura de Datos y procesos de ETL
  • Construcción y mantenimiento de estructuras de datos. Velar por las políticas de datos de la compañía.
  • Sincronización con los datos resultantes de los clientes en cada una de las integraciones del producto..
  • Mantener los programas desarrollados, procurando una continua mejora de los mismos y solventando problemas que limiten su eficiencia.
  • Colaborar en el diseño técnico de las aplicaciones con los analistas.
  • Satisfacer las políticas y prácticas relativas a la seguridad de la información


Se ofrece:


  • Contratación directa por cliente final.
  • Contrato indefinido.
  • Posibilidad de teletrabajo (50%) y horario de entrada flexible.
  • Ambiente laboral técnico. Estructura plana donde se pueden aportar ideas y conocimientos.
  • Ubicación: Barcelona. Zona L´ Antiga Esquerra de L´ Eixample
  • Salario Fijo (50-55K) + beneficios sociales (Seguro médico, tickets restaurant, formación…).


Requisitos:


El perfil que buscamos:


Formación Académica: Grado en informática o Matemáticas. Se valorarán otro tipo de formación relacionada con el puesto.


Experiencia de, al menos, 4 años en el desarrollo de las funciones con:


  • Dominio de Ingeniería de datos a través de Python y SQL.
  • Conocimientos DataCloud: Snowflake.
  • Domino con desarrollos de ETL y Statistical Programming.
  • Experiencia demostrable con Pipeline de Datos y herramientas de catálogos de datos.
  • Experiencia en diseño de modelos analíticos y Data Visualization.
  • Conocimientos de Machine Learning y Analítica Predictiva.
  • Metodologías Agiles (SCRUM, Kanban)


Se valorará:


  • Nivel de inglés alto.
  • Conocimientos sobre Geomarketing, geoposicionamiento y mejoras funcionales sobre producto tecnológico.

Title: Data Analytics and IT testing Engineer
Description:
Data Analytics and IT testing Engineer

Location: Rubí / Barcelona

Start: Immediate

Type of Role: Full Time / Permanent

Travel: 25% (within COVID restriction/caution)




About Submer

Submer Technologies provides a revolutionary computing liquid immersion cooling solution for HPC, hyperscalers and datacenters that saves CAPEX and OPEX. Our multinational talented team has a huge passion in reducing IT environmental footprint and expertise in datacenter design and day-to-day operation.




About the Role and the Candidate

The successful candidate will be responsible for analysing data and designing, implementing, and executing plans to test IT equipment.




Responsabilities

Validation of structured and unstructured data with focus on achieving superior data quality to enable meaningful analytics
Run and execute tests for IT hardware
Record tests results and generate synthesis reports
Define and document new testing and validation procedures for various IT equipment




Candidate Specific Competences

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field (completed or in progress)
Experience of 5 years
Experience in documenting testing results and realize data analytics to present results to third parties
An ability to adapt to support customers & colleagues, a "Can Do approach" to problem solving
Works well both on their own when trained, as well as support other teams in Submer
Fluent English and Spanish, other languages very valuable




Other Skills

Hands on work
Autonomous and team worker
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Analytical and creative skills. Able to share new ideas and provide technical solutions.
Proactive, highly motivated and ability to work in a fast-paced environment




Benefits

Competitive compensation pack
Great work environment
Career path evolution
Restaurant Pass Card




We hope to have piqued your interest and would love to speak to suitable candidates. If you can imagine yourself working with Submer or know of the right person, please let us know by sending an email with your resume to: talent@submer.com with the subject: Data Analytics and IT testing Engineer. We look forward to welcoming you to the team!




Who we are hiring

Join us in our continuous quest to grow a diverse and extraordinarily innovative team!

Submer is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (Biosimilars)
Description:
We are seeking a motivated Healthcare Research & Data Analyst to join the talented Biosimilars team at Clarivate.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insight generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

The Analyst will translate subject matter expertise expertise and market research data into targeted insights for key decision-makers within the biopharmaceutical industry. Areas of coverage will span the team’s diverse and intellectually stimulating research portfolio in oncology, immunology, endocrinology, nephrology, and other therapeutic areas.

If you have passion for the dynamic oncology landscape and excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


Advanced degree (MA, MBA, MPH, MS, or PhD in life/medical sciences or social) and/or relevant experience in the pharma, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors.
Experience in modeling and forecasting pharmaceutical markets.
Experience with key information resources (e.g., clinical trial and pipeline databases, sales/consumption data, physician audit databases).
Experience with real-world data (e.g., claims, EHR).
Experience in working with complex data sets.
Knowledge of market access and reimbursement issues in major and/or growth markets.
Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Subject matter expertise in one or more therapy areas, biosimilars and/or a complementary area of expertise (e.g., forecasting, drug development, medical writing) is desired but not essential.
Keen interest in becoming a subject matter expert.
Familiarity with clinical research, drug development, and/or commercialization processes.
Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
A flexible and collaborative approach to work.
Ability to manage competing priorities and meet project deadlines.
Ability to build relationships with global co-workers and clients.


What will you be doing in this role?


Build and apply an understanding of biosimilars drug development and commercialization, including the dynamics in different therapy.
Critically analyze clinical data and commercial information from several sources to evaluate market trends, assess opportunity, and build market forecasts.
Effectively and concisely communicate business insights through multiple formats (e.g., slide decks, live presentations).
Develop and maintain partnerships with clients; understand their needs and deliver solutions.
Manage the execution of multiple projects with minimal supervision.
Field client queries and ad hoc requests with minimal supervision.
Show a strong grasp of complex commercial issues in communication with clients and internal stakeholders.


About The Team


We are an international and diverse team of 30 analysts and managers located in Europe, India, and the US, making up the Biosimilars & Oncology therapy team.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive – excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
We have great benefits: 30 working days of vacations, Medical & Dental Insurance, Gym, Sodexo Card, etc
You’ll have 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time and the chance of being part of an active volunteering community which promotes diversity and inclusion across the business.


Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to the office in Barcelona 2-3 times per week.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our opportunity

Join a new team dedicated to Data and play a key role in delivering one of the key pillars of Zurich’s strategy: Main areas of focus include:


Workforce experience data governance and operating model
Connected data solutions
Support the enablement of a data driven culture


As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for making improvements on how best to gather, organize and maintain data. Your work will ensure that our leaders and internal customers are working with accurate data as efficiently as possible to help them make data-based decisions. As an SME you will lead the way in improving the maturity of the data and how it is being used across the organization.

Your role

As a Data Scientist/engineer your main responsibilities will involve:


Lead the planning, design, implementation, and maintenance of a new Data Management Solution
Work with multiple internal teams and external vendors to identify technical solutions to connect data and provide more meaningful insights
Manage the definition of metrics, data collection activities and visualization for a new KPI dashboard
Drive forward the identification of automation opportunities to help reduce effort associated with reporting and ensure data is providing value /useful insights
Collaborate with different parts of the organization to develop and implement solutions to improve data quality across Zurich
Review existing data sets and dashboards and put forward proposals that will result in improvements and efficiencies
Supervise and quality-assure the drafting of key data policy documents to ensure full compliance to the organization´s rules and regulations governing transactions
Help drive the adoption of a data driven culture through promoting the opportunities and benefits of using data
Support and work within the guidance from the Data Privacy, Risk, Compliance and Legal teams
Analyze key themes from a wide range of internal and external data sources in order to identify data industry developments and identify how different scenarios may impact upon the business and provide suitable recommendations.
Serve as technical expert in a specific process or product area, conducting process reviews and initiating change in order to contribute to continuous improvement of services to internal customers.
Provide specialist advice to address specific technical queries from internal clients and design/develop and deliver appropriate solutions, in line with Zurich´s policies and processes and regulatory requirements.
Put forward ideas to leverage the value of the data assets throughout the organization.
Be a Subject Matter Expert and upskill team members on data storage, quality, standardization, analytics, governance and reporting


Your Skills And Experience

As a Data Scientist/engineer your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


At least 5 years in Data Engineer role, ideally in large, complex organizations
SQL Server
PowerShell / Azure Automation
Graph API
Data Warehousing, Analysis, Modelling and Visualization
Unstructured Data
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Creative Problem Solving
Data Ethics and Data Privacy
Team player who is skilled at building up and managing stakeholder relationships
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Good project management and self-management skills
Highly organized, analytical and good attention to detail
Bachelor’s or master’s degree


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working:
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Santamaría Rodríguez Laura

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Job Purpose:


Responsible for the delivery and implementation of Business Intelligence strategy across multiple disciplines, utilising insight from internal and external commercial intelligence analysis to drive strategic activities in order to maximise profitable share growth for TD SYNNEX.


Responsibilities:


  • Execute tactical actions in line with Commercial Operations or Business Intelligence Strategy;
  • Work closely with various stakeholders to maximise share growth opportunities in vendors and customers for TD SYNNEX, for example:
  • Execution of TD SYNNEX Box Model;
  • Preparation and delivery of tactical activities to support share of wallet growth in customers.
  • Creation of financial and operational dashboards;
  • Monitor market developments, spot trends early and develop strategies to exploit identified opportunities;
  • Subject matter expert for SAP CRM, SAP Business Warehouse (reporting) and Business Intelligence matters;
  • Deliver training to new and existing users via multiple channels, in areas of subject matter expertise;
  • Maintain integrity of customer intelligence and master data;
  • Collate Intelligence and Financial data to propose and set sales and performance targets across the organisation;
  • Action any ad-hoc Commercial Operations or BI requests, and support projects/activities as appropriate.


Knowledge, Skills and Experience:


SOFT SKILLS:


  • Strongly analytical and numerate;
  • Excellent commercial acumen;
  • Lateral thinker/problem solver;
  • Excellent influencing & negotiating skills;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to work in a team environment and build effective relationships;
  • Ability to convert complex information into executable strategy;
  • Self-motivated;


TECHNICAL SKILLS:


  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills required:
  • VBA (Visual Basic) skills – ability to create macros and automate processes in Excel;
  • Excel: Competent use of external data sources, Pivot tables, v-lookups, Match and index functions;
  • Access Database (or similar, SQL etc) creation and development an advantage.
  • Experience with SAP R/3, SAP Business Explorer (Business Warehouse), SAP Analyser for Office etc, advantageous, but not essential.
  • Data visualization experience in Power BI or Tableau is mandatory.


What’s In It For You?


  • Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
  • Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
  • Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
  • Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
  • Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
  • Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.


At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Overview




PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change. Big-data and digital technologies are driving business transformation that is unlocking new capabilities and business innovations in areas like eCommerce, mobile experiences and IoT. The key to winning in these areas is being able to leverage enterprise data foundations built on PepsiCo’s global business scale to enable business insights, advanced analytics and new product development. PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team is tasked with the responsibility of developing quality data collection processes, maintaining the integrity of our data foundations and enabling business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.




What PepsiCo Data Management and Operations does:




Maintain a predictable, transparent, global operating rhythm that ensures always-on access to high-quality data for stakeholders across the company
Responsible for day-to-day data collection, transportation, maintenance/curation and access to the PepsiCo corporate data asset
Work cross-functionally across the enterprise to centralize data and standardize it for use by business, data science or other stakeholders
Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company




As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key technical expert developing and overseeing PepsiCo's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create a positive impact on the business. You'll be an empowered member of a team of data engineers who build data pipelines into various source systems, rest data on the PepsiCo Data Lake, and enable exploration and access for analytics, visualization, machine learning, and product development efforts across the company. As a member of the data engineering team, you will help lead the development of very large and complex data applications into public cloud environments directly impacting the design, architecture, and implementation of PepsiCo's flagship data products around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, and logistics. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and business users. You'll be working in a hybrid environment with in-house, on-premise data sources as well as cloud and remote systems.




Responsibilities




Key Accountabilities:




Active contributor to code development in projects and services.
Manage and scale data pipelines from internal and external data sources to support new product launches and drive data quality across data products.
Build and own the automation and monitoring frameworks that captures metrics and operational KPIs for data pipeline quality and performance.
Responsible for implementing best practices around systems integration, security, performance and data management.
Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
Collaborate with internal clients (data science and product teams) to drive solutioning and POC discussions.
Develop and optimize procedures to “productionalize” data science models.
Define and manage SLA’s for data products and processes running in production.
Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.
Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.




Qualifications




Qualifications:




2+ years of overall technology experience that includes at least 2+ years of hands-on software development, data engineering, and systems architecture.
2+ years of experience in SQL optimization and performance tuning, and development experience in programming languages like Python, PySpark, Scala etc.).
1+ years in cloud data engineering experience in Azure Certification is a plus.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building high-volume ETL/ELT pipelines.
Experience with data profiling and data quality tools like Apache Griffin, Deequ, and Great Expectations.
Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets.
Experience with running and scaling applications on the cloud infrastructure and containerized services like Kubernetes.
Experience with version control systems like Github and deployment & CI tools.
Experience with Statistical/ML techniques is a plus.
Experience with building solutions in the retail or in the supply chain space is a plus
Understanding of metadata management, data lineage, and data glossaries is a plus.
Working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps and DataOps concepts.
Familiarity with business intelligence tools (such as PowerBI).
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields.




Skills, Abilities, Knowledge:




Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with the ability to influence and demonstrate confidence in communications with senior level management.
Proven track record of leading, mentoring data teams.
Strong change manager. Comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. Able to lead a team effectively through times of change.
Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements.
High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously.
Positive and flexible attitude to enable adjusting to different needs in an ever-changing environment.
Strong leadership, organizational and interpersonal skills; comfortable managing trade-offs.
Foster a team culture of accountability, communication, and self-management.
Proactively drives impact and engagement while bringing others along.
Consistently attain/exceed individual and team goals
Ability to lead others without direct authority in a matrixed environment.




Differentiating Competencies Required:




Highly influential and having the ability to educate challenging stakeholders on the role of data and its purpose in the business.
Understands both the engineering and business side of the Data Products released.
Places the user in the center of decision making.
Teams up and collaborates for speed, agility, and innovation.
Experience with and embraces agile methodologies.
Strong negotiation and decision-making skill.
Experience managing and working with globally distributed teams.
Show more Show less
HTML:
Overview


PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change. Big-data and digital technologies are driving business transformation that is unlocking new capabilities and business innovations in areas like eCommerce, mobile experiences and IoT. The key to winning in these areas is being able to leverage enterprise data foundations built on PepsiCo’s global business scale to enable business insights, advanced analytics and new product development. PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team is tasked with the responsibility of developing quality data collection processes, maintaining the integrity of our data foundations and enabling business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.


What PepsiCo Data Management and Operations does:


  • Maintain a predictable, transparent, global operating rhythm that ensures always-on access to high-quality data for stakeholders across the company
  • Responsible for day-to-day data collection, transportation, maintenance/curation and access to the PepsiCo corporate data asset
  • Work cross-functionally across the enterprise to centralize data and standardize it for use by business, data science or other stakeholders
  • Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company


As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key technical expert developing and overseeing PepsiCo's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create a positive impact on the business. You'll be an empowered member of a team of data engineers who build data pipelines into various source systems, rest data on the PepsiCo Data Lake, and enable exploration and access for analytics, visualization, machine learning, and product development efforts across the company. As a member of the data engineering team, you will help lead the development of very large and complex data applications into public cloud environments directly impacting the design, architecture, and implementation of PepsiCo's flagship data products around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, and logistics. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and business users. You'll be working in a hybrid environment with in-house, on-premise data sources as well as cloud and remote systems.


Responsibilities


Key Accountabilities:


  • Active contributor to code development in projects and services.
  • Manage and scale data pipelines from internal and external data sources to support new product launches and drive data quality across data products.
  • Build and own the automation and monitoring frameworks that captures metrics and operational KPIs for data pipeline quality and performance.
  • Responsible for implementing best practices around systems integration, security, performance and data management.
  • Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
  • Collaborate with internal clients (data science and product teams) to drive solutioning and POC discussions.
  • Develop and optimize procedures to “productionalize” data science models.
  • Define and manage SLA’s for data products and processes running in production.
  • Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.
  • Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
  • Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
  • Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
  • Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.


Qualifications


Qualifications:


  • 2+ years of overall technology experience that includes at least 2+ years of hands-on software development, data engineering, and systems architecture.
  • 2+ years of experience in SQL optimization and performance tuning, and development experience in programming languages like Python, PySpark, Scala etc.).
  • 1+ years in cloud data engineering experience in Azure Certification is a plus.
  • Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building high-volume ETL/ELT pipelines.
  • Experience with data profiling and data quality tools like Apache Griffin, Deequ, and Great Expectations.
  • Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets.
  • Experience with running and scaling applications on the cloud infrastructure and containerized services like Kubernetes.
  • Experience with version control systems like Github and deployment & CI tools.
  • Experience with Statistical/ML techniques is a plus.
  • Experience with building solutions in the retail or in the supply chain space is a plus
  • Understanding of metadata management, data lineage, and data glossaries is a plus.
  • Working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps and DataOps concepts.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence tools (such as PowerBI).
  • BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields.


Skills, Abilities, Knowledge:


  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with the ability to influence and demonstrate confidence in communications with senior level management.
  • Proven track record of leading, mentoring data teams.
  • Strong change manager. Comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. Able to lead a team effectively through times of change.
  • Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements.
  • High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously.
  • Positive and flexible attitude to enable adjusting to different needs in an ever-changing environment.
  • Strong leadership, organizational and interpersonal skills; comfortable managing trade-offs.
  • Foster a team culture of accountability, communication, and self-management.
  • Proactively drives impact and engagement while bringing others along.
  • Consistently attain/exceed individual and team goals
  • Ability to lead others without direct authority in a matrixed environment.


Differentiating Competencies Required:


  • Highly influential and having the ability to educate challenging stakeholders on the role of data and its purpose in the business.
  • Understands both the engineering and business side of the Data Products released.
  • Places the user in the center of decision making.
  • Teams up and collaborates for speed, agility, and innovation.
  • Experience with and embraces agile methodologies.
  • Strong negotiation and decision-making skill.
  • Experience managing and working with globally distributed teams.

Title: Senior Reporting Data Analyst
Description:
Our opportunity

LiveWell by Zurich is a digital, health and wellbeing solution designed to engage and support corporates, employees and individuals on their health journey. We operate in global and local markets with the key mission of creating healthier, happier lives. Zurich LiveWell Services and Solutions Ltd (“Zurich LiveWell”) takes a holistic approach to health and wellbeing across physical, mental, financial and social health because all these areas need to be in balance to drive optimal performance.

Our aim is to empower individuals to own their total health and wellbeing through health education, best-practice prevention focused on lifestyle activities, goal setting, health challenges and responsive health services such as telemedicine.

Join our young and international “Reporting & Analytics” team to work in a dynamic start-up environment on exciting app data. The role is to develop new solutions (Reports, Analyses, Predictions,…) that generate actionable insights for the company as well as the users.

Your role

As a Senior Reporting Data Analyst your main responsibilities will involve:


Create impactful Reports and Analytics to support strategic executive decisions
Frame business questions with stakeholders to then design the best Analytics to answer those
Work on a consistent approach to measuring metrics/KPI across the business
Develop reports or analytics end to end including ETL jobs and dashboard visualization (AWS Glue, Python, PySpark, SQL, Power BI)
Collaborate with IT colleagues on functional aspects related to the data platforms, data sourcing and transformation (ETL) to build data foundation.
Work with a multi-disciplinary team including Product, Operations, IT to optimize and automate reporting and analytics products.
Implement and maintain master data management approaches, principles and processes.


Your Skills And Experience

As a Senior Reporting Data Analyst

your skills and qualifications will ideally include:

Technical Skills:


5+ years of relevant experience in data engineering, reporting or analytics roles with proven track record of delivering impactful results.
Extensive hands-on experience with at least one data engineering language (preferred Python, PySpark, SQL,…)
Extensive hands-on experience with at least one dashboard creation tool (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
Hands-on experience on a cloud platform (AWS, HANA, Azure, Google Cloud)


Other skills:


Ability to present complex information in a simple and engaging way, whilst making insightful recommendations.
Self-starter mindset to proactively identify opportunities and tackle them.
Customer-first attitude and willingness to go the extra mile in meeting customer needs
Clear passion for Health and Wellbeing services that improve people's lives, longevity, and health
Experience in one or more of the following areas is a plus: Firebase / App Navigation Analytics, digital marketing, behavioral science, Health / Wellbeing


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% counted monthly
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life and Health Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Work location is Barcelona, Poblenou . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 3.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 5,000+ merchants to give their customers magical shopping experiences.




Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #createmagic #staycurious #beimpactful #playasateam.




This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥




THE MISSION




Data-driven decisions are the centre of our efforts to automate processes and support decisions across the business.




As Data Engineer, your role will focus on developing distributed software for large-scale heterogeneous data processing, the development of ETL and reverse ETL pipeline.




You will be responsible for:




Data modelling
Data lineage
Data quality / Data observability
SLA, performance and scalability




You’ll be required to discuss requirements for data access and integrations with colleagues across the business, design solutions to the company’s problems and implement these using modern software processes in the cloud.




The role gives a large amount of autonomy and the chance to work with a top-notch team of experienced data experts.




Who we are looking for:




Strong Python and SQL experience
Experience building and deploying ETL pipelines
Experience with API integration
Ability to scope projects and decompose work into tasks
Familiarity with Linux-like development stacks, including Git, Kubernetes, etc
Familiarity with AWS infrastructure (such as S3, Athena, Glue, etc)
Knowledge of Data Modeling / Data Observability is a plus
Ability to engage with colleagues on business processes
A Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field




Why you should join Scalapay:




Attractive packages based on skills and experience
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role




Recruitment Process:




A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
The first interview with the Hiring Manager to deep dive into your experiences and better understand your motivation
A case study to test your hard skills
A Meet The Team session where you’ll get to meet different people at Scalapay and see if you’ll fit into our culture




_________________________________________________________________________




Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website and Careers website, and our LinkedIn, WTTJ, Meritocracy and Glassdoor pages.




Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉




Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.




We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer for Machine Learning
Description:
Si tienes habilidades y motivación en Data Engineering para machine learning, podrías ser la persona que estamos buscando para unirte a nuestro equipo. Con sede en Barcelona, serás responsable de diseñar, construir y mantener la infraestructura de datos de la empresa.

Desempeñarás un papel crítico en garantizar la precisión, confiabilidad y escalabilidad de nuestros sistemas de datos para el aprendizaje automático.




Responsabilidades

Diseñar, construir y mantener pipelines de datos para el procesamiento de datos a gran escala y el aprendizaje automático.
Implementar soluciones de almacenamiento de datos, como data warehousing, data lakes y bases de datos.
Desarrollar e implementar controles de calidad de datos para garantizar la precisión y completitud de los datos.
Colaborar con nuestros Machine Learning Engineers, Data Scientists y partes interesadas en el negocio para entender sus necesidades de datos y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos.
Realizar modelado de datos y diseño de arquitectura de datos.
Monitorear y optimizar el rendimiento del procesamiento de datos.
Mantenerse actualizado/a con las últimas tendencias y tecnologías de la industria en ingeniería de datos.




Conocimientos deseados

Experiencia con Scrum, GIT y herramientas de CI/CD
Experiencia con herramientas de orquestación de tareas como Airflow o Luigi
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación escrita y verbal en inglés (B2/C1) y español
Conocimientos de aprendizaje automático y visión por computador




Requisitos

2+ años de experiencia como ingeniero de datos.
Ingeniero Superior en Informática, Telecomunicaciones o similar.
Excelente dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python, C++, C# o SQL
Experiencia con tecnologías de data warehousing como BigQuery, Snowflake o Redshift
Experiencia con Google Cloud Platform, AWS o Azure
Fuerte comprensión de la modelización de datos, la arquitectura de datos, ETL y ELT y el procesamiento de datos




Tecnologías IMPRESCINDIBLES

Google Cloud - GCP - Google Cloud Platform
AWS
Python
SQL




Beneficios

Contrato indefinido
Jornada completa
Un salario competitivo.
Un ambiente de trabajo dinámico y de colaboración.
Oportunidad de carrera desafiante y gratificante.
Desarrollo personal y profesional en una empresa líder en inteligencia artificial.
Trabajo a tiempo completo con horarios de trabajo flexibles.
Días disponibles para trabajar desde casa.




Perfil deseado

Espíritu emprendedor, disposición para tomar riesgos y deseo de innovar y pensar fuera de lo convencional
Excelentes habilidades para resolver problemas y pensamiento crítico
Motivado y proactivo, con pasión por aprender y la determinación de mejorar continuamente tus habilidades.
Flexible y capaz de prosperar en un entorno en constante cambio
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Grupo Planeta

Somos el primer grupo editorial y de comunicación español, de capital familiar, que lidera una amplia oferta al servicio de la cultura, la formación, la información y el entretenimiento audiovisual, con presencia en más de 20 países, conectando con 25 millones de personas cada día. Todos los profesionales y empresas del Grupo Planeta compartimos unos principios que tienen como base las personas, la ética, la calidad y la excelencia en el trabajo.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Soporte de tareas en el departamento de Demand Planning & Distribution.
Extracción y tratamiento de datos desde diferentes orígenes: Qlik, Excel, SAP.
Diseño de dashboards de análisis para el equipo de Demand Planning & Distribution.
Elaboración de herramientas para la automatización de procesos para ganar en eficiencia.
Apoyo en la creación de ficheros recurrentes para el equipo de Distribution & Demand Planning.
Colaborar con los stakeholders para resolver problemas técnicos y relacionados con los datos.


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Buen ambiente de trabajo, donde aprender y formarte.
Beca remunerada.


Requisitos:

Requisitos

Estudios técnicos en Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Economía /ADE o similar. Formación específica en modelado de datos y data mining.
Conocimiento previo en algunos de los siguientes lenguajes de programación VBA, SQL, DAX y/o Python.
Experiencia en alguna de las siguientes aplicaciones: Excel, Access, Power Query, Qlik y/o SAP.
Interés por la tecnología, habilidades analíticas y numéricas.
Habilidades personales deseables: creatividad, curiosidad, trabajo en equipo y proactividad.
Posibilidad de realizar convenio con tu centro educativo por 6 meses.
Tener un nivel de inglés avanzado.
Tener disponibilidad desde las 9h hasta las 14h o 15h.
Show more Show less

Title: CONSULTOR BI – DATA ENGINEER
Description:
En VISEO buscamos incorporar un Data Engineer a nuestro Equipo de Expertos en Business Intelligence. Podrás desempeñar tareas a lo largo de todo el ciclo de vida del desarrollo, desde la toma de requisitos hasta la implementación y análisis/diseño de informes en la plataforma de Azure.




Alcance




Actualmente queremos incorporar un Consultor Data Engineer, con al menos 3 años de experiencia en toma de requerimientos y diseño de modelo de datos. Buscamos una persona proactiva, pasión a aprender nuevas tecnologías.




Tu rol:




Formarás parte de un equipo de expertos en BI, para participar en proyectos pioneros para nuestro cliente del sector aéreo, desarrollando tareas de análisis de datos, procesos ETL, desarrollo de proyectos BI y reporting.




Posible interlocutor con cliente interno, toma de requerimientos y dirección de proyectos/equipos (según capacidades del candidato).




Aplicación de metodologías agiles.




Procesamiento de datos de la compañía. Cruce de información interna y externa, ET'ls y proyectos internos de BI en tareas analíticas, mayoritariamente en entorno cloud orientadas a los departamentos de operaciones, finanzas, ventas, customer y marqueting. Gestión de la información histórica de la empresa, competencia, alianzas internas, reporting departamental y análisis predictivo.




Tu perfil:




Conocimientos de DWH MSFT
Desarrollos y metodologías AGILE.
Experiencia en DOWH Cloud, preferiblemente AWS
Conocimientos de PYTHON, SQL Server, Docker, Datalake
Desarrollos y optimización de consultas SQL (Nivel alto).
Experiencia en diseño de modelo de datos en cloud.




Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:




Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.

Title: Data Engineer (Python + AWS)
Description:
¡Hola!




Si eres un apasionado/a del mundo del dato y estás en busca de un reto en proyectos internacionales, ¡esta oferta es para ti!




En estos momentos estamos buscando incorporar al equipo un Data Engineer que realizará las siguientes funciones:




Desarrollar y comprender los procesos de negocio para su área funcional asignada / objetos de datos.
Creación y mantenimiento de programas de carga de datos.
Mantener documentación relacionada con la migración de datos.
Ejecución de cargas de datos.
Análisis de la calidad y mejora continua de los datos maestros.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos? 👀




Mínimo 4 años de experiencia proyectos similares.
Lenguaje de programación : Python con análisis y visualización de datos
Lenguaje de consulta : SQL, fundamentalmente con AWS Redshift como Datawarehouse.
Tecnologías de virtualización : Docker & Kuberntes.
Cloud: AWS (DynamoDB, Fargate, AWS Batch)




¿Desde dónde trabajarás? 📍




Híbrido. Presencialidad 1 día a la semana en las oficinas del cliente en Barcelona.




¿Qué implica formar parte de la #Familiaat? 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦




Plan de carrera 🏄 Tu crecimiento es el nuestro, por eso, todos nuestros profesionales tienen a su disposición procesos diseñados específicamente para sus funciones dentro de la compañía: modelo de competencias, evaluaciones, planes de formación y certificación, proyectos y eventos.




Retribución Flexible 💰Podrás optar por cheques restaurante, cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte, o seguro médico. Junto los beneficios y descuentos que te proponemos al unirte al Club de ventajas AT.




Conciliación vida familiar y laboral 💆Nos gusta que tengas equilibrio en tu vida personal y en tu carrera profesional, por lo que disfrutamos de 22 días de vacaciones + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre, además de opciones de teletrabajo, horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.




Formación continua 💻 como medio para conseguir el desarrollo personal y profesional de nuestros compañeros. Tendrás opciones para formarte en últimas tecnologías, inglés, competencias/habilidades. Además de nuestro programa de certificaciones oficiales y las licencias de Udemy Business.




Wellness 🔋Promovemos un estilo de vida saludable entre todos los que formamos atSistemas y, por eso, contamos con varias iniciativas que fomentan nuestra salud y bienestar. Nuestro equipo de People Care está siempre a tu disposición para que las experiencias en atSistemas sean humanas y lo más alegres posible.




Nos gusta celebrar los momentos especiales 🎉 Así que estate atento a lo largo del año porque recibirás alguna que otra sorpresa




Conviértete en Embajador AT 😎 a través del Friends Mood.




...¡entre otras muchas cosas!




Si tienes cualquier duda o quieres ampliar la información, no dudes en contactar con cualquiera de los compañeros de People & Talent.
