Title: Data Engineer
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Descripción del puesto:



¿Qué estamos buscando?



 



Actualmente tenemos un puesto vacante para un/a Big Data Engineer, con amplia experiencia trabajando con Spark y Scala. Buscamos una persona entusiasta y dinámica dispuesta a empezar y crecer en un entorno multicultural, retador y motivante.



   



 



Las principales funciones que llevarías a cabo con nosotros serían las siguientes, aunque dependerán de tu perfil y experiencia aportada:



 



Diseñar, desarrollar y testear soluciones data alineadas con las necesidades de negocio.
Investigar nuevas tecnologías y algoritmos de los que desarrollarás prototipos y PoC (Proof of Concept).
Trabajar en un equipo multidisciplinar, junto a Data Scientists, Software Architects y Developers.
Proporcionar, puntualmente, soporte técnico al departamento de ventas.
Desarrollar herramientas analíticas y programas.
Desarrollar y procesar sistemas de datos.
Desarrollar algoritmos y prototipos.

 



 



Requisitos deseados:



 



Licenciatura o Grado en Ingeniería de Software o similares.



Experiencia previa de 2/3 años en proyectos Big Data con con Hadoop, Scala, Spark.



Nivel de inglés alto, tanto hablado como escrito.



Conocimiento del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software (ingeniería data, desarrollo, testeo y despliegue de soluciones Data).



Experiencia en modelado y manipulación de datos.



Conocimiento en transformación de datos o ETL.



Certificaciones técnicas (Databricks, Cloudera, Confluent, GCP, Azure) es un plus.



 



Competencias personales:
 



Trabajo en equipo.



Habilidades de comunicación, favoreciendo dinámicas que permitan el flujo de conocimiento, con interés tanto en aprender como en enseñar.



Proactividad en la búsqueda de nuevas soluciones y mejoras.



 



 



 





Ofrecemos:



Qué ofrecemos:



 



Salario competitivo
Cheques comida y seguro de vida para todos los empleados
Posibilidad de trabajar desde casa
Plan de retribución flexible, acorde a tus necesidades (abono transporte, seguro médico, cheque guardería, formación)
Plan personalizado de desarrollo profesional y programa de formación
Cursos de inglés / alemán / español subvencionados
Horario de trabajo flexible y viernes jornada intensiva
Programa de mejora de la salud en el trabajo: eventos deportivos, fruta en la oficina
Cultura corporativa internacional
Descuento Gympass

 



En GFT consideramos que la diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares fundamentales y promovemos un entorno de trabajo inclusivo basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades a todas las personas sin tener en cuenta su raza, origen cultural, sexo, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, discapacidad o creencias religiosas.



 



¡Únete a nuestro equipo global!

Title: Finance Analyst Digital Analytics & Ops
Description:
Job Description

6000! That’s the number of associates in the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR). This division is the innovation engine of Novartis, focusing on powerful new technologies that have the potential to help produce therapeutic breakthroughs for patients.

The Finance Department at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR) is looking for an independent and pro-active Finance Analyst to transform the function to a future-proof business enabler.

NIBR Finance provides financial, administrative, and business services to support the leadership teams of a $3B research organization.

You will be part of a Finance team responsible to transform our operating model, with the focus to simplify and centralize activities, leverage digital technology and artificial intelligence to improve quality, deliver efficiency and superior value to the business.

You will serve as the key resource working closely with the Digital Finance Hub in Barcelona, the first center in Novartis focusing on financial problems using data science and AI.

This is a key role responsible for the ongoing operations, maintenance, performance, and availability of Finance Data, and will ensure the timely delivery of services to the NIBR Finance team to support financial planning and decision-making.

Your responsibilities include, but not limited to:

Your responsibilities will focus on two main workstreams: Digital Innovation and Operational Excellence.

Play a key role in supporting the timely delivery of



transformative projects related to the development of

Finance Data powerhouse

Translate business queries, such as optimization of



personnel cost planning and 3rd party spend, into

analytical problems and help build solutions using

visualization techniques, machine and deep

learning, and statistical modelling

Drive solutions for visualization, reporting and



dashboards; deliver monthly management reporting

based on data queries while transitioning to AI and

new platforms

Responsible for the end-to-end process



implementation of reporting needs involving diverse

data sources and environments such as BPC, Qlik,

SAC, etc.

Quickly learn and pilots the use of tools, data



sources and analytical techniques needed to answer

a wide range of critical business questions and to

improve status quo

Maintain the Finance Portal with all information



always updated, promote sharing of best practices

and knowledge to help improve efficiencies

Implement process improvements including change



management and communications strategies

Own the governance and management of relevant



reporting applications (e.g., SAC, I.AM, WebNIMS,

etc.)

Manage masterdata updates through EBX in line



with organizational and operational changes

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or



Business

2+ years of work experience in a relevant financial



business function and continuous improvement

areas

Strong analytical skills, solution-oriented, ability to



deal with complexity, pragmatic and agile

Passionate about digital transformation, experience



in predictive modelling and large data analysis is a

plus

Expertise in visualization tools like Qlik for crafting



insights

English fluency required spoken and written



Desirable: Regulatory affairs or quality control experience

You’ll receive:

Competitive salary, annual bonus, pension scheme, health insurance, flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, employee recognition scheme.

Why consider Novartis?

769 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2020. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Competitive salary, annual bonus, pension scheme, health insurance, flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, employee recognition scheme.

Why consider Novartis?

769 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2020. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Title: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Hyperion Materials & Technologies is looking for a

IT Business Systems Analyst

Hyperion Materials & Technologies is a full-line global supplier of innovative cemented carbide, diamond and cubic boron nitride solutions. We enable our customers to improve business performance with effective, wear-resistant tools, applications and components in hard and super-hard materials. We offer product solutions, unique services and application development expertise to meet our customers' competitive needs, and our global reach enables us to offer our customers local support.

The location of this position is in Barcelona (Martorelles) Hyperion site.

Job Summary

The IT Business Systems Analyst is responsible for ERP and integrated solutions Application Coordination. The responsibilities will be:

The operation of ERP is a 24/7/365 and require support and assisting our users in all time zones and all sites globally Support Cyber security incidents and problem processes.
Support business processes and ERP documentation
Support roll-out of global systems and tools, standards and business process
Continue to leverage improvement opportunities within the existing ERP solutions
Support implementation, development, enhancement, and usage of IT Security systems
Training of new and experienced ERP users
Key contact for third party development resources for assignment / tracking of change tickets
Coordinates with all areas of IT for a weekly IT Change Management meeting for approvals
Key contact for IT organization to get accurate updates on delivery status for change tickets assigned to consultants
Ability to travel occasionally

Your profile

We are looking for someone with:

· Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience.

· At least three years’ experience within the fields of IT business applications is preferred.

· Experience from working in projects and business understanding are preferred.

· Knowledge of ERP’s, Business Intelligence and CRM Systems is advantageous.

· Experience working in an international environment is advantageous

· ITIL Certifications would be an advantage

· Experience in working with IT applications life cycle

· Ability to work on your own initiative and with a proactive approach

· Proven self-management skills including managing your own learning.

· Fluent in English both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders, colleagues, employees and partners

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
The Power BI Developer and Designer will create, improve and manage our BI solutions that turn data into knowledge to help drive business insights and decision-making. The ideal candidate will have >3 years of experience in developing and designing Power BI solutions, excellent communication skills and a keen eye for outstanding graphical representations. Strong understanding of SQL and the ability to design and implement data models, visualizations, and reports in Power BI.



Detalles del cliente



Leading provider of economic intelligence via reports, data solutions and a subscriber portal. Our clients are senior executives and specialists in planning and finance at multinational companies, central banks and international organizations. We are looking for an experienced full-time Power BI Developer and Designer who will create the best possible client experience in a PBI embedded environment, by maxing out our subscriber platform in terms of usability, functionality and design.



Descripción de la oferta



Responsibilities:



Design and develop Power BI reports and dashboards that meet business requirements and user needs.
Maintain and optimize existing Power BI reports and dashboards, collect and test feedback.
Create and maintain data models using SQL to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval.
Support clients with Power BI, including solving problems and answering questions.
Assist to demos and clients calls and collect and/or transform client needs into insightful dashboards.
Help clients integrate data solutions into other BI tools such as Tableau.
Collaborate with sales team to create custom reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
Train and support team members in building dashboards.
Provide overview and documentation on standard and bespoke dashboards.

Perfil del candidato



Qualifications:



Degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, economics or related
Solid knowledge of economic data
ProvenknowledgeofPowerBI,including:
Data loading and modelling
DAX and Power Query
Power BI embedded

Oferta de empleo



Work flexibility (Remote)
Career progresion
International company
etc...

Title: Data Analyst, Partner Development – (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.




In this role you’ll get to




As a Data Analyst in the PD Analytics team, you will be using data and modeling techniques to identify opportunities and build models and tools to improve efficiency and effectiveness for Agoda’s supply team.




Key activities involved include but not limit to:




Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendations
Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization




What You’ll Need To Succeed




Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
3-6 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Title: Data Quality Engineer (m/f/d) (fully remote)
Description:
Fossil is on a mission to create great watches, jewelry, handbags, small leather goods and wearables by investing in technology and long-term value creation. We do this by living into our core values - Authenticity, Grit, Curiosity, Humor, and Impact - each and every day, continually powered by purpose and our people. We thrive on diversity, innovation, uniqueness, and inclusion.

Will you join us?




If you have a passion for data analysis and helping improve the quality of data that business users depend on to make decisions, then this may be the role for you. Working for a dynamic and global company, you will be supporting the Fossil Group Analytics team in their quest to be data driven and customer-centric.




You Will Be Expected To




Take responsibility for measuring and managing data quality for systems used throughout the enterprise
Champion data quality and data standardization best practices
Be a key part of the team that defines data management best practices and strategy
Educate the organization on existing data assets and how they can be used
Perform data exploration, analysis, and stewardship activities
Catalog new and existing data sources
Support data governance efforts to establish and enforce guidelines for data collection, integration, and data management
Collaborate with business users, IT staff and data scientists




Required Experience:




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related area
3+ years of experience and high level of SQL language proficiency
2+ years of experience in architecting, developing or QA database systems
2+ years of experience in data analysis with strong data quality background
Good understanding of extracting data from relational, dimensional database systems, CSV or XML files
Significant data analysis and DQ assessment experience
Experience using FTP, SFTP & SSH to move data between platforms
Demonstrated competence in multiple data analysis techniques and tools
Understanding of data protection and classification rules and methods
Analytical and naturally curious mind
Excellent communication skills, including written and verbal proficiency in English




Preferred:




Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related area will be highly valued
Experience working with multiple database platforms such as BigQuery, Netezza, DB2, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle
Experience working with Data Quality and/or Data Catalog tools like Informatica, Ataccama, etc. will be highly valued
Experience using APIs to pull data from various sources
Customer data analysis experience, especially retail
Hands-on experience with one or more common data integration tools such as DataStage, Informatica, Azure Data Factory, BODS, Alteryx or SAP PO
Experience visualizing data through tools like Tableau, Google DataStudio or Power BI
Experience using tools such as Postman, WS FTP, MOVEit
Python or similar programming language experience
Experience working with Agile and Waterfall methodologies
Experience with Salesforce products such as Commerce Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Service Cloud
Exposure to CDPs such as Segment or Amperity




Why Analytics at Fossil?




Come be part of a unique, creative fashion company, known for its style, friendliness, humor, and fun! Help lead the company’s transformation into a data driven modern retail and digital powerhouse. We are hiring the best analytical talent to transform the company from a traditional retailer to an omnichannel, insights driven company over the next 5 years. Top data scientists, digital analysts, data engineers and market researchers are coming together to produce insights that will transform the way people buy, sell, and make products. As part of the Global Analytics Team, you will work with some of the best minds in the business, recruited from the top universities in the world. You will sit at the intersection of technology and retail, bringing the two industries together with innovative solutions that work at scale. You will be inspired by experienced industry leaders and work on open-source platforms in the fast-paced, diverse environment that is Fossil. Our Analytics Team has won industry awards that recognize the cutting edge quality of our work from the American Marketing Association and the Association of National Advertisers.




At Fossil, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in all employment practices without regard to age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation.




Life is Short, Work Somewhere Awesome

Title: APPLIED INTELLIGENCE
Description:
Applied Intelligence

¿What’s APPLIED INTELLIGENCE & why to join?

Make your AI vision a reality by knowing where to start and how to scale. A strong strategy is key to making the right investments for transformation.

Applied Intelligence it’s our unique approach to combining AI with data, analytics and automation under a strategic vision to scale AI and transform business—across every function and process.

You’ll be part of a team, helping clients to understand how IA bring them to success in different areas:


Intelligent Automation: To help clients improve efficiency and productivity in many ways. Self-learning processes can help to empower employees, strengthen customer relationships and open new ways to innovate.


Artificial Intelligence: To take advantage of AI, you must move beyond proof of concept. Find out how to scale the impact of AI across your business for maximum value.


Data and Analytics: Imagine a steady stream of insights to fuel intelligent technologies; 360-degree customer views to boost relevance and revenue; or faster, smarter decisions to accelerate innovation.


IA And analytics solutions: Embed intelligence across business functions, from marketing and engagement to supply chain and more.


Requirements:


Higher Education related with data and analytics.


Advanced-Proficiency Level of English and Spanish will be mandatory.


What’s in it for you:

Join the Data Analytics Group for a challenging and rewarding career where the variety of opportunities and projects allows you to develop your potential and grow professionally every day. The only place where you can learn from our unrivalled experience, working alongside over 100 data scientists and Data Engineers, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics.

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!
Show more Show less
HTML:
Applied Intelligence

¿What’s APPLIED INTELLIGENCE & why to join?

Make your AI vision a reality by knowing where to start and how to scale. A strong strategy is key to making the right investments for transformation.

Applied Intelligence it’s our unique approach to combining AI with data, analytics and automation under a strategic vision to scale AI and transform business—across every function and process.

You’ll be part of a team, helping clients to understand how IA bring them to success in different areas:

  • Intelligent Automation: To help clients improve efficiency and productivity in many ways. Self-learning processes can help to empower employees, strengthen customer relationships and open new ways to innovate.

  • Artificial Intelligence: To take advantage of AI, you must move beyond proof of concept. Find out how to scale the impact of AI across your business for maximum value.

  • Data and Analytics: Imagine a steady stream of insights to fuel intelligent technologies; 360-degree customer views to boost relevance and revenue; or faster, smarter decisions to accelerate innovation.

  • IA And analytics solutions: Embed intelligence across business functions, from marketing and engagement to supply chain and more.

    • Requirements:

  • Higher Education related with data and analytics.

  • Advanced-Proficiency Level of English and Spanish will be mandatory.

    • What’s in it for you:

    Join the Data Analytics Group for a challenging and rewarding career where the variety of opportunities and projects allows you to develop your potential and grow professionally every day. The only place where you can learn from our unrivalled experience, working alongside over 100 data scientists and Data Engineers, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics.

    We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Conexus is proud to be partnering with a Global Chemicals company and we are looking for a highly motivated Data Center Engineer to join our team on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension based on project requirements.




Job Description




As a Data Center Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining the company's data center infrastructure, including Servers, storage systems, and network devices.
You will work closely with other members of the IT team to ensure the data center's availability, security, and performance.




Responsibilities




High expertise in data center devices and technologies
Deep knowledge of the hardware side (Servers) from the major vendors
Good technical skills datacenter management methodologies and best practice
Proactive approach to spotting problems, areas for improvement, and performance bottlenecks
Good leading/mentoring skills that motivate the teams you are leading
At least 5 years experience in Lead Technical Position
Strong infrastructure knowledge, including all the cross-domain knowledge
Documentation generation: Requirements, design, interface specification, test specifications
Effective influencing and negotiation skills in an environment
Excellent analytical, conceptual thinking, planning, and execution skills
Fluency in English (spoken and written)




Job Title: Data Center Engineer




Location: Barcelona, Spain




Duration: 6-month contract with the possibility of extension




On-site requirement: Only required for workshops




If you are a motivated and experienced Data Center Engineer looking for an exciting opportunity to work with a leading global chemicals company, this one's for you!




Apply here or contact me directly for more information.

Title: IT Business Analyst - Analytics & Audience Activation
Description:
Position Summary

The Analytics & Audience Activation Analyst will be integrated in the Global team responsible for the implementation of global digital media solutions and digital analytics strategy across the different Nestlé businesses and markets. Working closely with business teams and other IS/IT teams and solutions, will be responsible for enriching the data strategy of Nestlé. We are looking for a candidate who has hands-on expertize on Web Analytics and Insights, who is fully skilled in the Google toolset (Google Marketing Platform) and masters both technical and functional aspects of the products.

As part of the AdTech team you will be responsible for analyzing and refining business and functional requirements and later collaborating with team members to translate these digital requirements into meaningful processes and specifications and ensuring quality products. He/she will solicit requirements through interviews, workshops, and/or existing analytics, systems documentation or procedures, supports implementation team, and ensure functional documentation of the solutions.

As an Analyst you will be supporting the build and deploy of specific AdTech products by analyzing business needs, helping to define project scope and taking part in the implementation of digital packages with internal and external partners ensuring adherence with the architectures, solutions, tools and overall implementation framework.

A day in the life of...

Lead integrations of Google Analytics 360 and Google Analytics 4 with other Digital products used or developed by Nestlé as well as with other Google products (Search, Display, Video, BigQuery).
Gather and validate business requirements for analytics projects and solutions such as: Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio, Google Tag Manager and Google BigQuery.
Define Analytics architecture and implementation best practices.
Deliver consultancy services to our markets and brands on Web Analytics strategy and implementation for websites (WebCMS), eCommerce sites, mobile apps or Chatbots.
Ensure monitoring and control of Global GA and GTM Guidelines across all digital assets of the organization.
Support the design, build and deploy of IT solutions for AdTech at global level to ensure adoption and usage across Nestlé businesses and markets.
Challenges Business stakeholders into improving existing business processes through experience and monitoring of best practices.
Ensure project consistency and relevance by performing scoping assessments to determine feasibility of projects.
Responsible for the collection of Business requirements raised by stakeholders at Nestlé HQ and/or markets, and their analysis to produce functional specifications.
Responsible for the fit/gap analysis by performing system analysis.
Ensure that relevant stakeholders are involved in specification of new services and/or major upgrades to existing services.
Prepare and lead training activities for internal and external stakeholders. Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation (included users’ guidelines and training materials).
Build Strong awareness of latest industry trends to ensure the relevance of Digital Media solutions and active industry benchmarking.


What Will Make You Successful

Degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Digital Business or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience working with Google Analytics 360 and Google Tag Manager 360 and their APIs.
5+ years of experience in managing project in Digital media and analytics industry: Web analytics, Display or Search Media, Programmatic Media Buying (preferably on Demand side), Data Management Platforms (DMP)
Experience on analyzing and breaking down problems and information using structured frameworks and methodologies.
Analytical thinking abilities and client facing communication skills
Business focus ability.
Experience with Google Looker Studio, BigQuery and Power BI.
Curiosity to learn and power to adapt, a can-do attitude and receiver obsessed mindset
Ability to develop/maintain productive business relationships.
Excellent English written and oral communications skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Mobility: the position may involve international traveling.

The following experience will make you a more successful candidate:

3+ years of experience in a complex, matrix based international company, global environment and with virtual teams.
Experience with “AI for Marketing” leveraging Google Cloud’s BigQuery and ML components.
Experience with Google Tag Manager Server Side Tagging.
Post-degree in Digital Marketing
Experience with multi-source data integration projects.
Experience leveraging MS Sharepoint, MS Teams, JIRA and Confluence.


Benefits

An attractive and dynamic international working environment with the most talented and engaged IT professionals in their field and working with best-in class technologies

Be yourself @Nestlé, everyone else is taken! Our values are rooted in respect, we champion diversity and inclusion, and believe on the power of diversity to build winning teams where everyone can be the best version of themselves

Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset

Great benefits including competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits package

Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme, allowing everyone to meet their needs enjoying the advantages of remote work and combining with the amazing Nestlé facilities (dog friendly!) and culture.

Join Us!

We are Nestlé, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.
Show more Show less

Title: Global Senior Business Process and Data Analyst
Description:
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary

CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Finance Data Management group. We are looking for a global senior business process and data analyst to establish and evolve CHS enterprise data governance, master data management and data quality principles in our international locations. This position will partner with our businesses as well as data management analysts and stewards to ensure international master data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable. The ideal candidate will enjoy collaborating with other associates and team members and leverage strong communication skills. In addition, the ideal candidate will recommend improvements to international master data, processes, and systems.

This position will be based in our Barcelona office (on a hybrid basis) and may travel to enhance collaboration.

Responsibilities

As a lead work across a wide variety of business process and data management activities providing guidance, training and asssistance to more junior team members.
Analyze and evaluate current state work methods, procedures, controls, information and documentation systems. Conduct interviews to extract process knowledge and translate into process maps.
Analyze and resolve conflicts between business and process area data requirements.
Assess impact of process change requests to master data definition and existing system data.
Collaborate with business and technical subject matter experts to identify, analyze, and document data migration cleansing and transformation rules from legacy source systems. Collaborate with IT to resolve technical issues with data governance tools.
Design and maintain master data governance solutions aligned to the enterprise data governance strategy ensuring legal or regulatory data requirements are captured and adhered to in solution design.
Develop materials, conduct training and provide coaching to ensure staff across the company understand how to effectively use the process improvement methodology and tools.
Facilitate requirements gathering and analysis from process areas and business subject matter experts to translate in to process maps, master data definition, process maps and data governance processes.
Facilitate target system data migration requirements gathering from process areas and data governance.
Facilitate, support and train business subject matter experts on data migration validation procedures to meet target system design.
Lead change management process to ensure that updates are fully documented. Work closely with functional and business areas to ensure documented operational processes are understood and implemented consistently.
Identify critical success factors, metrics and KPIs in process analysis and design. Develop and track business process related metrics.
Investigate and resolve data incidents in a timely manner.
Perform other responsibilities as needed or assigned.


Minimum Qualifications (required)

High School diploma or GED
4+ years of experience in Information Technology and/or IT Business Systems


Additional Qualifications

Knowledge and direct application of data governance or data management practices including business process flow diagramming and updating business process user guides
Experience leading continuous improvement projects and tasks
Experience effectively using multiple ERP systems
Experience with business systems & applications to include prior direct work experience including analyzing and interpreting processes and resolving complex issues, developing, creating, and facilitating trainings to internal and external stakeholders
Proficient in MS Office Suite to include Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
Ability to multi-task, solve problems quickly and efficiently with little oversight, resolve conflicts by applying creative problem solving skills to mitigate disputes, and create and facilitate trainings to internal and external stakeholder
Bachelor's degree preferred in Information technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology Management, or related field
Show more Show less

Title: Digital Analyst (They/He/She)
Description:
Adsmurai, compañía tecnológica especializada en estrategia, optimización y automatización de campañas de marketing digital, escala el crecimiento real de las marcas, aunando el mejor talento y soluciones innovadoras.

Nacida con la visión de generar un impacto positivo en las personas a través de una mejor publicidad, dispone de sede en Barcelona y cuatro oficinas en todo el mundo, Adsmurai ha conseguido reunir desde 2014 a más de 300 expertos digitales, creativos y desarrolladores. Siendo una de las únicas compañías a nivel mundial con partnerships oficiales con Facebook, Instagram, Google Premium, Pinterest y TikTok (además de su colaboración con Linkedin, Snapchat y Twitter).



Tras la reciente adquisición de Zinkdo, consultoría y contenido orgánico, y la consolidación de los departamentos Search, Programática y Creatividad, Adsmurai se posiciona en 2023 como una fuerza líder en el mercado digital apostando por la diversificación de servicios full-funnel.
 



🔎 Estamos buscando un/a brillante Digital Analyst para formar parte de nuestro equipo.
 



🚀 Los retos de la posición son:




Seguimiento de los clientes y necesidades respecto a analítica y atribución.
Crear cuadros de mando e informes personalizados en función de los objetivos del cliente.
Identificar activos digitales y estructuras de páginas web que garanticen las mejores mediciones.
Crear/Definir modelos de atribución, embudos, cuadros de mando...
Realizar análisis de usabilidad en diferentes dispositivos (escritorio, tabletas, móviles).
Crear tests A/B y multivariantes para mejorar la tasa de conversión de una web en diferentes dispositivos.
Realizar mediciones cross-device.

 



💯 Eres tú si:




Tienes conocimiento de Google Analytics (o Adobe Analytics).
Tienes experiencia en proyectos de analítica y medición. Entiendes qué métricas son clave para conseguir información relevante que permita tomar decisiones de negocio relacionadas con datos.
Cuentas con experiencia previa en proyectos de data & CRO.
Has utilizado A/B Testing tools (Google Optimize, Optimizely…)






✨ Nice to have:




Conocimientos de Google Tag Manager (u otras herramientas como Tealium, Adobe Dynamic Tag Management, Segment…).
Nociones de Google Analytics 4.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (Looker Studio, DataStudio…).
Comprensión y gestión de diferentes modelos de atribución y de mediciones cross-device.
Experiencia en medición de aplicaciones.
Manejo de herramientas de gestión de cookies (CMPs como Cookiebot, OneTrust…).
Muy valorable conocimiento de tecnologías DMP y CDP.

 



🤙🏾 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.
Jornada intensiva los viernes y Agosto.
Flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Modelo híbrido oficina-remoto.
Crecimiento profesional a través de nuestro Plan de Carrera. Desde tu inicio tu Team Lead te guiará para potenciar tus Soft y Tech Skills.
23 días de vacaciones (+1 por año de antigüedad).
Día libre por tu cumpleaños.
Actividades de equipo y afterworks.
Formación activa.
Clases de inglés.
Acuerdos con gimnasios.
Plan de retribución flexible: seguro médico, ticket restaurante, transporte y/o guardería.

 



🍀 Estos son nuestros valores:




Make things happen: Aplicamos la razón en la toma de decisiones basándonos en datos. Gestionamos de principio a fin y orientándonos a resultados.
Walk, run, fly: Disparamos la proactividad ejecutando ideas. Nos marcamos metas ambiciosas, tenemos curiosidad y no tenemos miedo al fracaso.
Passionate players: Trabajamos con actitud positiva y ponemos pasión en todo lo que hacemos, con perseverancia y orgullo por nuestro trabajo.
Work together: Construimos relaciones de confianza basadas en la honestidad. Escuchamos, empatizamos y respetamos a las personas.






Nuestra cultura está en línea con los valores universales de libertad, cooperación y pasión por mejorar. Trabajamos cada día para que todo el mundo tenga las mismas oportunidades independientemente de su sexo, etnia, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, creencias políticas o religiosas y nunca aprobaremos ninguna acción discriminatoria.



Adsmurai nació en 2014 de una conversación entre amigos y tratamos de mantener y transmitir ese buen rollo y convertirlo en un pilar fundamental de nuestra cultura.



¿A qué estás esperando para unirte?



Show more Show less

  • Work together: Construimos relaciones de confianza basadas en la honestidad. Escuchamos, empatizamos y respetamos a las personas.




Nuestra cultura está en línea con los valores universales de libertad, cooperación y pasión por mejorar. Trabajamos cada día para que todo el mundo tenga las mismas oportunidades independientemente de su sexo, etnia, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, creencias políticas o religiosas y nunca aprobaremos ninguna acción discriminatoria.

Adsmurai nació en 2014 de una conversación entre amigos y tratamos de mantener y transmitir ese buen rollo y convertirlo en un pilar fundamental de nuestra cultura.

¿A qué estás esperando para unirte?

Title: AD, IT BP Intl' Data, Analytics & Insights
Description:
30108

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

Associate Director,

IT Business Partner International

Data, Analytics & Insights (Rare Disease Unit)

Location: Barcelona

This Is What You Will Do

The IT Business Partner, International Data, Analytics & Insights is responsible for Business engagement and IT alignment at global , regional and country/market level. She/he is responsible of Data, Analytics & Insights cross functional IT demand and delivery portfolio management, enabling strategic alignment, business growth and performance, leveraging the power of Data & Technology to generate business visibility and insights, support existing processes and ensure high level of adoption and prepare our region for next gen of Data solution (AI, ML, etc).. He/She act as interface between International Rare Disease business teams (regional & markets) , International IT business partners (with main focus on commercial, medical, digital & innovation) and our Global Data COEs spread cross geography (US, Ireland, Spain/Barcelona) . Strong understanding of Data EU regulation and compliance strongly recommended.

This role is located in our Alexion Barcelona Hub in Spain and reports to the Head of IT International Rare Disease Unit based in Zurich International HQ .

You Will Be Responsible For

Act as main IT point of contact for Rare Disease business for all Data, Analytics & insight related matters (roadmap, demand & delivery management, new capability, gap analysis & resolution etc)
Responsible for Business partnership & IT strategic alignment supportive of Business & IT/Data COEs objectives and priorities, road mapping, solution co-design, co-creation and delivery , and identifying opportunities to bring value to our business and patients leveraging Enterprise Technology, Digital & Data capability
Ensure IT solution and services are delivered on-time, effective, with high quality and adequately communicated and socialized for enhanced user experience and solution adoption. Lead our improvement effort, identify gaps, build action plan for resolution/enhancement, ensure high level of adoption cross our geography
Agile way of working , user experience and performance focused
Responsible for leading the translation of business requirements to functional and technical requirements, planning and project managing on execution, through sprint cadences and continuous development practices, in close collaboration business, IT organization and COEs, Privacy, quality & security etc groups.
Act as IT local escalation point, address employee service concerns and escalations from technology and process perspective, reroot to relative IT functions within IT RdU and/Or AZ IT technology services

You Will Need To Have

Fluent in English , Spanish is a strong plus
Experience leading Analytics groups / program supporting commercial, medical or R&D preferable in pharma environment
Bachelor / Master Degree
Demonstrated experience as Data SMEs /IT business analyst managing business engagement and relationship in data analytics and insights scope
Experiences in Project management
Experience in data integrations, data modelling, BI and data analytics and reporting (Qlik & Power BI preferred), exposure to data lake, Veeva CRM/SFDC, Query & Developpement (SQL, Python, ..)
Pharma & biotech experience preferred
Experience in advanced analytics, predictive analysis, AI/ML a strong plus for future internal opportunities
Strong analytical skills and business process oriented. Attention to detail and ability to think strategically and see the big picture. Communication efficient at all level of the organization
Innovative and autonomous leader. Strong team player, collaborator and networker
Ability to operate in matricial environment.
Role is office based

We Would Prefer For You To Have

10 years progressive similar experiences
Proven track record of delivering strategy and solution on Data analytics, insights , advanced analytics, - Gathering business requirement, building data roadmap. delivering on objectives and influencing key business stakeholders in matricial and pharma environment
SDLC , LMS, Project management/PMI demonstrated exposure and experience

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Accenture Cyber Threat Intelligence (ACTI)

ACTI is a global team that spans 13 countries and 4 continents and speaks more than 30 languages. We are passionate about delivering intelligence analysis, and providing industry-leading analytic insights, cyber context, and critical services our clients need to achieve their business-line and strategic-growth initiatives. We know success is only possible by developing and supporting our most-critical resources: our talented analysts, developers, and supporting team members. We value creativity and entrepreneurship in our team; where possible, we back staff initiatives with opportunities and investments. We strive to automate and innovate while working with powerful resources and vast data. Above all else, we value an egoless approach to guiding our clients as they navigate their businesses through all aspects of the cyber domain.

Who You Are

You are passionate about cybersecurity and intelligence analysis. You stay abreast of the latest threats, recognize the value of intelligence, and believe it should drive operations. You are a devoted team member who is always willing to lend a hand, mentor a colleague, or increase our global team’s awareness by sharing your knowledge and approaches with others. You are productive, easy to work with, and understand that adherence to a good process is key to excellence.

Role Description

As a Threat Intelligence Analyst, you will report to Europe’s Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Consulting Leads. You will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of the existing and prospective CTI consulting portfolio, such as threat assessments, attack surface assessments, industry threat landscape reports, and social media brand monitoring.

The role requires prior basic knowledge of open-source intelligence collection, and processing and analysis of multiple data sources, most of which are open source.

Key Responsibilities


Timely delivery of the CTI consulting portfolio adhering to the highest standard of quality


Collaborative production of threat assessment reports that highlight a company’s risk score based on an assessment of that company’s industry-based threat landscape and company-specific digital footprint


Production of ad-hoc cyber threat intelligence alerts and reports aimed at meeting client requirements


Deep dive analysis of threats faced by specific industry verticals in which Accenture operates


Contribution to the team’s overall delivery effectiveness and efficiency, such as by contributing to analyst workflow automation, trialing new tools, and improving existing delivery methodologies


Basic Qualifications


Degree or equivalent qualifications, preferably relating to politics, intelligence, or information security


Minimum 1 year of work experience involving analysis of information from disparate sources and synthesizing it into concise and actionable reports for a varied audience


Required Skills


Ability to work with geographically dispersed teams


Research skills


English language proficiency (both written and oral)


Strong writing skills


Strong analytical skills


Ability to learn quickly


Basic knowledge of threat intelligence and cyber defense concepts


Ability to work as part of a team and independently with minimal supervision


Experience in a similar role


Desired Skills


Knowledge of how to work on regulatory-driven engagements, such as CBEST and TIBER (Threat Intelligence-Based Ethical Red-teaming) engagements


Ability to conduct open-source intelligence collection and analysis


Ability to produce intelligence products for varied consumption levels (e.g., tactical, operational, strategic)


Basic knowledge of open-source tools, such as Shodan, Maltego, PassiveTotal


Working knowledge of frameworks and methodologies to quantify cyber risk (e.g., FAIR)


Non-English language skills (additional linguistic capabilities are a plus)


Working knowledge of common threat intelligence frameworks and methodologies to quantify cyber risk (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Killchain, FAIR)


Keen interest in cyber security as demonstrated by experience/training/education or extra-curricular pursuits


Understanding of geopolitical landscape and how real-world events and geopolitics influence cyber activity.


Basic technical skills, such as understanding of infrastructure enumeration


If you have any experience of or exposure to any of the following disciplines, please highlight them in your application and explain how these could be applied to the role.


International Relations, Politics, Criminology, English, Sociology


Research, journalism


Cyber security, Incident Response, Threat Intelligence, Penetration testing, Information security


Military intelligence

Title: Business Intelligence trainee
Description:
Únete a nuestro equipo como




Business Intelligence trainee




ESP-Mataró (Barcelona)




Aprovecha la nueva oportunidad que te ofrece HARTMANN en el Área de Business Intelligence.




Responsabilidades:




Como Business Intelligence Trainee darás apoyo a la función de BI y Data Analyst:
Análisis de datos de mercado para todas las categorías de Marketing
Experto e impulsor de la herramienta XL3 de gestión de datos de mercado para Marketing Out-Patient. Gestión del proveedor y del proyecto de despliegue: usuarios, formación y creación de dashboards estándares.
Comunicador de informes y tendencias de mercado provenientes de las fuentes de información tipo HMR, IQVIA, etc.
Punto de contacto con la función MRI del grupo HARTMANN (investigación y datos de mercado) para el proyecto de harmonización de datos de mercado entre países.
Análisis de la competencia.
Análisis y soporte en la construcción de inteligencia de negocio en In-Patient. Ej. proyecto gestión de datos Cooper y estimaciones de mercados.
Soporte en el proyecto Showroom (Gestión de Categorías en farmacias), gestión de la clasificación de farmacias (ABC) y calidad general de los datos en CRM (ej. mejora información Bricks en el sistema).
Soporte en los nuevos proyectos de Commercial Excellence incluyendo también: análisis de SFE (sales force effectiveness), proyecto Safari o MeetYou.
Parte Digital:
Apoyo con datos de mercado a la estrategia digital de las marcas
Soporte al proyecto de KPI Dashboard




¿Qué estamos buscando?




Buscamos una persona proactiva, organizada y con pasión por el trato con los clientes en un ambiente internacional y multicultural.
Deberás estar cursando un grado universitario en ADE, Marketing o similares así como un máster especializado.
Deberás tener un dominio de las herramientas Office (especialmente en Excel) y un nivel alto de inglés (advanced).
Se valorarán conocimientos en Power Query, Power Pivot así como en herramientas de Business Intelligence.
Es necesario poder establecer un convenio de colaboración por un mínimo de un año.




¿Estás preparado para formar parte de una compañía internacional con un posicionamiento clave en el mercado? Entonces anímate a seguir tu carrera profesional en HARTMANN. Nuestro mayor potencial es invertir en el desarrollo de nuestros colaboradores.




Departamento: Business Intelligence




Si estás interesado/a en la posición por favor es imprescindible que te registres previamente y nos hagas llegar tu CV a través de la opción de "Enviar Candidatura Ahora" que aparece más abajo.




Una vez registrado/a, podrás hacer llegar cualquier consulta sobre el perfil solicitado a Agostina Camarotti.




Correo electrónico: Agostina.Camarotti@hartmann.info

Title: Big Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Job Description

As a Data Engineering Senior Analyst at Avanade, you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You can collect, aggregate, and analyze structured/unstructured data from multiple internal and external sources and patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Your goal is to support the use of data-driven insights to help our clients achieve business outcomes and objectives. In this role, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics.

Day-to-day


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies
Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
Design and Build Data Service APIs.
Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
Expose data to end users using Python, Spark, Scala or any other modern visualization platform or experience.
Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.


Your technical and non-technical skills include :


Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.


About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .
Show more Show less

  • Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: BI Senior Consultant
Description:
🏢 ¿Buscas un nuevo reto con mejor salario y condiciones?



Si eres una persona con experiencia en BI con habilidades en liderazgo, análisis y planificación estatégica para diseñar y desarrollar soluciones, capaz de liderar proyectos y gestionar equipos en un entorno internacional,



Entonces...



💼 Esta oferta es para ti si...



Eres una persona con experiencia en BI, capaz de liderar proyectos y gestionar equipos.
Tienes habilidades analíticas y de planificación estratégica.
Tienes experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones de BI.
Eres capaz de colaborar con otros departamentos con orientación a cliente.


🚫 Esta oferta no es para ti si...



No tienes experiencia en consultoría de BI o liderazgo de proyectos.
No tienes habilidades sólidas de comunicación y presentación.
No tienes capacidad para influir y construir relaciones con personas internas y externas.
No tienes experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones de BI.

📈 Principales responsabilidades:



Diseñar, desarrollar y desplegar soluciones de BI con orientación a cliente.
Planificación de recursos y gestión de presupuestos.
Identificar oportunidades de mejora en los procesos existentes de BI y proporcionar recomendaciones para su optimización.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros departamentos para garantizar la satisfacción del cliente y la retención.
Identificar y proporcionar soluciones de análisis de datos para clientes, utilizando herramientas de automatización ETL de vanguardia.
Proporcionar informes regulares sobre el desempeño y la evolución del proyecto.





¿Nos conocemos y me explicas tu principal motivación al cambio?
